firstReview">      <div id="review_173429036" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/173429036" />    <a title="Lora" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4632071-lora"><img alt="Lora" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1305237530p2/4632071.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/173429036?book_show_action=false">Aug 20, 2015</a>      <a title="Lora" class="user" name="Lora" href="/user/show/4632071-lora">Lora</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780590353403" href="/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">anyone who is still waiting to read it</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Lora by: </span>      Tina, Morgan, my own curiosity  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=lib-read">lib-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=book-to-movie">book-to-movie</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=middle-grade-lit">middle-grade-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4632071-lora?shelf=surprised-me">surprised-me</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer173429036" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9371981851681000886">I'm going to keep this brief since there isn't much to say that hasn't already been said. *clears throat*<br />I think the reason I waited so long to read this series is because I just couldn't imagine myself enjoying reading about an eleven-year-old boy and his adventures at a school of wizardry. I thought it would be too juvenile for my taste. I was wrong, of course.<br />I can honestly say that I loved every minute of this. It's a spectacular little romp with funny, courageous, and endearing characters t</span>  <span id="freeText9371981851681000886" style="display:none">I'm going to keep this brief since there isn't much to say that hasn't already been said. *clears throat*<br />I think the reason I waited so long to read this series is because I just couldn't imagine myself enjoying reading about an eleven-year-old boy and his adventures at a school of wizardry. I thought it would be too juvenile for my taste. I was wrong, of course.<br />I can honestly say that I loved every minute of this. It's a spectacular little romp with funny, courageous, and endearing characters that you can't help but love.<br />It has talking chess pieces, singing hats, a giant three-headed dog named Fluffy, a hilarious giant with a dragon fetish, a master wizard that's just a little bit crazy, mail carrier owls, goblins running a bank, unicorns, centaurs(!), trolls . . . and probably much more that I'm forgetting. <br />And then there's the lead characters: Hermione, the young scholar who starts out prim and up-tight but soon becomes a true friend; Ron, the boy who has little money but who has an abundance of family and loyalty to his friends to make up for it; and then there's Harry, the boy who starts out sleeping in a closet and ends up being a hero. Harry is kind to those that deserve it, fearless when it counts the most, and wonderfully intelligent. What's not to love? <br /><br />In regards to the ending: <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I feel silly saying this about a middle grade novel, but I didn't suspect Quirrell a bit! If there were hints that he was the true culprit and not Snape, I obviously missed them. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />FAVORITE QUOTE: <i>"But from that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them."</i><br /><br />Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to start <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>.<br /><br />*******************************************************<br /><br /><b>My reviews of other titles in this series:</b><br /><br /><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/173434838">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a></span>  <a data-text-id="9371981851681000886" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review173429036">  <td itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/346176116" />    <a title="Khanh (the Grinch)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4527753-khanh-the-grinch"><img alt="Khanh (the Grinch)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1414813051p2/4527753.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/346176116?book_show_action=false">Jul 26, 2016</a>      <a title="Khanh (the Grinch)" class="user" name="Khanh (the Grinch)" href="/user/show/4527753-khanh-the-grinch">Khanh (the Grinch)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4527753-khanh-the-grinch?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer346176116" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3117271061571780937">Rereading for the 3rd time for the group read.<br><br>Once upon a time, there was a 10th grader named Khanh who didn't get along with people very well. She wasn't an outcast in school, and all the bullying and teasing stopped with the commencement of high school, but she had always been a bookworm and has generally preferred the company of her own thoughts.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1384328297i/6850034._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Lunchtime had always been dedicated not to eating, but to sitting in the library, browsing through books.<br><br>(Not to worry, she got her nutrition in 5th</span>  <span id="freeText3117271061571780937" style="display:none">Rereading for the 3rd time for the group read.<br><br>Once upon a time, there was a 10th grader named Khanh who didn't get along with people very well. She wasn't an outcast in school, and all the bullying and teasing stopped with the commencement of high school, but she had always been a bookworm and has generally preferred the company of her own thoughts.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1384328297i/6850034._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Lunchtime had always been dedicated not to eating, but to sitting in the library, browsing through books.<br><br>(Not to worry, she got her nutrition in 5th period in the form of a giant 6-inch M&M studded cookie and a package of Sour Patch Kids and/or a package of Reese's Pieces. Ah, the effortless metabolism of youth.)<br><br>One day, there were shiny new books on her school library's "New Releases" shelf. Harry Potter, books 1 through 3. She had heard of the books before, of course, since they were a constant presence on the NYT bestsellers list, but she had always avoided them, thinking of them as children's novels.<br><br>At the grand age of 14, surely she was too old for a little kid's fantasy novel. She had read the <i>Outlander</i> series earlier that year, after all. And it had sex in it. SEX! She didn't really quite understand everything in the book, but the point is, she had read them. Surely, at 14, Khanh was ready for more mature novels.<br><br>And that did not include Harry Potter. <b>Harry Potter is 11. Khanh is 14.</b> There is a vast difference in their ages. Khanh was a <i>teenager</i>, dammit.<br><br>But the Harry Potter books were new. Brand new. They were shiny, they had never been touched by another reader. And Khanh was tempted.<br><br>She picked up the first book in the series: <i>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</i>.<br><br>The end.<br><br><b>Or rather, the beginning.</b></span>  <a data-text-id="3117271061571780937" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2683062?shelf=5-star-excellent">5-star-excellent</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2683062?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2683062?shelf=read-in-2010">read-in-2010</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2683062?shelf=dearest-old-favourites">dearest-old-favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2683062?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer80615382" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12726126618478348968">My original review was a comparison of sorts between Harry Potter and Twilight. However, this is stupid as the two are incomparable. Honestly, its not even worth discussing. Its not just that Twilight doesn't come close, it is the fact that Harry Potter transcends other similar works. Its peerless. To quote Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction: It <i>"ain't the same fuckin' ballpark, it ain't the same league, it ain't even the same fuckin' sport." </i><br /><br />There was a day when I thought I needed to defend Harr</span>  <span id="freeText12726126618478348968" style="display:none">My original review was a comparison of sorts between Harry Potter and Twilight. However, this is stupid as the two are incomparable. Honestly, its not even worth discussing. Its not just that Twilight doesn't come close, it is the fact that Harry Potter transcends other similar works. Its peerless. To quote Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction: It <i>"ain't the same fuckin' ballpark, it ain't the same league, it ain't even the same fuckin' sport." </i><br /><br />There was a day when I thought I needed to defend Harry Potter, in the midst of the now dead Twilight craze, and you can see that below in what was my original review. It is a testament to the power of this series, that while various other franchises (Twilight, Hunger Games) have surged into popularity and then faded, Harry Potter remains unwaveringly strong after nineteen years. It is clear readers hold just as much admiration for these books as they always have. Time has not dimmed that.<br />I will, one day, write an essay about what these books mean to me. Eternal, this is the one that started it all. <br /><br /><i>Original review (circa 2010) </i><br />A note in regard to the on-going Potter vs Twilight debate: <br />Go ahed, tell me <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/41865.Twilight__Twilight___1_" title="Twilight (Twilight, #1) by Stephenie Meyer">Twilight</a> is better. <br />Tell me that James is scarier than Voldemort, <br />That the Cullens are a better family than the Weasly's <br />That Edward is cooler than Harry, <br />and Bella is smarter than Hermione. <br />Tell me that <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/941441.Stephenie_Meyer" title="Stephenie Meyer">Stephenie Meyer</a> is more talented than <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling">J.K. Rowling</a>. <br /><br />Go ahead, <br />I dare you. <br /><br />Those who think the topic of Harry Potter or Twilight is worth debating and arguing over, <br />are utterly stupid. <br /><br />Quite frankly-this book is amazing. </span>  <a data-text-id="12726126618478348968" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/108852775" />    <a title="Raeleen Lemay" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay"><img alt="Raeleen Lemay" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475215415p2/3452652.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/108852775?book_show_action=false">Dec 16, 2015</a>      <a title="Raeleen Lemay" class="user" name="Raeleen Lemay" href="/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay">Raeleen Lemay</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408845646" href="/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">EVERYONE</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=own">own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer108852775" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6551636883706902061"><i>Review for Illustrated Edition</i><br /><br />Perfect. Duh. <br /><br /><i> Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You</i><br /><br />OH LORDY. Every time I read this book it brings back so many memories, and also gets me excited to read the rest of the series again as well because there is so much foreshadowing!! <br /><br />For example:<br />-Sirius Black is casually mentioned in the first chapter<br />-Mrs. Figg is talked about a bit, as she looks after Harry from time to time (or all the time, ayyyy?)<br />-it always cracks me up when Hagrid says you'd have</span>  <span id="freeText6551636883706902061" style="display:none"><i>Review for Illustrated Edition</i><br /><br />Perfect. Duh. <br /><br /><i> Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You</i><br /><br />OH LORDY. Every time I read this book it brings back so many memories, and also gets me excited to read the rest of the series again as well because there is so much foreshadowing!! <br /><br />For example:<br />-Sirius Black is casually mentioned in the first chapter<br />-Mrs. Figg is talked about a bit, as she looks after Harry from time to time (or all the time, ayyyy?)<br />-it always cracks me up when Hagrid says you'd have to be mad to try and rob Gringotts... Damn crazy kids.<br /><br />Also here was a line in Dumbledore's chocolate frog card bio that said AND I QUOTE, "Professor Dumbledore enjoys chamber music and tenpin bowling." HAHAHAHA WHAT EVEN. NOW I'M IMAGINING HIM BOWLING DRAMATICALLY TO CHAMBER MUSIC.<br /><br />Rowling is the queen forever and always.<br /><br /><br /><br /><i>Re-Read in July 2012</i><br />GINNY'S FANGIRLING IN THIS BOOK IS JUST TOO GOOD.<br />Also, the Dursleys aren't as bad as people think they are, because after all, they DID pick Harry up at the end of the year rather than just abandoning him. So THAT'S worth something.<br />mmmm, this book smells so good. It's good to be back.</span>  <a data-text-id="6551636883706902061" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review108852775">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link108852775" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=108852775&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_108852775'><a id="like_count_review_108852775" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/108852775?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">465 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_108852775" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_108852775" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=465&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=108852775&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_108852775" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 108852775, true, &#39;&#39;); </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_86964275" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/86964275" />    <a title="K.D. Absolutely" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2156200-k-d-absolutely"><img alt="K.D. Absolutely" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471967140p2/2156200.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/86964275?book_show_action=false">Sep 06, 2014</a>      <a title="K.D. Absolutely" class="user" name="K.D. Absolutely" href="/user/show/2156200-k-d-absolutely">K.D. Absolutely</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to K.D. by: </span>      Purplycookie, Jzhun and Ruby  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2156200-k-d-absolutely?shelf=501">501</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2156200-k-d-absolutely?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer86964275" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13908868695059240124"><b>How can more than half of my Goodreads friends be wrong with this?</b><br /><br />I have to get this right. As of this writing, I have <b>98</b> Goodreads friends. <b>61 (62%)</b> of them have read J. K. Rowling's <i>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</i>. Out of those who read this, <b>39 (64%)</b> rated this with 5 stars. <b>11</b> of them with 4 stars. All the others gave 3 or 2. Only 2 rated this with 1 star. One of them admitted not being able to finish it. <s>She should not have rated it really since she did not read its entirety. (But she</s></span>  <span id="freeText13908868695059240124" style="display:none"><b>How can more than half of my Goodreads friends be wrong with this?</b><br /><br />I have to get this right. As of this writing, I have <b>98</b> Goodreads friends. <b>61 (62%)</b> of them have read J. K. Rowling's <i>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</i>. Out of those who read this, <b>39 (64%)</b> rated this with 5 stars. <b>11</b> of them with 4 stars. All the others gave 3 or 2. Only 2 rated this with 1 star. One of them admitted not being able to finish it. <s>She should not have rated it really since she did not read its entirety. (But she is my friend and it is her right, so why question?)</s><br /><br />When the book came out in 1998, I was not yet a bookworm so I brushed this aside. I read only those books that my brother told me to read. He was the bookworm but he would not be caught reading any book being pushed by media hype. However, when Warner Bros. released the film adaptation in 2001, my daughter was 6 years old and I thought that, since there was too much hype, the movie must be good and we would have a memorable time with our first ever father-daughter movie date. I was wrong. She not only got scared because of the darkness inside the movie house but she trembled with fear during the life-size human chess game, in that scene when Ron was sacrificed. We left the movie in that scene with my daughter crying and me cursing it: <i>  <b>I will never read Harry Potter</b></i>.<br /><br />My daughter is now 15 going 16. She is not fond of movies and she still does not show interest on reading Harry Potter. However, I am now a bookworm and the other week, I was with my 4 Goodreads friends and 3 of them raved (two of them, again) about Harry Potter books. Oh well, first-time fathers can make mistakes about first movie date with their daughters, Book 1 is included in 500 Must Read Books and the book must be a quick read. So the following day, I bought my copy.<br /><br />After 13 years of the book's existence and me ignoring it, did I finally make a good decision of reading it? Are all of those 39 friends of mine in Goodreads wrong in giving this 5 stars? Most of them did not bother writing a review. Maybe those would be too long or maybe they read this when they were not in Goodreads yet. But I am in Goodreads already so I can make this review long.<br /><br />These are what some of them say:<blockquote> <i><b>it was a great book <br />i enjoyed reading it</b></i></blockquote> For an eloquent reviewer, she must have been too happy to express herself. <blockquote> <i><b>Such a great story and creative way of writing. I love Harry Potter.</b> </i></blockquote> Yes, I agree about the story being great and J. K. Rowling being creative. <blockquote> <i><b>I was secretly wishing I was studying in Hogwarts too! It was silly, but I was simply enraptured by Harry Potter. Honestly, I still am :) It was a great book. I enjoyed reading it</b></i></blockquote> Coming from one of my favorite reviewers in Goodreads. I do not share her wanting to be a sorcerer though. <blockquote> <i><b>Honestly, I don't know anybody who'd refuse to even entertain the thought of attending a school for wizards.</b></i></blockquote> Another one of my favorite reviewers. That seems to have nailed this. Young people wanting to be in Hogwarts and study sorcery. That should be it! The world seems to be a dreadful place that we would all like to have powers to turn our enemies into frogs, pigs, ride on a broomstick and get the Snitch and earn points (money) for our family!<br /><br />Oh well, the Bible says that sorcery is Satan's work. The book even used the word Transfiguration as a subject in the sorcery school. Blasphemy.<br /><br />Just kidding. This is a work of fiction and I am not too old to appreciate it. I was just kidding. To be frank, I tried hard not to like this. I thought that giving this a 1 or 2 will freak out my friends and somehow get votes from those who are, up to now, ignoring this book. <i>I told you so! Why waste your time? </i>. However, unless you are a grumpy old man/woman, there is nothing not to like about this book. I maybe too old for it but hey, talent is talent and J. K. Rowling <i>has</i> it!<br /><br />My 39 friends are indeed right!</span>  <a data-text-id="13908868695059240124" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review86964275">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link86964275" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=86964275&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_86964275'><a id="like_count_review_86964275" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/86964275?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">320 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_86964275" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_86964275" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=320&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=86964275&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_86964275" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 86964275, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">112 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/86964275?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_86964275' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/86964275/comments?reverse=true">View all 112 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_159004115" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Camryn Doyle" href="/user/show/51517260-camryn-doyle"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assetsophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/51517260-camryn-doyle">Camryn Doyle</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer716926957042573470">I figure skate and one year when I was younger I skated to Harry Potter and I skated to it with my friends</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Nov 11, 2016 06:56AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_159027462" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Kelly ..." href="/user/show/1330063-kelly"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1217387294p1/1330063.jpg" alt="1330063" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/1330063-kelly">Kelly ...</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer17273241785854115956">Wonderful review -- it might be my favorite review of any book that I have ever read. Thank you. BTW -- I just read it two days ago for the first</span>  <span id="freeText17273241785854115956" style="display:none">Wonderful review -- it might be my favorite review of any book that I have ever read. Thank you. BTW -- I just read it two days ago for the first time. And I am almost done with book 2 right now.</span>  <a data-text-id="17273241785854115956" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Nov 11, 2016 09:03PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_86964275' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 86964275, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_46540413" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/46540413" />    <a title="Stephen" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1413439-stephen"><img alt="Stephen" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1311616811p2/1413439.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/46540413?book_show_action=false">Dec 04, 2013</a>      <a title="Stephen" class="user" name="Stephen" href="/user/show/1413439-stephen">Stephen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=potteresque">potteresque</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=1990-1999">1990-1999</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=comfort-food">comfort-food</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer46540413" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2203760265994864185">On my list of <b>reasons</b> why <b>my daughters</b> are the <b>bestest thing</b> to ever happen to me, <b>Number 14,577</b> is that they gave me, at <b>41 years old</b>, the perfect <b>excuse</b> to revisit the <b>Harry Potter</b> series. <br /><br />When my oldest angel told me she wanted to start reading the Harry Potter books, I couldnU+2019t have been happier. As I was collecting all seven volumes off the shelf to bring up to her room, I started feeling nostalgic for the whole Hogwarts gang, and I realized that IU+2019d never done more than a perfunctory revie</span>  <span id="freeText2203760265994864185" style="display:none">On my list of <b>reasons</b> why <b>my daughters</b> are the <b>bestest thing</b> to ever happen to me, <b>Number 14,577</b> is that they gave me, at <b>41 years old</b>, the perfect <b>excuse</b> to revisit the <b>Harry Potter</b> series. <br /><br />When my oldest angel told me she wanted to start reading the Harry Potter books, I couldnU+2019t have been happier. As I was collecting all seven volumes off the shelf to bring up to her room, I started feeling nostalgic for the whole Hogwarts gang, and I realized that IU+2019d never done more than a perfunctory review of this first volume. I figured it was high time to rectify that oversight.<br /><br />Harry deserves it. <br /><br />However, with over a million ratings, and almost two reviews for every day IU+2019ve been alive, I think I can dispense with any plot distillation or character profiles. It has all been eloquently said before. Therefore, I just want to briefly express what I see as the essential magic at the heart of the series, and why I think it has resonated so strongly with so many people. <br /><br />Here goes...<br /><br />Only rarely does a story come along that can so completely wrap you up in a warm blanket of contentment and good feelings. One that can hold at bay, even if only for precious moments, the nasty brutishness of what often passes for daily life. These stories do that. <br /><br />ItU+2019s an escape into a world of optimism, honor, and hope, where things always look hopeful and anything is possible. Who wouldn't want to hang around in a place like that, especially when it is decorated with sorting hats, kindly giants, magic wands and Quidditch.<br /><br />Granted...no aspect of the story is revolutionary, or even particularly noteworthy, from the standpoint of blazing new trails within the fantasy genre. It isnU+2019t great literature, and nothing about its technical merits makes it befitting of even a fraction of its unprecedented success. <br /><br />Fine...acknowledged. And? So what!<br /><br />The virtue of this story is the postive feelings it conjures in its readers. HarryU+2019s story is something that radiates acceptance, inclusion, and friendship. It invokes a sense of belonging. Inside these pages, you can find the impetus to see the better angels of humanityU+2019s nature, and feel just a little better about the world around you.<br /><br />How is that not worthy of praise?<br /><br />As for Harry himself, heU+2019s just a good kid. The quintessential everyman who makes good. A loving boy with a clear head on his shoulders and a caring heart that pumps affection for the world around him. HeU+2019s someone you canU+2019t help but like. <br /><br />HeU+2019s not perfect. He makes mistakes, heU+2019s occasionally short sighted, and I know many of us wish he would stick up for himself a little more. Maybe reduce his aunt and uncle to a pair of fatty stains on the carpet, or give Dudley an atomic wedgie until his skivvies scrape against his pancreas. <br /><br />But thatU+2019s not Harry. HeU+2019s a better person than that. ThatU+2019s why we love him. <br /><br />Maybe all of the above is a bit much. Like I said, I was feeling nostalgic and maybe the gush got a tad away from me. LetU+2019s just say that these stories are perfect comfort food and reading them will make you happy. <br /><br />IU+2019ll certainly settle for that. <br /><br />As for the rating, I Initially only gave this first volume 3 stars, and IU+2019m not going to change that now. As much as I love the series as a whole, I donU+2019t think it reaches stratospheric heights until <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>. <br /><br />Still, this is where it all began. As such, it should be read and savored knowing that it only gets better.<br /><br />3.0 stars. Highly Recommended. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="2203760265994864185" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review46540413">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link46540413" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=46540413&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_46540413'><a id="like_count_review_46540413" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/46540413?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">288 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_46540413" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_46540413" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=288&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=46540413&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_46540413" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 46540413, true, &#39;&#39;); class="section">      <div id="review_1053147591" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1053147591" />    <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey"><img alt="Mohammed Arabey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364338486p2/13592557.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1053147591?book_show_action=false">Nov 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="user" name="Mohammed Arabey" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey">Mohammed Arabey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855898" href="/book/show/21523103-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1053147591" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4563264466270173843"><b>It's Always Great, Coming back Home..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411256402i/11211677._SX540_.jpg" width="470" height="292" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>There's a reason us, the Fans, feel that we're connected, no matter where we from, different culture, ethics, ages..we're all like graduated from there..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411258362i/11211797._SX540_.jpg" width="470" height="305" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>..Hogwarts..we're even like in the same class, classmates, no matter which edition we read..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411257184i/11211711._SX540_.jpg" width="470" height="357" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>..Cause Harry Potter is not just a story..it's a Life..<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472432297ra/20192894.gif" width="470" height="264" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><blockquote>The Boy Who <s>Saved</s> Flourished the Book Industry</blockquote></b>It's really One of the most important novels in the modern history, Sorry, it's <b>The Most Important ONE.</b><br><i>This Review al</i></span>  <span id="freeText4563264466270173843" style="display:none"><b>It's Always Great, Coming back Home..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411256402i/11211677._SX540_.jpg" width="470" height="292" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>There's a reason us, the Fans, feel that we're connected, no matter where we from, different culture, ethics, ages..we're all like graduated from there..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411258362i/11211797._SX540_.jpg" width="470" height="305" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>..Hogwarts..we're even like in the same class, classmates, no matter which edition we read..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411257184i/11211711._SX540_.jpg" width="470" height="357" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>..Cause Harry Potter is not just a story..it's a Life..<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472432297ra/20192894.gif" width="470" height="264" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><blockquote>The Boy Who <s>Saved</s> Flourished the Book Industry</blockquote></b>It's really One of the most important novels in the modern history, Sorry, it's <b>The Most Important ONE.</b><br><i>This Review also for those who hate the series !<br>Please bear with me..</i><br>Without it,most of the Book stores and publishers may have the same fate of the Video stores Blockbuster LLC, which despite being super popular in the 90s, closed all the stores by 2013 ,shutting down forever.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411425655i/11225976._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="250" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Yes, without this novel, and with the rapid change in technology, the ease of making e-books and reading it in PCs, Smartphones,Tablets ,etc, the publishing and trade of new paper books may decrease rapidly.<br> It'd be limited for religious or some educating books, classic and small novels., even these kinds of books goes just electronicU+2026. and the books be just like an old Video Tape.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411427520i/11226186._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="250" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>A Dystopia ,right? very gloomy idea to the world without This novel,<b> The One.</b><br><br>Well, in the case you think I'm exaggerate..Let's have<br><b><br>A <i>Brief !!!</i> History of Literature in the 90s<br>------------------------------------------</b><br><br>Well, letU+2019s back to the early 90s , where TV is in every house,even in every room ,Video sets are there too, rental video stores everywhere and satellite receivers and cable channels growing fast, with many channels for kids and teenagers making them attached more and more into screens, not to mention Video Games, Game boy and NintendoU+2026 <br><br>Those from this new generation who read are U+201Cweirdos" or "nerdsU+201D to the rest of their peers.<br>And for those U+201Cfew who readU+201D book stores mostly got for them just comics and graphic novels, which most of them created early this century.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411429565i/11226560._SY540_.jpg" width="400" height="400" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>The classic novels they read just for schools and education, otherwise they merely know the movies that based on.<br>The new novels that make a best seller are the ones which made ,or will be made, into movies for Julia Roberts, Tom Cruse or any of the 90s Hollywood celebrity , or the ones by Stephen King because ,of course, will be made into movies too.<br><br>Even these novels didn't live up the selling numbers of Tolkien, Charles Dickens, Agatha Christie -whatU+2019s with the British authors and selling numbers :)?- also in Russia no more Dostoevsky and Tolstoy , no more Hugo in France.<br>Also in <b>Egypt</b> no more like Naguib Mahfouz and the great authors of the 50s to 70s...No new big hit for novels, most of the selling books are those of Speculation about strange and mysterious things in the world or in religion,Dreams explications , cocking books or just celebrities rumors.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411582524i/11251816._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="390" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>While in US and UK it selling books mostly the self help books, or those which teach how to make Computers programs or even web sites -this brand new huge technology leap back then.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584118i/11252020._SX540_.jpg" width="401" height="174" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>No new novels to attract the new generation of kids and teenagers, just some few successful highlights like R.L.StineU+2019s Goosepumbs in 1992 which make a very good success, and translated in many countries including Egypt.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584118i/11252021._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="188" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And in Egypt thereU+2019s also a very successful project made by The Modern Arabic Institution for Publishing & Distribution which made U+201CPocket NovelsU+201D for youth , by brilliant Egyptian writers,who presented excellent variety of novels of many genres, Sci-Fi, Action Thriller, comics, Romance .etc.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584118i/11252022._SX540_.jpg" width="401" height="274" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>ThereU+2019s also U+201CReading for AllU+201D,project by the first lady U+201CSusan MubarakU+201D which printed a huge verity of important books and novels from all over the world in very cheap prices.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411584576i/11252145._SX540_.jpg" width="401" height="274" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>But all these effort didn't attract U+201Cmore and moreU+201D of new youth readers ,it just made more and more books for those few who already reads.<br><br>The vast numbers of those who donU+2019t just read will increase if there isn't a big new attractive reading experience to get them into reading, specially with the more channels, more movies.<br>But the BIGGEST Obstacle for them to read came out in <b>1994<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411611859i/11255857._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="220" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br></b>and became a real phenomenon by 1995...itU+2019s the <b>Playstation </b>, the giant Japanese gaming leap..<br>Football, Crash , Pepsi man, and the comics heroes also have their games , so why reading Superman , BatmanU+2019s comics when you can play them....<br><br><br>*************************************************<br>*************************************************<br>So by 1996,with this growing leap in Gaming, as also the Computer 3D games getting even much improves, Books get replaced bit by bit by a gaming controls.<br><br>So do you think itU+2019s wise for publishers to publish a book for new writer?<br><br>Of course not, it may even cover itU+2019s publishing cost.<br><br>So it was very normal when in this year, 1996, when <b>Joanne</b>, a 31 years old lady from England , handed the manuscript for her first novel to 12 publishing houses, all of them rejected it...<br><br>A manuscript of over 200 pages of a novel, that she had hard times in her personal and professional life while writing it, and for children??? Seriously is there still any who still read? itU+2019s 1996, the era of Playstation and Video Games.<br><br>But then, the Modest<b> U+201CBloomsburyU+201C</b> agreed to publish it ,with 2 advises for her, first that sheU+2019d get a day job, since itU+2019s a little chance of making money in children's books. - later she received a grant from the Scottish Arts Council to help her continuing writing.-<br>But the significant advice was to change her pen name cause young boys might not want to read a book written by a woman..so with her name and her grandmotherU+2019s "Kathleen" come the 2 initial of her pen nameU+2026<br><b><blockquote>J . k . Rowling</blockquote> </b><br>And in <b>26th June 1997</b> ,with 1,000 copies, 500 of which were distributed to libraries..come out in UK, to our world The Greatest<br><blockquote> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411626851i/11258422._SY540_.jpg" width="333" height="720" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><b><br>Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</b></blockquote><br>And Baam , everything happened so fast..<br>Before the end of this year the novel awarded many important litural awards in the UK, an American important publisher , Scholastic , won the rights to publish the novel in US, with a huge check Rowling would never dreams of.<br><br>Just with small change, The title changes from Philosopher's Stone to the Sorcerer's Stone , as the American publisher saw that Philosopher's may not be that attractive to young readers..<br>And Thanks to Harry Potter ,now Every young readers know much more about Philosopher's Stone from their other reads.<br><br>In 1998 Book 2 released in UK ,1999 in US, winning more literary prizes. Becoming a Top Selling books in UK, US and many other countries which start to publish the translation for the first book.<br><blockquote>  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411667189i/11263200.jpg" width="363" height="280" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></blockquote><br>And on 8 July 1999, The <b>First Breaking Record</b> made when Book 3 sold 68.000 copies in just three days after its release in the United Kingdom..and more copies when it released late 1999 in US..<br><br>With the fast growing popularity of Harry Potter among readers , more records had been broken both in UK and US....<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411659710i/11262277._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br> The 3 books takeover the top spot in the charts of best selling books for weeks and months, and it was still the hardcover editions.<br>This conquer made some literary magazines and newspapers separate the Harry Potter books selling records from the rest of the top selling books, splitting its lists into children Books and adult books sections under pressure from other publishers who were eager to see their books given higher ranking. <br><br><b>And then it was year 2000 , where everything is about to change .... forever..</b><br>The Playstation 2 is out there, and even higher leap in Computer Games..<br>But even with this much of temptations, thousands of children, teens and parents gathered in the midnight of 8 July 2000 in UK and US at the same day in front of stores, not electronic stores or Apple stores -as theses days- , it was Bookstores, for may be the first time in the Book Stores History , to buy a copy of ...<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411670472i/11263478._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="260" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b> Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</b><br>And They didn't mind to find out that the book is over 700 page, it was even for their pleasure, more than double the size of any of the first 3 novels..double the thriller, double the fun..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411670796i/11263575._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="260" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Over 3 million copies sold at that day only in the US , a new world record...a totally unexpected one.<br><br>huge story, bigger plot , mysterious and very well written. <br>more literate prizes for Rowling... more translated editions to more than 40 language. <br><br>And huge budget for the upcoming first movie of the series, which beautifully visualize the magic of the novel by the faithful producers and the director...and it also made some records , but that's not our subject now. <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270149.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>******************************************<br>******************************************<br>By the announcement of pushing the publishing date of book 5 to mid 2003 , and even by 2 movies out so far, the hunger for reading Harry Potter kept on.. <br><br>Also , as more readers start to increase into this generation, Publishers and book stores start to promote for more books for those readers who are hungry for more..<br>Older fantasy books , like Lord of the Rings -which was a super successful movie by then too- Narnia , Golden Compass and many other novels which finally getting more reprinted editions...and so Book stores to get more and more readers.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270150._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="224" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>More countries welcomed the Harry Potter phenomenon.. The English edition AND the local translated ones ,both been sold everywhere worldwide.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270151._SX540_.png" width="400" height="186" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br> Even in <b>Egypt</b> English edition sold at many books stores and,hopefully some new book stores specialized in English novels start to open in Cairo and Alexandria by 2002-2003..<br><br>and finally in summer 2002, Nahdet Masr for publishing and distribution got the rights and published the Arabic edition, although it cut some of the lines for the length issues, fearing it may won't attract more readers , but the edition still hold the magic of it..making a very good sales.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411758298i/11270181.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><blockquote>****************</blockquote><br>The good news is,the literary movement didn't stop there, more new books come out for the increasing demand from the readers..<br><br><b>Life of Pi</b> , the 2002 man Booker winner make very good sales numbers by.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411757596i/11270152._SX540_.jpg" width="401" height="200" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And in April 2003 Dan Brown (previously published 3 novels, making good sales) released a novel that made huge fuss around and making a new sales records , <b>The Da Vinci Code</b>.. <br>The funny thing that there's a reference in this novel that Harry Potter is the second most selling book in history after the Bible..., a speculation that happens to be true in less than 5 years after that. <br><br>A month later,May 2003, Khaled Hosseini released his first novel -do you think publishers would agree if there's no Harry Potter before? ,He'd may be rejected by 12 publishers like you know who :)- , <b>The Kate Runner </b>which also made a very good records too.<br><br>And that's didn't affect the main reason for this new 'literal renaissance'.<br>All that didn't affect the Records Breaker to break records one month later..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411758082i/11270171._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="290" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>On 20 June 2003 book 5<b> 'Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix'</b> comes out , ten thousands of all ages conquer the book stores in UK, US and other countries too to get the one they been waiting for at least 2 years... shipping agents like FedEx made the delivery to many countries to get the book at the same time.<br><br><b>A New world Record </b>,5 millions copy at the first day only..<br>For the first time in France a non french language book placed in no.1 of the bestselling book....<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411758082i/11270172._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="220" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Some kids got a headache called 'Harry Potter Headache' as they read the whole 850 pages of the book five, the biggest so far, at the same day without resting.<br><br>And in <b>Egypt</b>, in September the same year, the Arabic edition of book three comes out with unexpected sales records, first edition run out of the stores by the first week only although it's nearly the beginning of the School year, and the movie of this 3rd book still filming. <br>U+0650And the price of the book get higher 20% in 2 days and still with increasing demand..<br><br>More English books and novels sold in Egypt too, along with the Arabic ones, publishing more books for new Egyptian writers along with more of the famous ones , Alaa El Aswany's first novel 'Yaqubean's Building' makes very good selling numbers..<br><blockquote>  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411759045i/11270248._SY540_.gif" width="300" height="420" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></blockquote><br>2004 the Arabic edition of Book Four makes a price war between book stores and magazines stands.<br><br>January 2005 , an abridged translated edition of Book Five make many readers angry in Egypt , specially that many already read the English edition before, so the publisher release an unabridged one by May.<br><br>And in the same year's summer, on 21 July, <b>A higher record </b>that breaks all the previously ones<br><blockquote>  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411759919i/11270289.jpg" width="344" height="500" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></blockquote><br> 6.9 million copy of book 6 sold in US in its first day... A huge book, may didn't fans' expectations of being full of action , but it get a twist that blow minds about one of the most interesting characters, <b>Professor Snape.</b>That made many fans and even big authors like Stephen King and Salman Rushdie talk about for months..<br><blockquote>****************</blockquote><br>The pre-final book followed by a massive variety of new novels, new authors....Twilight series, Percy Jackson series, and more new novels, more books sales not only in US, UK but worldwide...<br><br>But still Potter is the Records Big Breaker...<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273744._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="266" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br> At the midnight before 21 June 2007, everywhere around the globe the scene of thousands of people lining in front of book stores was repeated...even bigger than any time before..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273745.jpg" width="400" height="251" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br> A huge record for pre-orders online reach to one million copies by Amazon, and total sales of <b>11 millions copies in UK and US in the first day only.</b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273746._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="251" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>The book sold at the same day almost in every country,even in Israel which made a big religious fuss about the book stores being open in their holy Saturday, But it's Harry Potter after all, the world's most unusual, unexpected phenomenon and sales records breaker.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411781936i/11273747.jpg" width="400" height="289" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And that's not bad, it was the Miracle of bringing back readers to book stores, thousands of topics went online asking 'what to read next'....<br>Indeed, although there's the ebooks, ereaders , etc , still there's thousands of new books and novels published and sold every year , in every where in the world.<br>The gaming devices is increasing yes, not as expected though by the 90s and early 2000s "remember Nokia N-Gage"- but so do the reading devices which first come out by Sony in 2004,make big step by Amazon's Kindle in 2007...the ebook applications on every device.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411835645i/11285409._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="218" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>New books and series come after that , and still on, making super sales, attracting more readers... more writers come with more books and novels, some are just a rip off others and some are really original and brilliant. in UK, US , Egypt ..ever where all over the globe..<br><br>No matter a Playstation 4 is out, or new xbox, the books still there...with its most beloved magic..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411835645i/11285410.jpg" width="400" height="218" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>The magic of books is back and , I believe, to stay..<br><br>Don't you see with me that the magic of Harry Potter is one of the main factors of this magic?<br><blockquote>  <b><br>U+201CThis boy will be famous. There wonU+2019t be a child in our world who doesnU+2019t know his nameU+201D</b>  <br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411836005i/11285585.jpg" width="365" height="238" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></blockquote><br>That's what Rowling wrote at the very early pages of her first book..The one that rejected by 12 Publishing Houses in 1996...<br><br>Well, what about now?<br><br><br>God, Talked too much in the "Brief" introduction , didn't I?<br>Well, that's it for this review... I guess some still think it's just the Propaganda that made that all....Well I'll try to prove them worng by the upcoming next 6 reviews at the other 6 Books of the series..<br>Links will be here as soon as it'd done .. <a href="http://www.khassab.netews/?p=3444" rel="nofollow">U+0648 U+0644 U+0644 U+0645 U+0642 U+0627 U+0644 U+0627 U+062A U+0627 U+0644 U+0639 U+0631 U+0628 U+064A U+0629 U+0627 U+064A U+0636 U+0627<br></a> <br><br>Now I'll be back to go around Hogwarts.....<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411082784i/11192136._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="273" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>For the Zillionth time I guess..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1411082784i/11192137._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="197" alt="0" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Hope to see you there too, come on and try first year :)<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380396313i/763769.jpg" width="395" height="315" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>From Hogwarts<br><br>Mohammed Arabey<br>The Craziest Potterhead of Egypt<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1381936688i/5444084.jpg" width="401" height="217" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Re-reading the new edition -Guess I'm addicted to new editions BUT this one really rocks.."Bloomsbury-2014"<br>from 12 Sep. 2014<br>till 23 Sep. 2014<br></span>  <a data-text-id="4563264466270173843" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1053147591">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1053147591" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=1053147591&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1053147591'><a id="like_count_review_1053147591" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1053147591?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">239 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1053147591" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1053147591" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=239&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1053147591&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1053147591" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1053147591, true, &#39;&#39;); id="review_882178969" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/882178969" />    <a title="Bookworm Sean" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27788046-bookworm-sean"><img alt="Bookworm Sean" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457171461p2/27788046.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/882178969?book_show_action=false">Oct 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Bookworm Sean" class="user" name="Bookworm Sean" href="/user/show/27788046-bookworm-sean">Bookworm Sean</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27788046-bookworm-sean?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27788046-bookworm-sean?shelf=children-of-all-ages">children-of-all-ages</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27788046-bookworm-sean?shelf=5-star-reads">5-star-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer882178969" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer430553746509863766">Here are three reasons why Harry Potter rocks my socks:<br><br><b>1.A Better World</b><br><br>One of the main reasons <i>Harry Potter</i> is so wonderful is because Rowling shows you a boring world; it is the world of reality, dry, boring and ordinary. Then under it she reveals fantasy; she reveals everything a reader longs for: she reveals pure escapism. I still want to go to Hogwarts. I always will. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475396409ra/20716497.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>2. WeU+2019re all a bit like Harry</b><br><br>Okay so not many of us are orphans, and not many of us are practically abused in their own homes</span>  <span id="freeText430553746509863766" style="display:none">Here are three reasons why Harry Potter rocks my socks:<br><br><b>1.A Better World</b><br><br>One of the main reasons <i>Harry Potter</i> is so wonderful is because Rowling shows you a boring world; it is the world of reality, dry, boring and ordinary. Then under it she reveals fantasy; she reveals everything a reader longs for: she reveals pure escapism. I still want to go to Hogwarts. I always will. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475396409ra/20716497.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>2. WeU+2019re all a bit like Harry</b><br><br>Okay so not many of us are orphans, and not many of us are practically abused in their own homes, but a lot of us feel isolated in the world, a lot of us wish for a fantastic group of friends as a child. I know I did, and this again leads back to my first point. Not everyone finds a Ron and Hermione.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1475396409i/20716498.jpg" width="400" height="175" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>3. The magic</b><br><br>Seems a bit of an obvious point doesnU+2019t it? But, seriously, not many books have such a well-developed system. We have different categories, spell names, potions and books, lots of books on magic. And who doesnU+2019t like books on magic? <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1475396409ra/20716499.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br></span>  <a data-text-id="430553746509863766" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review882178969">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link882178969" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=882178969&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_882178969'><a id="like_count_review_882178969" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/882178969?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">216 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_882178969" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_882178969" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=216&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=882178969&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_882178969" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 882178969, true, &#39;&#39;);
