<div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1185968753?book_show_action=false">Oct 08, 2015</a>      <a title="Aj the Ravenous Reader" class="user" name="Aj the Ravenous Reader" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader">Aj the Ravenous Reader</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader?shelf=wholesome-reads">wholesome-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1185968753" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer410814643123851842"><br><b> <i> U+201CIt was agony to touch a person marked by something so good.U+201D </i> </b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576920.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>To give you an overview of the storyU+2026<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576921.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>As if I was gonna do that. I wouldnU+2019t want to be pelted with rotten tomatoes, mind you. Lol. ^^<br><br>As for my review, I politely refer you to all other great five star reviews of this book and think of every little thing good you can think of, every beautiful word that comes to mind, every amazing feeling you remember, those are what I will say of this book, of the characters, of the writing and of e</span>  <span id="freeText410814643123851842" style="display:none"><br><b> <i> U+201CIt was agony to touch a person marked by something so good.U+201D </i> </b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576920.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>To give you an overview of the storyU+2026<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1423017066ra/13576921.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>As if I was gonna do that. I wouldnU+2019t want to be pelted with rotten tomatoes, mind you. Lol. ^^<br><br>As for my review, I politely refer you to all other great five star reviews of this book and think of every little thing good you can think of, every beautiful word that comes to mind, every amazing feeling you remember, those are what I will say of this book, of the characters, of the writing and of everything about the book. <br><br>The only challenge I encountered reading this was this little voice speaking in perfect British accent that was manipulating my entire reading. That stubborn voice prolonged the entire process because it wanted to be heard and so many times that voice managed its way through my mouth making me read the words aloud in this foreign voice thatU+2019s definitely not my own. Lol. ^^<br><br>I know IU+2019m not making sense anymore so IU+2019ll stop but before that let me just say that I loved all the characters (of course except the despicable ones) but that who made the strongest impression upon me isU+2026.surprise, surprise! <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1423017066i/13576922.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>That quote above belongs to him. He amuses and surprises me all the time despite his little but hugely significant roles in the entire story. I was laughing out loud at his mention of eating a vomit flavored bean and then trying another only to taste the earwax flavored one. But except from his hilarity, everything he says is a precious gem. <br><br><b> <i> U+201CAfter all, to the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.U+201D </i> </b><br><br>I know it sounds too much, but I was laughing and crying at the bookU+2019s perfect ending. Everything is just perfect! <br><br><br><br>Thank you, Hayat for this reading challenge and thank you Isabelle for providing me the book. You guys are the best! <3 <3 <3<br></span>  <a data-text-id="410814643123851842" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div id="reviewTextContainer137775795" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17425602962719569213">Wow! Watching the movie was one thing, but reading it is completely something else! I wish I didn't watch the movies first >__< Or should I say, I wished I read the books first!<br /><br />My first impressions:<br />1) I didn't realize how humorous some parts of the book were! Albus Dumbledore, you're definitely off your rocker; but I LOVE IT!<br />2) The friendships, and interaction between all the characters are great. I love the love/hate relationship going on between Ron and Hermione.<br />3) Harry is a spunky kid</span>  <span id="freeText17425602962719569213" style="display:none">Wow! Watching the movie was one thing, but reading it is completely something else! I wish I didn't watch the movies first >__< Or should I say, I wished I read the books first!<br /><br />My first impressions:<br />1) I didn't realize how humorous some parts of the book were! Albus Dumbledore, you're definitely off your rocker; but I LOVE IT!<br />2) The friendships, and interaction between all the characters are great. I love the love/hate relationship going on between Ron and Hermione.<br />3) Harry is a spunky kid isn't he? For a 11 year old he really knows how to hold his own. Well done sir!<br />4) Neville Longbottom. What can I say? He's the true hero, isn't he? :)<br />5) Love The Mirror of Erised chapter.<br />6) Quidditch is amazing. Can I be a Beater?<br />7) Excellent writing. Great setup for the rest of the books!<br /><br />Check out my full review here: <a target="_blank" href="http://thereadables.tumblr.com/post/2604732660/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone" rel="nofollow">http://thereadables.tumblr.com/post/2...</a><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="17425602962719569213" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; I adore the entire series and love the educational value and positive messages as well in the book, I could read it over and over again! my childhood was amazing I grew up watching harry potterU+2019s movies as an adult IU+2019m still so amazed by this series itU+2019s my first time reading JK RowlingU+2019s books and IU+2019m loving it !               <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1713956-manny?shelf=science-fiction">science-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1713956-manny?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" id="reviewTextContainer113033849" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5515039270989259599">Oh look! A cute, funny children's book, just the right length, with a nicely constructed, self-contained plot and a good ending.<br /><br />Well, obviously we want to turn it into a huge, bloated, ridiculously self-important seven-volume series. Nothing else would make sense. <br /></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29931457-franco-santos?shelf=libros-en-digital">libros-en-digital</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1243233355" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18020644331807234897"><b>U+00BFQue puedo decir que no se haya dicho ya?</b><br><br>Hace rato que querU+00EDa empezar la saga leyendo sus libros. Antes de hacer eso preferU+00EDa conseguir los tomos en fU+00EDsico. No tengo plata, no aguante, me los descarguU+00E9 y la iniciU+00E9. AsU+00ED que U+00A1mis aU+00F1os de estudio en Hogwarts han comenzado!<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1428000423i/14349548.jpg" width="400" height="160" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>DespuU+00E9s de todo, para una mente bien organizada, la muerte no es mU+00E1s que la siguiente gran aventura.</i><br><br><b> <i>No es bueno dejarse arrastrar por los sueU+00F1os y olvidarse de vivir.</i> </b></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_794900297" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/794900297" />    <a title="Laz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22313662-laz"><img alt="Laz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459126457p2/22313662.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/794900297?book_show_action=false">Jan 21, 2015</a>      <a title="Laz" class="user" name="Laz" href="/user/show/22313662-laz">Laz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810545" href="/book/show/7955579-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">magic world lovers</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=classics">classics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=sci-fi">sci-fi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer794900297" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7355088556086665287"><b> <blockquote>U+201CIt does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.U+201D</blockquote> </b><br /><br />Is there a person in the entire planet that has never in their lives read at least a Harry Potter novel? No, I don't think so. Is there a person who's never heard of Harry Potter? No, I don't think so, even my grandma knows of him. We all love us some Harry Potter. <br /><br />It's a favorite of mine and I'm sure every bookworm who's out there can appreciate and understand the reason why.<br /><br />I was one of those little kids that run around dressed up like H</span>  <span id="freeText7355088556086665287" style="display:none"><b>  <blockquote>U+201CIt does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.U+201D</blockquote></b><br /><br />Is there a person in the entire planet that has never in their lives read at least a Harry Potter novel? No, I don't think so. Is there a person who's never heard of Harry Potter? No, I don't think so, even my grandma knows of him. We all love us some Harry Potter. <br /><br />It's a favorite of mine and I'm sure every bookworm who's out there can appreciate and understand the reason why.<br /><br />I was one of those little kids that run around dressed up like Harry. For the record, I really did. I would wear those round glasses and swish and flick my wand around and I took so pride in doing so.<br /><br />It took me some time to read the books because I didn't use to be a bookworm, I only started appreciating the magic of books, like two years ago. I read this last year and after seeing the movie countless times I still didn't feel like reading something forcefully or something I knew what its story was going to be, although I did.<br /><br />J.K. Rowling created a world that is so genuine, so detailed, so real. She took a word, magic, and she gave new meaning to it, creating spells, traditions to follow magic throughout this magnificent journey. She created these three real, passionate, and amazing characters that we all love and in a way we grew together. <br /><br />This is my childhood. No, not the books. But I was fan of the movies ever since the first one and maybe I wasn't one of the lucky ones to read the book from the beginning I still have a word at saying that we were lucky to grow up into the Harry Potter generation.<br /><br />This, as you all know, is the first novel in the series and it's an introduction mostly. Its size is not so big but trust me it's a wondrous book that makes every little kid's fantasy (and why not kid-grown ups) run wild. I love this and how juvenile it is. Harry, Ron, Hermione, they're all so cute and small, they're just little kids, chasing down the adventure.<br /><br />We all know who Harry and his sidekicks are. We all know about his lightning-shaped scar. We all know what he's been through when he was just a little boy.<br /><br />So, I dare you, if you're my age, 19 that is, and you're a fan of the movies but have never given this book the chance it deserves, read the hell out of it. It's never to late.<br /><br />Thanks for reading my review. <3</span>  <a data-text-id="7355088556086665287" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>       >            <span id="freeTextContainer10691451697223119554"><i>"I think we must expect great things from you, Mr Potter....After all, He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Names did great things - terrible, yes, but great."</i><br><br><i>The feels and memories this read has brought back is unreal. Can't say more than this is:</i><br><a href="http://s284.photobucket.com/user/kellsway/media/potter approves gif_zpstxsfvlir.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1446515012ra/16821625.gif" alt=" photo potter approves gif_zpstxsfvlir.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><b>From beginning to end ~ Everything was:</b><br><a href="http://s284.photobucket.com/user/kellsway/media/Ron Pic _zps4vta8m4y.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1444926252i/16574687.gif" alt=" photo Ron Pic _zps4vta8m4y.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><i>Harry Harry my dearest Harry this book was you finding out who you are and that you were not just any ordinary boy. href="/user/show/21992464-helen-the-bookowl"><img alt="helen the bookowl" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477245060p2/21992464.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/896279189?book_show_action=false">Nov 03, 2015</a>      <a title="helen the bookowl" class="user" name="helen the bookowl" href="/user/show/21992464-helen-the-bookowl">helen the bookowl</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780545790352" href="/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer896279189" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer941830610134089416">Harry Potter has and always will have a special place in my heart, so my rating comes as no surprise. However, my rereading of the first book this time around was quite special because I read the recently published illustrated version. I must say that the illustrations very much enhanced the story and made it even more magical. They are unique because they don't look like what we see in the movies, but at the same time they were exactly as I would've pictured them to be. I imagine that any child</span>  <span id="freeText941830610134089416" style="display:none">Harry Potter has and always will have a special place in my heart, so my rating comes as no surprise. However, my rereading of the first book this time around was quite special because I read the recently published illustrated version. I must say that the illustrations very much enhanced the story and made it even more magical. They are unique because they don't look like what we see in the movies, but at the same time they were exactly as I would've pictured them to be. I imagine that any child who has a hard time imagining this fantasy world would only find help and guidance in this illustrated version. I know I loved it, and I can't wait till the second edition comes out. </span>  <a data-text-id="941830610134089416" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> together.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jul 14, 2015 07:38PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_388323946' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 388323946, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_129564160" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/129564160" />    <a title="Mark Lawrence" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4508542-mark-lawrence"><img alt="Mark Lawrence" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442536170p2/4508542.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/129564160?book_show_action=false">Aug 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Mark Lawrence" class="user" name="Mark Lawrence" href="/user/show/4508542-mark-lawrence">Mark Lawrence</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer129564160" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6711562669152037877">Publishers have my sympathy. If I try to put myself in the place of an editor picking this manuscript from the pile I can say with some certainty that I would not have recognized it as the ticket to a multi-billion dollar prize. I would have thought to myself that it was a good fun read, revisiting the magic-school trope and doing a fine job for children in the 8 to 12 range. If I hadn't had anything better land on my desk I might have published it, but then again, like quite a number of</span>  <span id="freeText6711562669152037877" style="display:none">Publishers have my sympathy. If I try to put myself in the place of an editor picking this manuscript from the pile I can say with some certainty that I would not have recognized it as the ticket to a multi-billion dollar prize. I would have thought to myself that it was a good fun read, revisiting the magic-school trope and doing a fine job for children in the 8 to 12 range. If I hadn't had anything better land on my desk I might have published it, but then again, like quite a number of publishers, I might have passed in favour of a book I liked better.<br /><br />I read this maybe 15 years back so I could share in what was exciting my three kids at the time. And I've read it twice to my daughter, Celyn. We read the first 5 some years back, and now she's 12 we're going to read the whole lot. She's very disabled and can't read for herself (she can't hold the book or see the page for starters...) <br /><br />Having just finished I've checked the shelves to discover we have two copies of book 1 and two copies of book 3, but none of book 2. So JKR will be getting some more of my money shortly!<br /><br />To the review... I liked the book. I have no idea why it has sold a gazzilion copies more than any other children's book or why so many adults are so taken with it. JKR writes solid enough prose, though her addiction to adverbs in dialogue tags irks me no end, he said testily. She writes a fun and inventive story, though the internal inconsistencies would have distressed me even as a child. Why do the finest wizards in the land leave a great treasure guarded only by a series of puzzles rather than actual defences? If in the final scenes the puzzle poem hadn't been left to give the solution to the potion test ... or the key hadn't been left in the same room as the door that wouldn't yield to magic ... would that not have been a better way to defend the treasure? Yes ... it was more fun this way, but ... dammit ... kids aren't stupid...<br /><br />But yes, funny and inventive magic, school dynamics of making friends and enemies, the hijinx, the evil baddie, the chosen one... it's all good. Celyn certainly enjoyed it. She's on team Hermionie.<br /><br />The only other thing that really bothered me was the repeated insinuation, present even in the term itself, that 'muggles' are somehow lesser. That the random gift of magical ability somehow makes you better.<br /><br />I remember that later on (and hinted at in this book) the idea of mud-bloods (wizards born of muggles) is offered up as a proxy for racism and we're invited to condemn Draco Malfoy for his views (rightly so). But all the time I read this I'm feeling the hypocrisy embodied in the whole idea of muggles, which, albeit voiced without open malice, is really the same damn thing. <br /><br />I will report back on book 2 when we're done.<br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="6711562669152037877" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1695888397" />    <a title="Renata" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/45587823-renata"><img alt="Renata" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472153441p2/45587823.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1695888397?book_show_action=false">Jul 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Renata" class="user" name="Renata" href="/user/show/45587823-renata">Renata</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788478886548" href="/book/show/15868.Harry_Potter_y_la_piedra_filosofal">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1695888397" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9805750198147440820">Es la primera vez que leo Harry Potter (lo sU+00E9, verdad? Pero oye nunca es demasiado tarde para leer un libro) y me ha encantado. HacU+00EDa la mitad del libro hubieron algunas partes que me aburrieron un poco pero lo demU+00E1s me gustU+00F3 y mucho. Tengo ganas de seguir leyendo las aventuras de Harry por que creo que acabarU+00E9 muy enamorada de esta saga. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1695888397">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow"      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1695888397'><a id="like_count_review_1695888397" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1695888397?resource_type=Review"><span class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1151669054" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1151669054" />    <a title="Evelyn (devours and digests words)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words"><img alt="Evelyn (devours and digests words)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1443086847p2/38658747.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1151669054?book_show_action=false">Dec 08, 2015</a>      <a title="Evelyn (devours and digests words)" class="user" name="Evelyn (devours and digests words)" href="/user/show/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words">Evelyn (devours and digests words)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=great-characterization">great-characterization</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=unique-story-lines">unique-story-lines</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=worldbuilding-for-the-win">worldbuilding-for-the-win</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=fantastical">fantastical</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=the-big-screens">the-big-screens</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=childhood-nostalgia">childhood-nostalgia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=fey-folks">fey-folks</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=series-i-actually-like">series-i-actually-like</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=writing-i-would-love-to-imitate">writing-i-would-love-to-imitate</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=bagful-of-laughs">bagful-of-laughs</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=stephen-king-approves">stephen-king-approves</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1151669054" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8617942665549933936">I am not going to review Harry Potter, that is just an impossible task. However, after reading many people's personal stories linked to Harry Potter I got inspired to share mine as well! It'll be a long and boring reminiscing....<br /><br />My childhood was not exposed to <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling"> J.K.Rowling</a>. In fact, Harry Potter remained untouched until I was 12 years old.<br /><br />I was an avid <s>inhaler</s> reader of spooky books. Many children at that age were probably attending Hogwarts already (Harry Potter was booming back then) but I was</span>  <span id="freeText8617942665549933936" style="display:none">I am not going to review Harry Potter, that is just an impossible task. However, after reading many people's personal stories linked to Harry Potter I got inspired to share mine as well! It'll be a long and boring reminiscing....<br /><br />My childhood was not exposed to <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling"> J.K.Rowling</a>. In fact, Harry Potter remained untouched until I was 12 years old.<br /><br />I was an avid <s>inhaler</s> reader of spooky books. Many children at that age were probably attending Hogwarts already (Harry Potter was booming back then) but I was stuck in another planet where your worst nightmares can come to life. Other times, I'll be battling off angry ghosts from lighthouses, zapping aliens with laser guns, dodging dungeon trolls, wrestling off demonic doppelgangers, getting haunted by talking dummies and going back and forth from one dimension to the next. Sometimes, I was scouring places for clues to solve puzzling mysteries.<br /><br />I suppose you can say that <b>my childhood was still just as adventurous minus witches & wizards & magical schools.</b><br /><br />Finally, I was burnt out from all my usual, preferable book series. I have completed all the <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/138020.The_Secret_Path__Spooksville___1_" title="The Secret Path (Spooksville, #1) by Christopher Pike"> Spooksville</a> adventures <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/19954.Christopher_Pike" title="Christopher Pike"> Christopher Pike</a> had offered, I've read <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/18901.The_Book_of_Nightmares" title="The Book of Nightmares by Galway Kinnell"> The Book of Nightmares</a> by <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/3347573.John_Peel" title="John Peel"> John Peel</a> countless times already that I made myself sick of it, I was dead tired of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/13730.R_L__Stine" title="R.L. Stine"> R.L.Stine</a>'s repetitions in his <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/14883617.Goosebumps" title="Goosebumps by Scholastic Inc."> Goosebumps</a> books, and I didn't own enough copies of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/search/search?q= The Secret Five" title=" The Secret Five"> The Secret Five</a> series by <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/10657.Enid_Blyton" title="Enid Blyton"> Enid Blyton</a>. I had <b>nothing</b> else to read aside from childish picture books.  <br /><br />Then come one day when my sister came home with a bulging plastic bag from Times bookstore. When we spilled out the content together, there were 4 books and <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling"> Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets</a> was among them.<br /><br />You see, when I was first introduced to Harry Potter, I did not start with The Sorcerer's Stone as I should have but instead, the starter book for me was<i> The Chamber of Secrets</i> (My sister was a bit of a noob at book buying. She didn't realize she bought the second book instead of the first!). I remembered thinking how <b>VERY ODD and UNIQUE</b> this world of witchcraft & wizardry was. And believe me, I've read some strange stuffs before Harry Potter came into the picture.<br /><br />I knew I had missed out on a few details from the first book but I've watched the movies and they were enough to provide me the information I needed to know.<br /><br />Here's where the plot twist come to play - right after I was done with <i>The Chamber of Secrets</i>, I extinguished Harry Potter out of my mind. My sister and I did not want to own the rest of the books either. Plus, I simply wasn't that interested to continue reading and thought it was quite pointless to read the books when the movies were at my reach. (You are more than welcomed to kick the old me in the shins. I can't believe I was so unimaginative!)<br /><br />It was 4 years later, at 16, when I re-returned to this series. I was quite late to jump into bandwagon, I know but damn it, the last movie ended quite a while ago and I've rewatched and rewinded them all so many times than I can count. <i>I fucking missed Harry Potter. </i><br /><br />Well, I was still side-eyeing the books mistrustfully but one day, when I was feeling rebellious, I bought the entire box set (my old copy of <i>The Chamber of Secrets</i> was long lost) and here I am, doing my 5th reread of the series.<br /><br /><b>Stories are even more magical to read than to watch onscreen.</b> That much I realized. I feel like kicking myself even as I write this for thinking, once, that the Harry Potter movies are better than the books. I didn't truly or fully apprecite the written words before but <b> <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/1077326.J_K__Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling"> J.K.Rowling</a> had given me a WAKE UP! call and I have her to thank for that.</b><br /><br />This being my fifth reread, I was worried the analytical reader in me will shred the book apart and nitpick every single details but to my surprise, I did not. I still love every single moment as much as I had the first time around. I still found The Dursleys reaction to magic hilariously comical, Hermione's and Ron's banters are adorable and rip-roaringly funny at times (oh, they were so meant to be) and I enjoyed J.K.Rowling's ability to weave up an entire new bizarre world with its own set systems and good lord, her food description is absolutely fantastic. My mouth waters even at the thought of Chocolate Frogs, Pumpkin Juice, Butterbeer and every single meals the house elves at Hogwarts have to offer. I'd even try a taste at Bertie Bott's Every Flavour beans.<br /><br />In a nutshell, this entire series is utterly magical (Need I say more?) and I won't ever forget this anytime soon.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="8617942665549933936" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1426951998" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13688730888339569588"><b>The Philosopher's Stone's Magic is now concluded..<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445990314i/16729974._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="325" alt="" world will know his name!U+201D</blockquote><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445990972i/16730136._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="313" alt="" U+062A U+0645 U+0644 U+062A U+0645 U+062C U+0645 U+0648 U+0639 U+062A U+064A U+0627 U+0644 U+0645 U+0641 U+0636 U+0644 U+0629 U+0645 U+0646 U+0627 U+0644 U+0633 U+062D U+0631, U+0628 U+0623 U+062D U+0629 U+0644 U+0623 U+0648 U+0644 U+0645 U+0631 U+0629 U+0645 U+0646 U+0647 U+0627 U+0631 U+064A U+0628 U+0648 U+062A U+0631 U+0648 U+062D U+062C U+0631 U+0627 U+0644 U+0641 U+064A U+0644 U+0633 U+0648 U+0641<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445990314i/16729975._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="269" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></b>With this glossy elegant ,really magical edition..for a novel that <i>Everytime</i> I read, I get a new loving, peaceful, real life lesson for better humanity..It really a life changing read ,And I'm not exaggerating..<br><blockquote>U+201DHeU+2019ll be famous,a legend U+2014 U+2014 there will be books written about Harry U+2014 every child in our world will know his name!U+201D</blockquote><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445990972i/16730136._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="313" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>In this large tome, very large actually is the new insight into the first Adventure ,the first year for our beloved Harry Potter in his, and our Home , Hogwarts.<br><br>Have to admit that so far I see that the illustrations reminds me a bit with the children's books I saw in my ary school's library, specially the European ones.. Ou Oh wait, Harry Potter is already one :) ,silly me, I forget :)<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445991341i/16730197._SX540_.jpg" width="400" height="212" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>U+0627 U+0644 U+0643 U+062A U+0627 U+0628 U+0628 U+0623 U+0643 U+062B U+0631 U+0645 U+0646 75% U+0645 U+0646 U+0635 U+0641 U+062D U+0627 U+062A U+0647 U+0628 U+0647 U+0627 U+0631 U+0633 U+0648 U+0645 U+062C U+062F U+064A U+062F U+0629 U+0648 U+0645 U+062E U+062A U+0644 U+0641 U+0629 , U+0645 U+0646 U+0643 U+0627 U+062F U+0631 U+0635 U+063A U+064A U+0631 U+0644 U+0635 U+0648 U+0631 U+0629 U+0645 U+0646 U+062F U+0645 U+062C U+0629 U+0645 U+0639 U+0627 U+0644 U+0643 U+0644 U+0645 U+0627 U+062A, U+0647 U+0630 U+0627 U+063A U+064A U+0631 U+0623 U+0646 U+0643 U+0644 U+0623 U+0641 U+062A U+062A U+0627 U+062D U+064A U+0629 U+0641 U+0635 U+0644 U+0628 U+0647 U+0627 U+0635 U+0648 U+0631 U+0629<br>U+0623 U+0645 U+0627 U+0628 U+0627 U+0642 U+064A U+0627 U+0644 U+0635 U+0641 U+062D U+0627 U+062A U+0627 U+0644 U+062A U+064A U+0628 U+0644 U+0627 U+0635 U+0648 U+0631 U+0641 U+0633 U+062A U+062C U+062F U+0628 U+0647 U+0627 U+062F U+0627 U+0626 U+0645 U+0627 U+0628 U+0642 U+0639 U+0629 U+062D U+0628 U+0631, U+0628 U+0642 U+0639 U+0629 U+0627 U+062D U+062F U+064A U+0627 U+0644 U+062C U+0631 U+0639 U+0627 U+062A U+0648 U+0627 U+0644 U+0648 U+0635 U+0641 U+0627 U+062A U+0627 U+0644 U+0633 U+062D U+0631 U+064A U+0629, U+0643 U+0623 U+0646 U+0647 U+0627 U+0643 U+062A U+0627 U+0628 U+0645 U+062F U+0631 U+0633 U+064A U+0645 U+0633 U+062A U+0639 U+0645 U+0644 U+0628 U+0634 U+0643 U+0644 U+0639 U+0628 U+0642 U+0631 U+064A<br><br>75% of the pages have illustrations, small cadres to full page stunning illustration..<br>Even those few pictures without graphic or illustrations have some ink or potion stains and marks ..as If it's a used school book, which is perfect.<br><br>As a collector, I guess I'd give it 4 stars "for the edition not the story of course" , I still miss the Pottermore.com illustrations which was amazing even without "smartly" adding faces..<br><br>But all the same, I still loved it, and can't wait for all the Sevens..And hopefully one day,from this edition I'll read to my kids bedtime stories..a chapter every night :)<br>Well , that's how I'll read it now anyway for <i>lost counting</i> time..<br><br>Mohammed Arabey<br></span>  <a data-text-id="13688730888339569588" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer50283600" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3466932309622233599">How could I not give this book 5 stars? I would live in fear of being strung up the nearest Muggle tree! Thankfully, it was a great book and well deserving of high praise.<br /><br />Not to mention Harry Potter gives way to this famous Office scene:<br /><br />Michael Scott: We are going to choose team names. Dwight!<br />Dwight Schrute: We will be called Gryffindor!<br />Jim Halpert: Really? Not Slytherin?<br />Dwight Schrute: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.<br />Jim Halpert: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.<br />Dwight Schrute: [fearfully:] H</span>  <span id="freeText3466932309622233599" style="display:none">How could I not give this book 5 stars? I would live in fear of being strung up the nearest Muggle tree! Thankfully, it was a great book and well deserving of high praise.<br /><br />Not to mention Harry Potter gives way to this famous Office scene:<br /><br />Michael Scott: We are going to choose team names. Dwight!<br />Dwight Schrute: We will be called Gryffindor!<br />Jim Halpert: Really? Not Slytherin?<br />Dwight Schrute: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.<br />Jim Halpert: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.<br />Dwight Schrute: [fearfully:] He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named? I wouldn't do that.<br />Jim Halpert: [starts chant, everyone joins in:] Voldemort! Voldemort! Voldemort! Voldemort! Voldemort!<br />Dwight Schrute: [looks around, scared:] Okay, seriously, you really shouldn't be saying that.<br /><br />Now that's funny. </span>  <a data-text-id="3466932309622233599" href="#" </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1316706192" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1316706192" />    <a title="Councillor" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/40792319-councillor"><img alt="Councillor" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1437208837p2/40792319.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1316706192?book_show_action=false">Jul 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Councillor" class="user" name="Councillor" href="/user/show/40792319-councillor">Councillor</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=20th-century">20th-century</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=uk-ireland">uk-ireland</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=rated-4-and-a-half-stars">rated-4-and-a-half-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=library">library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=friendship">friendship</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=will-be-a-classic-in-100-years">will-be-a-classic-in-100-years</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=those-books-anyone-should-read-once">those-books-anyone-should-read-once</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=the-1st-book-in-a-series">the-1st-book-in-a-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=school-setting">school-setting</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1316706192" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5906462430203989606">ItU+2019s time for a little confession: I have survived <i>eighteen</i> years without <i>ever</i> having read any Harry Potter book or having watched any Harry Potter movie. I remember seeing glimpses of the third or fourth movie in my childhood on a friendU+2019s birthday, but thatU+2019s about everything which connected me with the world of Harry Potter. More recently, a friend of mine forced me to finally watch the movies, not understanding how I could still have had a relatively enjoyable childhood without the presence</span>  <span id="freeText5906462430203989606" style="display:none">ItU+2019s time for a little confession: I have survived <i>eighteen</i> years without <i>ever</i> having read any Harry Potter book or having watched any Harry Potter movie. I remember seeing glimpses of the third or fourth movie in my childhood on a friendU+2019s birthday, but thatU+2019s about everything which connected me with the world of Harry Potter. More recently, a friend of mine forced me to finally watch the movies, not understanding how I could still have had a relatively enjoyable childhood without the presence of Harry Potter in it. So here I am, having read the first book approximately ten years too late, and regretting to never have read it before.<br /><br />The novel actually has a lot of flaws which I could start to criticize right now. But apart from the assumption that it would gain me some enemies, what would be the point of it? This book is <b>magical</b> exactly the way it has been written. Even its flaws made me laugh or at least chuckle, and during every other page of the book, I wanted to be a part of Hogwarts. I always thought of the HP series as being set in a world designed for children, but now I understand how wrong my thinking was. Furthermore, I canU+2019t stop comparing it to the Chronicles of Narnia, which are set in another magical world U+2013 yet the writing seems so much more childish. RowlingU+2019s style addresses children, teens and adults alike, and thatU+2019s what I admire most about her writing.<br /><br />IU+2019m only 57 days older than the first book of the Harry Potter series as of its publication date, yet it has needed 6746 days before I finally entered the world of Hogwarts along with Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger, Neville Longbottom and all the other well-known characters connected with the series, and two more days before I finished the first year in Hogwarts. The only possible way for me to make good for avoiding RowlingU+2019s book for such a long time is to read all the six following novels. Soon.<br /><br />And to await the arrival of my own Hogwarts letter.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="5906462430203989606" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1316706192">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1316706192" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=1316706192&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1316706192'><a id="like_count_review_1316706192" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1316706192?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">48 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1316706192" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1316706192" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=48&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1316706192&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1316706192" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1316706192, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">34 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1316706192?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=3">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1316706192' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1316706192/comments?reverse=true">View all 34 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_146902899" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Aj the Ravenous Reader" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453105148p1/30248594.jpg" alt="30248594" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/30248594-aj-the-ravenous-reader">Aj the Ravenous Reader</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer1966228932047587217">Don't worry, Fabian.   <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1274690312?book_show_action=false">May 08, 2015</a>      <a title="Sue (Hollywood News Source)" class="user" name="Sue (Hollywood News Source)" href="/user/show/6511257-sue-hollywood-news-source">Sue (Hollywood News Source)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582889" href="/book/show/17372039-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6511257-sue-hollywood-news-source?shelf=favorite">favorite</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6511257-sue-hollywood-news-source?shelf=scholastic">scholastic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" id="reviewTextContainer1274690312" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8003903591804689626"><b>U+201CIt was agony to touch a person marked by something so good.U+201D </b><br><br>I'm not going to attempt to review this book, but I'll leave you all with this. We all need a hug sometimes, especially after rereading Harry Potter.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1431098973ra/14791803.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span> class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1274690312" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/696504509" />    <a title="Argona" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/349639-argona"><img alt="Argona" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476301474p2/349639.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/696504509?book_show_action=false">Feb 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Argona" class="user" name="Argona" href="/user/show/349639-argona">Argona</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=childhood-memories">childhood-memories</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=urban-fantasy">urban-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=dragons">dragons</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=epic-fantasy">epic-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=humor">humor</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=mystery">mystery</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=favorite-romance">favorite-romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=high-fantasy">high-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=favorite-fantasy-series">favorite-fantasy-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/349639-argona?shelf=david-the-amazing">david-the-amazing</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer696504509" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10992803881221043107">First read 1997<br />Many many rereads<br />Most recent reread 2014<br /><br /><br />Dear Harry<br /><br />I have been meaning to write this for a long time now. This isnU+2019t a review on your journey, this is simply my feelings and words I wish I could tell you. I still remember the first time I bought your first book. (I had to buy it again from another publication that actually continued with your books!) I had been without any interesting books to read for months and your book caught my attention since I had read about your popularity</span>  <span id="freeText10992803881221043107" style="display:none">First read 1997<br />Many many rereads<br />Most recent reread 2014<br /><br /><br />Dear Harry<br /><br />I have been meaning to write this for a long time now. This isnU+2019t a review on your journey, this is simply my feelings and words I wish I could tell you. I still remember the first time I bought your first book. (I had to buy it again from another publication that actually continued with your books!) I had been without any interesting books to read for months and your book caught my attention since I had read about your popularity in Britain so I got all excited and bought the book immediately. People barely knew you where I lived and I can claim I was among the first who gave you a chance. At the time, your books werenU+2019t found easily anyway and werenU+2019t published all over the country. I read your book and I really liked it but I wasnU+2019t really in love. I did look forward to your second book and I was disappointed to find out that there were no copies available where I lived and your third book wasnU+2019t even out yet. I waited and waited and slowly word spread about you and the second copy appeared. I read it and...something changed. I was falling in love.<br /><br />There was a girl in my class that I barely knew. I recommended you to her, she read it and something changed between us too. More than 10 years later, she is still one of my closest friends. Just like that, you helped to connect us.<br /><br />I am not a genius but I found school days very boring. I was fine getting good grades without paying any real attention at the classroom and certain days were almost unbearable but then...you became a part of my life and I finally had you and your world to think about. I could think and fantasize about you, your journey, your future and I finally had a book to look forward to year after year. Time passed and my teenage years were spent with you. When I think back, you gave me some of my best memories from that time. <br /><br />Then came a time that almost anyone that read books, knew about you. I stumbled upon a new site that had been created by kids in my country and I started to talk with one of the admins. She was both a Harry Potter fan and a Lord of the Rings fan and we clicked immediately! I will never forget how she kept calling me by mobile phone when my family moved into a new house and I didn't have access to phones or Internet. She would talk to me for hours and helped me to keep my sanity! She moved to Japan a few years ago and I have very little contact with her now, but I will always remember her and what she did for me.<br /><br />Years later, as a university student, I met a pair of twin sisters. They were very very shy at the time, or should I say at first contact, and I didnU+2019t know how to connect with them or whether I even wanted to. Then we realized we all love you, we started talking about you and then found other things we all liked... and today, they are my best friends, they always try to be there for me and I always try to be there for them. We have our differences but we also have our similarities and our love for you is one of them.<br /><br />Harry, thank you for letting me into your world. Thank you for becoming a part of my world. Thank you for being there when I needed you. Thank you for giving me these fun and treasured memories. Thank you for helping me find people like me. Thank you for everything! I will always cherish you.<br /><br />You live forever in my mind and my heart.<br /><br />Yours sincerely<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="10992803881221043107" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1727905686?book_show_action=false">Aug 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Aya Hamza" class="user" name="Aya Hamza" href="/user/show/11660871-aya-hamza">Aya Hamza</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582889" href="/book/show/17372039-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11660871-aya-hamza?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11660871-aya-hamza?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11660871-aya-hamza?shelf=school">school</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11660871-aya-hamza?shelf=cover-love">cover-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11660871-aya-hamza?shelf=childrens">childrens</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1727905686" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1120963373801124694"><b>*2nd Reread: August 24th 2016.<br>*1st Reread: September 2013.<br>*Read: Someday 2006.</b><br><br>I was so excited to enter Hogwarts this year again (Fall is coming soon and this is the best time to re-read the whole series).<br><b>Hogwarts: a love story!</b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472583500i/20211527._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212064._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212065._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And I wanted to meet my beloved characters, whom I've grown with for so long.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212066._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Harry</b>, the famous child, who didn't know anything about his family history or Hogwarts until he was 11 years old! Harry was always brave, honest and so kind (and he was the youngest Quidditch pla</span>  <span id="freeText1120963373801124694" style="display:none"><b>*2nd Reread: August 24th 2016.<br>*1st Reread: September 2013.<br>*Read: Someday 2006.</b><br><br>I was so excited to enter Hogwarts this year again (Fall is coming soon and this is the best time to re-read the whole series).<br><b>Hogwarts: a love story!</b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472583500i/20211527._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212064._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212065._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And I wanted to meet my beloved characters, whom I've grown with for so long.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212066._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Harry</b>, the famous child, who didn't know anything about his family history or Hogwarts until he was 11 years old! Harry was always brave, honest and so kind (and he was the youngest Quidditch player for a century!).<br><b>Ron</b>, the red-haired boy, the funniest best friend you can have ever! (and he was so good at playing Wizard's Chess!).<br><b>Hermoine</b>, the book nerd, the smartest girl you can imagine.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212067.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And <b>Draco Malfoy</b>, I've always loved him (he was always misunderstood).<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212068._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Hagrid</b>, he was always the kindest.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212069._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Prof. Dumbledore</b>, the best wizard the history has known ever. He was wise but also so brave.<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212070._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Prof. Snape</b>, you won't know him well unless you complete the series!<br>(He is my favorite character, <i>always</i> my fav!).<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212071._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And we got to see <b>Prof. Quirrell</b>, the stuttering, most innocent professor you can meet in your life! <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Don't trust anyone looks so innocent, NEVER. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>You can't imagine the <b>plot twist</b> in this book, it is so well-done. The first time I saw the movie, I was shocked! (Yeah, I watched the movies before reading the books, and the books are so much better than the movies, but it helped me a lot in imagining this magic world).<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212073._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Lets leave the characters now, <b>what is this book particularly about?</b><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212072.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>The Philosopher's/sorcerer's stone</b>.<br>What is this?<br>Who owned this stone?<br>Who protects it?<br>Who want to steal it? and why?<br>What will happen to the trio?<br>Who is "You-Know-Who"?<br><br>I won't tell, for sure. GO. READ. THE. BOOK.! <br>Even if you watched the movies, I am sure you still can enjoy the books so much. And you will know these characters better and better.<br><br>And finally, I NEED THIS TICKET IN MY LIFE!<br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472586415i/20212074._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>P.S.</b> I have never written any reviews for HP books, because, you know, I always thought that was impossible for me. But, at least I tried this time! :D<br><br><br></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="1120963373801124694" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr       <span id="reviewTextContainer1521662614" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9190225209082730602">To be honest I just got this for the illustrations, which I loved. But I did feel like there was A LOT of empty space that could have been more illustrations but other than that this was really fun. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1521662614">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1521662614" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=1521662614&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1521662614'><a id="like_count_review_1521662614" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1521662614?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">46 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1521662614" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1521662614" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=46&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1521662614&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1521662614" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1521662614, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1413790320?book_show_action=false">Dec 13, 2015</a>      <a title="Mangrii" class="user" name="Mangrii" href="/user/show/30410174-mangrii">Mangrii</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788498387070" href="/book/show/26228167-harry-potter-y-la-piedra-filosofal">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1413790320" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10022602092714008542">Desde que me llego el viernes era inevitable que en cuanto que tuviera un mU+00EDnimo de tiempo una relectura iba a caer, y ha sido mU+00E1s pronto que tarde, acompaU+00F1 U+00E1ndome en este domingo. La historia como en cada ocasiU+00F3n que la he leU+00EDdo, me atrapa, me hace soU+00F1ar y revivir aquellos de los momentos mU+00E1s felices de toda mi infancia. La ediciU+00F3n es simplemente un verdadero lujo para cualquier fan de la saga. <br /><br />Un volumen rocoso (que pesa lo suyo), con unas buenas tapas duras y de gran tamaU+00F1o. Las ilustraciones</span>  <span id="freeText10022602092714008542" style="display:none">Desde que me llego el viernes era inevitable que en cuanto que tuviera un mU+00EDnimo de tiempo una relectura iba a caer, y ha sido mU+00E1s pronto que tarde, acompaU+00F1 U+00E1ndome en este domingo. La historia como en cada ocasiU+00F3n que la he leU+00EDdo, me atrapa, me hace soU+00F1ar y revivir aquellos de los momentos mU+00E1s felices de toda mi infancia. La ediciU+00F3n es simplemente un verdadero lujo para cualquier fan de la saga. <br /><br />Un volumen rocoso (que pesa lo suyo), con unas buenas tapas duras y de gran tamaU+00F1o. Las ilustraciones son una gozada, Jim Kay ha hecho un buen trabajo durante todo el volumen, y hay alguna como la de Malfoy a pagina completa que me maravilla y quiero enmarcar. Al principio no me encandilaba el texto a doble columna, pero he terminado acostumbrU+00E1ndome. Un lujo volver asU+00ED a la infancia, la pena es que solo saldrU+00E1 un volumen al aU+00F1o, pero las ganas de tener todos son enormes.</span>  <a data-text-id="10022602092714008542" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer758508746" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8947633768566617011"><br><b> ETA 10/2016</b><br><br>"It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.U+201D<br><br>~~ A.D. <br><br><b>ETA 11/2014</b><br><br>I could never imagine loving a book as much the second time around, yet here I am. <br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/Ugg7eZy" title="" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929056.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><p> <b>U+201CHogwarts, Hogwarts, Hoggy Warty Hogwarts,<br>Teach us something please,<br>Whether we be old and bald<br>Or young with scabby knees,<br>Our heads could do with filling<br>With some interesting stuff,<br>For now theyU+2019re bare and full of air,<br>Dead flies and bits of fluff,<br>So teach us things worth knowing,<br>Bring back what weU+2019ve forgot,<br>just d</b></p></span>  <span id="freeText8947633768566617011" style="display:none"><br><b> ETA 10/2016</b><br><br>"It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.U+201D<br><br>~~ A.D. <br><br><b>ETA 11/2014</b><br><br>I could never imagine loving a book as much the second time around, yet here I am. <br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/Ugg7eZy" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929056.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><p>  <b>U+201CHogwarts, Hogwarts, Hoggy Warty Hogwarts,<br>Teach us something please,<br>Whether we be old and bald<br>Or young with scabby knees,<br>Our heads could do with filling<br>With some interesting stuff,<br>For now theyU+2019re bare and full of air,<br>Dead flies and bits of fluff,<br>So teach us things worth knowing,<br>Bring back what weU+2019ve forgot,<br>just do your best, weU+2019ll do the rest,<br>And learn until our brains all rot.U+201D</b></p><br><br><b>Original Review</b><br>When I review a book, basically I'm breaking it up into little pieces, placing the parts into neat little boxes, and ending my journey with that particular world. It's bittersweet at times because I want to share my journey with everyone, but in doing so, I get sucked back into the real world I was in before I read the book.<br><br>In this case, I refuse to do that. I am keeping all the feelings this book gave me, all the <b>  <i>magic</i></b>, to myself. If you want some of your own, you'll have to go out and get it yourself. I'm not ready to let mine go. Not just yet.<br><br><i>So if you know how to get there,</i><br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/52tMPY4" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929057.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/Psmrrrk" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929058.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/ynRs7p3" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929059.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><i>meeting some good friends along the way,</i><br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/tg2aWUc" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929060.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><i>maybe I'll see you at Hogwarts.</i> <br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/39bXK4F" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929061.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>That's where I'm heading.<br><br><a href="http://i.imgur.com/4xRHAs7" title="" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1416284533ra/11929062.gif" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><b>5 ninja bunnehs holding wands and casting a million magic spells stars</b></span>  <a data-text-id="8947633768566617011" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext 2016</a>      <a title="Isa Cantos (CrU+00F3nicas de una Merodeadora)" class="user" name="Isa Cantos (CrU+00F3nicas de una Merodeadora)" edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer631404671" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17368943744395186136">U+00A1La de veces que yo he releU+00EDdo Harry Potter y me sigue gustando tanto como la primera vez! Ahora, el haber releU+00EDdo el libro en inglU+00E9s, cosa que nunca habU+00EDa hecho, y en su versiU+00F3n ilustrada me tiene alucinando, de verdad. Cosas tan pequeU+00F1as como los acentos de los personajes y algunas palabras escritas en su versiU+00F3n britU+00E1nica y no americana me enamoraron <3. <br /><br />Sigo pensando que nunca es tarde para leer Harry Potter, o incluso para releerlo. Esta historia me trajo muchU+00EDsimos recuerdos de la U+00E9poca</span>  <span id="freeText17368943744395186136" style="display:none">U+00A1La de veces que yo he releU+00EDdo Harry Potter y me sigue gustando tanto como la primera vez! Ahora, el haber releU+00EDdo el libro en inglU+00E9s, cosa que nunca habU+00EDa hecho, y en su versiU+00F3n ilustrada me tiene alucinando, de verdad. Cosas tan pequeU+00F1as como los acentos de los personajes y algunas palabras escritas en su versiU+00F3n britU+00E1nica y no americana me enamoraron <3. <br /><br />Sigo pensando que nunca es tarde para leer Harry Potter, o incluso para releerlo. Esta historia me trajo muchU+00EDsimos recuerdos de la U+00E9poca en la que me sabU+00EDa el nombre de cada capU+00EDtulo, de cada personaje y de cada punto y cada coma que aparecU+00EDa en sus pU+00E1ginas... RecordU+00E9 cU+00F3mo esperU+00E1bamos sU+00FAper impacientes cada nuevo libro, cada pelU+00EDcula, porque querU+00EDamos saber mU+00E1s de las aventuras de Harry, querU+00EDamos volver a ese mundo mU+00E1gico lejos de los Muggles, querU+00EDamos volver a Hogwarts. <br /><br />Releyendo este libro entiendo por quU+00E9 Harry logrU+00F3 crearse un espacio en mi corazU+00F3n y por quU+00E9 nunca se va a ir de allU+00ED tenga la edad que tenga.<br /><br /><i> Hogwarts will always be there to welcome you home </i></span>  <a data-text-id="17368943744395186136" href="#" todos ya?
