itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/624662206" />    <a title="Thomas" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2018505-thomas"><img alt="Thomas" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463769552p2/2018505.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/624662206?book_show_action=false">Jun 22, 2013</a>      <a title="Thomas" class="user" name="Thomas" href="/user/show/2018505-thomas">Thomas</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=own-physical">own-physical</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer624662206" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12268770511559683188">Because everyone on the planet excluding me and maybe some of the Kardashians have read this series, I'll skip the plot summary and go for a less formal review. I can see why so many people adore <i>Harry Potter</i>. While Rowling does not introduce anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of fantasy or plot or characterization, she does abide by the hero's quest with great precision. Harry is the underdog from the start and you can't help but cheer him on as he overcomes obstacles with the help o</span>  <span id="freeText12268770511559683188" style="display:none">Because everyone on the planet excluding me and maybe some of the Kardashians have read this series, I'll skip the plot summary and go for a less formal review. I can see why so many people adore <i>Harry Potter</i>. While Rowling does not introduce anything particularly groundbreaking in terms of fantasy or plot or characterization, she does abide by the hero's quest with great precision. Harry is the underdog from the start and you can't help but cheer him on as he overcomes obstacles with the help of his friends and his mentor. Each of the characters has a distinct personality, and Rowling's simple writing style leaves room for brevity and enough imagery to pull you into the setting. Story-wise, she includes all of the necessary s: foreshadowing, conflicts that escalate to the climax, a pretty satisfying plot twist, etc.<br /><br />I'll probably read one other book in between each installment of this series. I'm looking forward to seeing the characters mature and the plot become darker as many others have said it will!</span>  <a data-text-id="12268770511559683188" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review624662206">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link624662206" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=624662206&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_624662206'><a id="like_count_review_624662206" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/624662206?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">32 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_624662206" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_624662206" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=32&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=624662206&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_624662206" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 624662206, true, &#39;&#39;); Reminds me of your comment. :)<br /><br />And Jessie, do you intend to start soon?</span>  <a data-text-id="4592377354678062356" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1132598568" />    <a title="Teryna90" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7040410-teryna90"><img  </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1132598568" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3324143150849793574"><b> NOW WHERE IS MY LETTER FOR HOGWARTS?! I WANT IT!!!</b> <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/hogwarts" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949739.gif" alt="hogwarts photo: Hogwarts hogwarts2-1.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>After two years of ESL my english teacher decided to assign me a book to read, and every day for a couple of hours she would stay with me and I'd have to read, circle all the words I didn't know and so much more... the book assigned was <b>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.</b> After reading that book I started hating Harry Potter so much that I didn't want to see another book of his... <br><br>after a couple of months the first movie was out and the sch</span>  <span id="freeText3324143150849793574" style="display:none"><b> NOW WHERE IS MY LETTER FOR HOGWARTS?! I WANT IT!!!</b> <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/hogwarts" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949739.gif" alt="hogwarts photo: Hogwarts hogwarts2-1.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>After two years of ESL my english teacher decided to assign me a book to read, and every day for a couple of hours she would stay with me and I'd have to read, circle all the words I didn't know and so much more... the book assigned was <b>Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.</b> After reading that book I started hating Harry Potter so much that I didn't want to see another book of his... <br><br>after a couple of months the first movie was out and the school brought us to movie theater to watch it and I actually fell in love with the movie! So I've watched almost all the movies and then at a certain point I stopped and I promised myself that I wouldn't watch the last three movies, not until I would have read the series...<br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/stupid" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929661ra/12949740.gif" alt="stupid photo: with stupid stupid.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>Well after 14 years I've finally had <i>the courage to start this Saga </i>and I'm so ashamed that I've waited so long... This book is adorable, perfect, I loved it!!! And I've already started the second one!!! Have to make up for all the years I've lost! D: But I've chosen to read it in my language, italian ;)... It's funny how a bad memory can influence you. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930348ra/12949830.gif" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><u>  <b>Stupid Me!!! I almost risked never reading this wonderful saga...</b></u><br><br>... ... ... HARRY POTTER < 3 <3 <3 ... ... ...<br><br>Even though I knew exactly what was going to happen and who the bad guy was, I was still surprised! Rowling has a way of capturing you completely! She has bewitched me completely!!!!!!<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418296490ra/12736351.gif" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Me after reading Harry Potter! </b><br><br>-----<br>Dopo quattordici anni sono finalmente riuscita a trovare il "coraggio" per iniziare questa saga. Eh si, coraggio. Dopo il trauma subito da piccola avevo paura di riprendere questo testo. Ogni volta che pensavo alla saga di Harry Potter mi rivedevo piccola, seduta accanto alla mia professoressa d'inglese che mi invitava a leggere e cerchiare tutte le parole che non comprendevo (che erano tantissime, considerando che ero appena uscita da ESL - classe per alunni stranieri nelle scuole americane - da pochissimo). E quindi successivamente non ho mai piU+00F9 voluto saperne di HARRY POTTER! Dannazione!!!! ... quanto mi pento di non aver trovato il coraggio prima... per fortuna Harry Potter U+00E8 in grado di stupire non solo i bambini!!!<br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/harry potter" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418929987ra/12949765.gif" alt="harry potter photo: glee tumblr_les06aCN1W1qahz0j.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>Dopo un paio di mesi dalla lettura del testo la scuola ci portU+00F2 a vedere il nuovo film di Harry Potter al cinema, ma che dire... il film mi rapU+00EC completamente. Non vi era nessuno che mi osservava, solo io ed Harry. Ed iniziai a vedere anche i film successivi. Ma poi dopo il quarto mi imposi di fermarmi. <b>Dovevo leggere la Saga di Harry Potter!</b> ... beh dopo tanti anni eccomi qui!!! <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930453ra/12949854.gif" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b> Harry forgive me!!! But I'm all yours now... ready to fly to Hogwarts with you!</b><br><br>Questo libro U+00E8 dolcissimo!!! Harry, Ron, Hermione... ohhh can't wait to see how the love between the two grows!!! <3 <3 <3<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930782ra/12949933.gif" width="300" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b><3 Una vera e propria fiaba </b>che non stanca mai, che ti tiene incollata alle pagine! Un testo davvero unico, con protagonisti straordinari... e sto solo all'inizio! Non vedo l'ora di continuare... beh in realtU+00E0 giU+00E0 sto leggendo il secondo! <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1418930570ra/12949874.gif" width="250" height="170" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>Misteri, magia, amici, nemici, incanti, scope volanti, pozioni, intrighi, lotte,</i>, tanti ingredienti squisiti che non possono non suscitare una forte emozione. Amore. <br><br><b> STUPENDO!!!<br>I need more!!!!</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1417028974ra/12171967.gif" width="400" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br></span>  <a data-text-id="3324143150849793574" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1242475028" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1242475028" />    <a title="Steve" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2314568-steve"><img alt="Steve" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1242475028?book_show_action=false">Apr 06, 2015</a>      <a title="Steve" class="user" name="Steve" href="/user/show/2314568-steve">Steve</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=rmfao-2015-genre-challenge">rmfao-2015-genre-challenge</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya">ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1242475028" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10457043252093554053">Ok, so this was my first time reading this book (don't judge me). While I wasn't quite as enamored with it as the thousands of adoring fans (the ones who have read them over and over and over) have been, this wasn't a bad read. I did have to keep reminding myself that this was a children's book, and I'm WAY past the target age! My son and daughter-in-law, along with the RMFAO group, have been after me to read these books. <br /><br />I'm actually looking forward to reading the rest of the books, just to see</span>  <span id="freeText10457043252093554053" style="display:none">Ok, so this was my first time reading this book (don't judge me). While I wasn't quite as enamored with it as the thousands of adoring fans (the ones who have read them over and over and over) have been, this wasn't a bad read. I did have to keep reminding myself that this was a children's book, and I'm WAY past the target age! My son and daughter-in-law, along with the RMFAO group, have been after me to read these books. <br /><br />I'm actually looking forward to reading the rest of the books, just to see how the books, and the characters, grow up. I haven't seen the movies, but I don't live under a rock either, and I know that each book progressively ages with the characters, turning from children's books with child-like problems, to books with adult issues and adult responses from the characters. I'm really hoping that things in the next books aren't so easy for Harry, Ron, and Hermione to solve. That's probably my biggest complaint, and why it "only" got four stars from me: everything was too easy, that the mysteries were laid out too simply and were easily solved. They were clever, and again, I had to keep reminding myself that it wasn't written with me in mind.<br /><br />This first book was entertaining, as I've said, but it wasn't a five-star read (I'm going to be in trouble for that statement, I think!). It reminded me of a mash-up between the old Hardy Boysancy Drew books (kids solving crimes with skills well beyond their age or abilities) and Scooby-Doo. Yes, Scooby-Doo! Especially at the end when the real bad guy was revealed (it wasn't who they thought it was), and the bad guy's reaction was, "Darn you, meddling kids!" (or something very similar). :D<br /><br />On to the next book!</span>  <a data-text-id="10457043252093554053" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1242475028">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks"> alt="Becky" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457393924p2/1376766.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1505654224?book_show_action=false">Jan 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Becky" class="user" name="Becky" href="/user/show/1376766-becky">Becky</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780590353403" href="/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1505654224" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13288558266498748957">I started reading this for the Nth time 3 days before the death of Alan Rickman, who played Snape in the adaptations- in my opinion the best thing about them. It was sad, heartbreaking really, to think of his character just beginning his journey again for me through this reading, while the man who played him so excellently had just passed away. <br /><br />I love the adventure and magic of these books, but I especially love the journey we take with Snape's character. He is everything. So hard to love, but I</span>  <span id="freeText13288558266498748957" style="display:none">I started reading this for the Nth time 3 days before the death of Alan Rickman, who played Snape in the adaptations- in my opinion the best thing about them. It was sad, heartbreaking really, to think of his character just beginning his journey again for me through this reading, while the man who played him so excellently had just passed away. <br /><br />I love the adventure and magic of these books, but I especially love the journey we take with Snape's character. He is everything. So hard to love, but I love him for it.<br /><br />I adore these books. That is all.</span>  <a data-text-id="13288558266498748957" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext Every time I read this book, it delights me all over again. There's nothing like it, accept no substitutes. Boy had read it before, of course, but it was Baby Girl's first time, and she was hooked. The one drawback to reading it aloud is bawling through Hagrid giving Harry the album of pictures of his parents, and through Neville getting 10 points for Gr</span>  <span id="freeText655435461340763629" style="display:none">Reread, September 2012. Every time I read this book, it delights me all over again. There's nothing like it, accept no substitutes. Rowling has given the world a tremendous gift.<br /><br />January 2016: Read the kids the illustrated edition aloud. They loved it. Boy had read it before, of course, but it was Baby Girl's first time, and she was hooked. The one drawback to reading it aloud is bawling through Hagrid giving Harry the album of pictures of his parents, and through Neville getting 10 points for Gryffindor. </span>  <a itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1269177142" />    <a title="Chelsea" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/33481873-chelsea"><img p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810545" href="/book/show/7955579-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=fantasy-dystopia">fantasy-dystopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1269177142" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12792904350102546292">[re-read August 2015] I won't write a full review, since pretty much everyone knows how this book goes! I'm just amazed by the amount of foreshadowing! JK Rowling must have exactly known how the story would evolve. I don't mind that this book is short, when I think of OOTP for example, I find the beginning (before they go to Hogwarts) too long and often boring... </span>          </span>        </div>      <div bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35775020-odette-knappers?shelf=inbezit">inbezit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35775020-odette-knappers?shelf=2016-fictie">2016-fictie</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1200329574" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8713893509012710682">First read: this first edition hardcover is from october 2000, so I guess around that time..?<br /><br />Second read: buddyreread in June/July 2016, with good AND bookish friend <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/2778699-rowie">Rowie</a>, how perfect is that :D.<br /><br />It was a great experience to reread this book for the first time. I loved meeting all the characters again while I already knew them, and I love going back to places I already love. I'm really happy I still like my favorite character, Hagrid, as much, and I'm really happy the book was this good second t</span>  <span id="freeText8713893509012710682" style="display:none">First read: this first edition hardcover is from october 2000, so I guess around that time..?<br /><br />Second read: buddyreread in June/July 2016, with good AND bookish friend <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/2778699-rowie">Rowie</a>, how perfect is that :D.<br /><br />It was a great experience to reread this book for the first time. I loved meeting all the characters again while I already knew them, and I love going back to places I already love. I'm really happy I still like my favorite character, Hagrid, as much, and I'm really happy the book was this good second time around as well. <br /><br />I had some issues with Harry and how some events went down, but I still loved reading this a lot and it's Harry Potter so still 5*!</span>  <a data-text-id="8713893509012710682" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return id="reviewTextContainer178319270" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13471077178974812719"><b>4-4.5 stars</b><br /><br />This is my second time reading <i>Sorcerer's Stone</i>, but it will be my first time reading the rest of the series. I will no longer be an HP virgin! Of course, I've seen all the movies, but I'm ready to live the magic of the actual books. I felt like a kid again reading this! Ron and Hermione are already winning, Harry and that mirror had me tearing up, and I <i>love</i> Dumbledore with his mixture of quiet, powerful wisdom and surprising kookiness...<br /><br />...Onto <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secret</a></span>  <span id="freeText13471077178974812719" style="display:none"><b>4-4.5 stars</b><br /><br />This is my second time reading <i>Sorcerer's Stone</i>, but it will be my first time reading the rest of the series. I will no longer be an HP virgin! Of course, I've seen all the movies, but I'm ready to live the magic of the actual books. I felt like a kid again reading this! Ron and Hermione are already winning, Harry and that mirror had me tearing up, and I <i>love</i> Dumbledore with his mixture of quiet, powerful wisdom and surprising kookiness...<br /><br />...Onto <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>!</span>  <a data-text-id="13471077178974812719" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788478886111" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7929992520691540406">So this is the first time I read Harry Potter (yeah I know WHY???) and now I can officially say it is AMAZING! <br /><br />I'd love to describe how this book made me feel but I just can't find a word to do it so let's say...you know that feeling when you didn't know a part of your heart was missing until you feel like something starts to fill it? Well, it was kind of like that (*starts crying*).<br /><br />Anyway, I recommend it to everyone who hasn't read it yet. I can asure you it's never too late to start reading Ha</span>  <span id="freeText7929992520691540406" style="display:none">So this is the first time I read Harry Potter (yeah I know WHY???) and now I can officially say it is AMAZING! <br /><br />I'd love to describe how this book made me feel but I just can't find a word to do it so let's say...you know that feeling when you didn't know a part of your heart was missing until you feel like something starts to fill it? Well, it was kind of like that (*starts crying*).<br /><br />Anyway, I recommend it to everyone who hasn't read it yet. I can asure you it's never too late to start reading Harry Potter.</span>  <a data-text-id="7929992520691540406" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_9681448" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/9681448" />    <a title="Mariel" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/647547-mariel"><img alt="Mariel" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451321467p2/647547.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/9681448?book_show_action=false">Nov 29, 2010</a>      <a title="Mariel" class="user" name="Mariel" href="/user/show/647547-mariel">Mariel</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Harry is the one I'll marry</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Mariel by: </span>      Potter you rotter  </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer9681448" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11141258349907648675">I'm not the usual Harry Potter fan, I don't think. <br /><br />To the well organized mind death is but the next great adventure." - Albus Dumbledore I don't wanna die! Who cares? My favorite Dumbledore is Aberforth. Y'know, the one who performed an experimental charm on goats and got sent to appear before the ministry for it. Albus isn't even sure he can read, for that matter. I'm more Aberforth on the wisdom scale, fo' sho'. (I once asked JK Rowling what the charm was. She said my guess was as good as hers</span>  <span id="freeText11141258349907648675" style="display:none">I'm not the usual Harry Potter fan, I don't think. <br /><br />To the well organized mind death is but the next great adventure." - Albus Dumbledore I don't wanna die! Who cares? My favorite Dumbledore is Aberforth. Y'know, the one who performed an experimental charm on goats and got sent to appear before the ministry for it. Albus isn't even sure he can read, for that matter. I'm more Aberforth on the wisdom scale, fo' sho'. (I once asked JK Rowling what the charm was. She said my guess was as good as hers. She also laughed evilly. I have my answer.) Wake up and smell the flowers? Huh? The goats are eating all the flowers and they sure smell experimental pretty. It wasn't as fun after Order of the Phoenix and the bitching commenced. Yeah, there were problems. But I'm not organized, I don't wanna die, and I never really cared how it ended as much as I cared about focusing on the cool little stuff.<br /><br />I got into the series after Prisoner of Azkaban came out and before Goblet of Fire. (So it wasn't the movies or that Daniel Radcliffe was -then- Elijah Wood before he was uglier.) What made me want to read them? The Dursleys. I thought they sounded wonderfully delicious (they are hilarious. I love it when Vernon tells everyone that Harry attends "St. Brutus' Center for Incurably Criminal Boys". His Japanese golfer joke. When playing trivia games with friends I'd piss myself with excitement if I got a muggle question. "Vernon's drill company is called Grunnings! Yes! I'm more amazing than all of you put together!" Wonder why no one plays reindeer games with me anymore...) I love muggles.<br /><br />I loved the stupid shit. No, not the mythology references. Yaaay she read Shakespeare. My Uncle Remus did too. Not even that she listened to The Smiths and The Beatles while coming up with the series (I do love that). I loved the Aberforth goat stuff. I loved the names of Lockhart's books (Gadding with Ghouls, Year with the Yeti, etc.) and the little humor stuff she slips in. I can still quote asshole-y things that Draco Malfoy taunted them with (Potter stinks!) and can't remember the basic plot twists. <br /><br />I was a card carrying Potterite (laminated!). Sigh. I do miss wondering what was going to happen next. I miss having that place to retreat to in my mind. I'd go on my favorite Harry forum and have fun making up theories (I was right about EVERYYTHING *coughs*). I'm jealous of JK Rowling for having that place in her mind. Yeah, I've got my own stories. But I don't think I have as much fun with mine (probably because I'm not a sadistic murderer like she is). <br /><br />I liked the books better before they grew up. Rowling couldn't write a love story for anything. I hated it whenever Ron was mad at Harry. My favorite Buffy seasons to watch when depressed are the first three because the core group are still together. I love the togetherness. (Aberforth was eventually important in the last book. That almost ruined it.)<br /><br />P.s. In case I didn't look dorky enough... I used to get into rabid debates about the English to American changes with the transatlantic fans. They were all like: "Americans are so dumb that you don't understand what Philosopher means." I delivered eighteen shots to their stomach with my comebacks about Lee not being black in their versions, JK Rowlings name being JK in the first place (it doesn't mean Just Kidding. The publishers thought boys wouldn't read a female author), and their effing ugly covers (English kids lose so often. No Edward Gorey for Joan Aiken's books!). I did know that jumper meant sweater. It's not just a Hayden Christensen vehicle.</span>  <a data-text-id="11141258349907648675" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_9681448" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 9681448, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">3 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/9681448?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_9681448' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/9681448/comments?reverse=true">View all 3 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_9681448' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 9681448, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_855877673" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/855877673" />    <a title="Sharon" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10827825-sharon"><img alt="Sharon" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1462601237p2/10827825.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/855877673?book_show_action=false">Dec 14, 2015</a>      <a title="Sharon" class="user" name="Sharon" href="/user/show/10827825-sharon">Sharon</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855652" href="/book/show/22841994-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10827825-sharon?shelf=reviewed-2015">reviewed-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer855877673" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4405854637513303948">I found the idea of this series of books wonderful. When they were released there were not a lot of children's books that were set in the world of magic. I think for me the greatest thing about this book is, it teaches children and adults alike that, you can achieve anything you wish even when you think that it is impossible. I also think the theme of friendship is important, people can be friends whether you agree with everything about them or not, Hermione is a great example of that throughout</span>  <span id="freeText4405854637513303948" style="display:none">I found the idea of this series of books wonderful. When they were released there were not a lot of children's books that were set in the world of magic. I think for me the greatest thing about this book is, it teaches children and adults alike that, you can achieve anything you wish even when you think that it is impossible. I also think the theme of friendship is important, people can be friends whether you agree with everything about them or not, Hermione is a great example of that throughout the book, she is more of a straight-laced student but she befriends Ron and Harry. She tells them it is to keep them out of trouble, but I believe deep down she is actually happy that she has found people that like a bit of adventure, it is something new to her. <br /><br />One aspect of the story that there has been a lot of discussion about is, why Harry was left with the Dursley's after the death of his parents. Although it is clear that Harry is not treated very well at all, I think this was the best place for Harry to grow up. Although he cannot understand why they do not like him because of his magical ability, they teach Harry a very valuable lesson...kindness, when he comes across all different kinds of people at Hogwarts, he is more prone to showing kindness to them after the way he has been treated by the Dursley's. They also have taught him how to stand up for himself when he is taunted by Draco Malfoy.<br /><br />Rowling has the ability to create a world that every reader of these books wishes to enter and never leave. With owls that deliver the mail, a magical school where anything is possible and lets not forget the moving pictures, Hogwarts is a place that will live in the hearts of fans for years to come. <br /><br />All and all a great start to what looks like a fantastic series. If you are a fan of all things magical and have not delved into the world of Harry Potter yet, I would highly recommend you give this series a chance.<br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="4405854637513303948" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1425021125" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1425021125" />    <a title="Cris" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/33748885-cris"><img alt="Cris" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1407423719p2/33748885.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1425021125?book_show_action=false">Dec 06, 2015</a>      <a title="Cris" class="user" name="Cris" href="/user/show/33748885-cris">Cris</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408845646" href="/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1425021125" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14137093330714833453">Es muy difU+00EDcil escribir una reseU+00F1a sobre una saga que me ha acompaU+00F1ado en tantos momentos diferentes de mi vida. TodavU+00EDa recuerdo cuando mis padres me regalaron U+2018Harry Potter y el prisionero de AzkabanU+2019 y alucinU+00E9 en colores con el mundo que me encontrU+00E9 entre sus pU+00E1ginas. TendrU+00EDa 11 o 12 aU+00F1os y creo que fue perfecto cruzarme con esta historia por aquel entonces. Inmediatamente me enterU+00E9 de que lo que acababa de leer era la tercera entrega de una serie y fui corriendo a hacerme con los dos</span>  <span id="freeText14137093330714833453" style="display:none">Es muy difU+00EDcil escribir una reseU+00F1a sobre una saga que me ha acompaU+00F1ado en tantos momentos diferentes de mi vida. TodavU+00EDa recuerdo cuando mis padres me regalaron U+2018Harry Potter y el prisionero de AzkabanU+2019 y alucinU+00E9 en colores con el mundo que me encontrU+00E9 entre sus pU+00E1ginas. TendrU+00EDa 11 o 12 aU+00F1os y creo que fue perfecto cruzarme con esta historia por aquel entonces. Inmediatamente me enterU+00E9 de que lo que acababa de leer era la tercera entrega de una serie y fui corriendo a hacerme con los dos anteriores, que leU+00ED en cuestiU+00F3n de dU+00EDas. Entiendo perfectamente que supusiera el acercamiento a la literatura para miles de niU+00F1os que no habU+00EDan mostrado antes ningU+00FAn interU+00E9s por los libros. Aunque en mi caso yo ya era una lectora regular, no consigo recordar ningU+00FAn otro libro o saga que me hubiera tenido leyendo tantas horas seguidas y en un estado tal de ensimismamiento.<br /><br />ReseU+00F1a completa y mi versiU+00F3n de la portada en <a target="_blank" href="http://sidumbledorefueralibrero.com/2015/12/06/harry-potter-and-the-philosophers-stone-de-j-k-rowling/" rel="nofollow">http://sidumbledorefueralibrero.com/2...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="14137093330714833453" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>      <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1425021125" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=1425021125&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1425021125'><a id="like_count_review_1425021125" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1425021125?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">29 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1425021125" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1425021125" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=29&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1425021125&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1425021125" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1425021125, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">2 itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/363148348" />    <a title="Maureen" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10762033-maureen"><img alt="Maureen" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398557569p2/10762033.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/363148348?book_show_action=false">Dec 03, 2014</a>      <a title="Maureen" class="user" name="Maureen" href="/user/show/10762033-maureen">Maureen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer363148348" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12044817297830355884">I LOVE Harry Potter, fantastic start to the series.<br /><br />Reread December 2014 for #HarryXmasToYou<br /><br />There are SO MANY foreshadowing things I never noticed before! Like the centaurs talking about the innocent being the first to die? And just so many things just mentioned that come up later, the dragon in Gringotts, Dittany, Sirius Black, Etc.<br />There's also a lot of things I've forgotten weren't in the movie, which is crazy! But so good. I love it just as much IF NOT EVEN MORE.<br /><br /></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" U+2113 U+2113 U+03B1 U+044F ScU+044F U+03C5 U+0442 U+03B9 U+03B7 U+0443 U+271E</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=way-better-than-i-thought">way-better-than-i-thought</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=i-regret-not-reading-this-sooner">i-regret-not-reading-this-sooner</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=all-the-right-books-challenge">all-the-right-books-challenge</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24407332-s-sc?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1321888040" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2114516190580936150"><blockquote> <b> <i>U+201CYou haven't got a letter on yours," George observed. "I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.U+201D</i> </b> </blockquote><br><a href="https://stellarscrutinyblog.wordpress.com/2015/11/08/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-harry-potter-1-by-j-k-rowling/" rel="nofollow">Originally posted on Stellar Scrutiny Book Blog.</a><br><br><b>Well, it turns out all those Muggles were rightU+2026</b> <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429979195ra/14655508.gif" width="350" height="150" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I didnU+2019t enjoy reading until a few years ago. Having suffered through so many years of school required reading, I couldnU+2019t look at a book without thinking of essays! Not to mention my distaste for writing at the time. All that changed ho</span>  <span id="freeText2114516190580936150" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201CYou haven't got a letter on yours," George observed. "I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br><a href="https://stellarscrutinyblog.wordpress.com/2015/11/08/harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone-harry-potter-1-by-j-k-rowling/" rel="nofollow">Originally posted on Stellar Scrutiny Book Blog.</a><br><br><b>Well, it turns out all those Muggles were rightU+2026</b> <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429979195ra/14655508.gif" width="350" height="150" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I didnU+2019t enjoy reading until a few years ago. Having suffered through so many years of school required reading, I couldnU+2019t look at a book without thinking of essays! Not to mention my distaste for writing at the time. All that changed however, with one book that was so magnificent, it must have been a gift from God! It completely altered my view of books. What was this holy novel, you might be asking? U+2026It wasnU+2019t Harry Potter. It was The Hunger Games. As my eyes were opened to the Young Adult genre, my love of reading began. Shortly after reading The Hunger Games, I made a deal with my friend, who passionately loved the Harry Potter books and had been trying to get me to read them for quite some time. If she read the first Hunger Games book, IU+2019d read the first Harry Potter book. Flash forward a few months, and wouldnU+2019t you know it, my friend read the whole trilogy! Did I breeze through all seven Harry Potter books in a week? HAHAHAHAHA, NO.<br><br>You want to know the best part? That was 3 years agoU+2026<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444407231ra/16497076.gif" alt="description" width="400" height="175" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I had been hearing about Harry Potter since I knew how to read, but really disliked the concept of it. <i>It's just about some stupid boy who goes to a school for wizards! Also, I've heard it rips off Lord of the Rings, so I'm going to stay as far away from it as possible....</i>See, the funny thing about this is, I actually knew nothing about Harry Potter. Nothing. Zip. Nada. I hadn't even seen more than 5 minutes of the movies! *gasps* After having a hundred or so people threatening me to read it, out of fear for my life, I complied. I certainly am glad I did. It was incredible! Absolutely stupendous!<br><br><br><u>  <b>    <i>The Characters</i>  </b></u><br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>"So light a fire!" Harry choked. <br>"Yes...of course...but there's no wood!"<br>"HAVE YOU GONE MAD!" Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><b>Harry.</b><br><br>Undoubtedly, my favorite part of this beautiful book was its beautiful characters. Harry, Hermione, Ron, Fred, George...I love them all! Ironically, Harry was my least favorite of the trio. Not that I didn't like him, but he just didn't have as distinct of a personality as Hermione and Ron. However, I still admired his loyalty and selflessness. I'm really excited to see how his character develops throughout the series.<br><br><b>Hermione.</b><br><br>Is it bad if I see a lot of myself in Hermione? Haha. I can be the occasional smart-alec who gets all up in your business...so, naturally, I love Hermione Granger. She wasn't a Mary Sue! She was intelligent, loyal, and feisty! There really should be more heroines like her. I also have brown hair, brown eyes, and am Muggle-born...<br><br>We're practically the same person.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1447190765ra/16967495.gif" alt="description" width="400" height="170" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Ron.</b><br><br>He was pretty great too. Having four siblings (two of which, are twins), I can relate to him. Ron and Hermione's bickering was positively priceless, and he had more than a few memorable remarks. He was the comedy relief of the whole book, and it wouldn't be the same without him.<br><br><b>Malfoy.</b> <br><br>I was really hoping this little git would get devoured by Fluffy.<br><br><b>Other characters.</b> <br><br>Hagrid, was hilarious, and is it strange if I am particularly fond of Hedwig? Dumbledore didn't really have that much screen time, so I don't really know what to think of him...yet. My favorite, or should I say favorites, are definitely Gred and Froge. *wink* I swear, I was cracking up over every dialogue they had. As a matter of fact, I loved all the Weasleys.<br><br><b>  <i>    <blockquote><br>U+201CNow, you two U+2013 this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've U+2013 you've blown up a toilet or U+2013"<br>"Blown up a toilet? We've never blown up a toilet."<br>"Great idea though, thanks, Mum.U+201D</blockquote>  </i></b><br><br><br><u>  <b>    <i>The World Building</i>  </b></u><br><br>I finally see why everyone admires J.K. Rowling. Hogwarts and the wizard world she creates is whimsically ingenious. Honestly, why can't Quidditch be a real sport? It's fantastic! I want to ride a broom stick and hit flying balls into peoples' faces! All flavor jelly beans? How awesome is that? Apparently, you can buy them from Amazon...including earwax flavor (Eww, wasn't licorice bad enough?). I'm not kidding, look it up! Rowling did a marvelous job of luring me into Potter's world. The only aspect of the universe that puzzles me, is where exactly is Hogwarts? Is it in a different universe from our reality? If so, how are Harry and Ron (I started a wee bit on Chamber of Secrets...as soon as I finished this one) able to fly a car there?!<br><br><br><u>  <b>    <i>What I Loved</i>  </b></u><br><br>U+269C <b>The protagonist and side characters.</b> Lovely, lovely, lovely characters. Rowling did a spectacular job of creating such a hilarious and realistic cast.<br><br>U+269C <b>The plot was highly entertaining.</b> Though a little short, Harry and his friends' adventure was incredibly entertaining and I am especially curious about what other secrets Hogwarts holds...<br><br>U+269C <b>Rowling's writing was pleasant and engaging.</b> A little simple, yes, but short and sweet. What else should I expect from a Middle Grade novel?<br><br><br>U+269C <b>The plot twist in the end.</b> I'm not going to lie, I felt quite childish that I didn't see it coming. It was so obvious, yet I was too busy laughing over Harry swallowing Quidditch balls to notice what was right in front of me.<br><br>U+269C <b>The villains.</b> *claps* Well done, Rowling. Well done.<br><br><br><u>  <b>    <i>What I Didn't Love</i>  </b></u><br><br><b>U+269C The pacing.</b> A short novel? Understandable. An abrupt ending? Inexcusable.<br><br><br><b>  <i>    <u>Final Thoughts</u>  </i></b><br><br>I hope all you Muggles are happy now!  I finally did it!<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1447191144ra/16967517.gif" alt="description" width="400" height="160" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Harry Potter was so wonderful!  I really should've read it all those years ago.  The characters were exceptional, story incredible, writing amiable...honestly, what else can I say, other than it truly was a magical book.  I'll absolutely be finishing this series. :)</span>  <a data-text-id="2114516190580936150" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_274070323" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/274070323" />    <a title="Alejandro" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/665584-alejandro"><img alt="Alejandro" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1328672389p2/665584.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/274070323?book_show_action=false">Sep 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Alejandro" class="user" name="Alejandro" href="/user/show/665584-alejandro">Alejandro</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780590353403" href="/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/665584-alejandro?shelf=novel">novel</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer274070323" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3946822242601174458">It was interesting how I ended reading finally the books of Harry Potter. I'd heard some comment here and there even before of the first film from some acquaintances and I had the general knowledge that it was becoming a phenomenon, but still I didn't feel compelled to read the books. I've been reader all my life but I don't know, I was kinda undecided about it. Then, the films came out, and I started to watch them, and still I wasn't eager to read the books, since I thought, hey, I am watching</span>  <span id="freeText3946822242601174458" style="display:none">It was interesting how I ended reading finally the books of Harry Potter. I'd heard some comment here and there even before of the first film from some acquaintances and I had the general knowledge that it was becoming a phenomenon, but still I didn't feel compelled to read the books. I've been reader all my life but I don't know, I was kinda undecided about it. Then, the films came out, and I started to watch them, and still I wasn't eager to read the books, since I thought, hey, I am watching the films, so what may I am losing about the story (oh boy! how wrong I was!). I had some good surprises because I wasn't reading the books like in the third movie. When I watched the fourth film, <i>Goblet of Fire</i>, I was commenting it with a friend that he was reading the books on Spanish and he told me enough stuff that was in the fourth book <b>BUT</b> it was missed on the fourth film that I decided then to read the books. Oddly enough while my friend was been reading the books on Spanish, he had an edition on English of the first book, this one, and since by then I already was reading on English, he lent me the book. Usually I am quite reluctant to borrow books or that people lent me books. I had some bad experiences borrowing books and while I am dependable and careful about stuff that it's not mine, still I don't want to have books, etc... that are not mine under my care. Still, my friend insisted and he told me that he was glad that somebody read the book since he bought it in an impulse thinking that he would read it but he aborted the mission and he prefer to read on Spanish. Since I wasn't SO convinced to read the books, I ended accepting the offer of that he lent me the book. I started to reading it... <b>OH MY GOODNESS!!!</b> Right in the first pages, when Hagrid mentioned <b>WHO</b> lent him out the flying motorcycle!!! <b>OH MY GOODNESS!!!</b> Keep on mind that I already watched 4 films by then, so reading the identity of the real owner of the motorcycle, mentioned in so casual way and right in the beginning of the saga! <b>OH MY GOODNESS!!!</b> Then, I knew that J.K. Rowling was a wicked genius!!! And this first book kept me surprising me even when I was already reading the fifth book, since certain character that appears in the first book, then I said "Oh, boy, what a boring chapter, why did J.K. bothered to create such unimportant character?" and I was starting to read the fifth book and... "Mmh... where I heard about this character before...where?...mmmh...OH MY GOODNESS!!! NO!!! IT CAN'T BE!!!". By then, I had returned the borrowed book but I had bought my own copy for the collection and I consulted it and POW! Yes, it was the same character!!! Right in the first book!!! So, re-confirmed like for the umpteenth time... J.K. Rowling is a wicked genius!!! I enjoyed a lot reading the first book. J.K. Rowling has a very interesting style of writing. Also, the first book is very good combining the magical world with the normal things that people has to do when kids are beginning school. Going to buy the school supplies. Having to deal different kind of teachers. Some good, some strict, some both. The forming of friendships with schoolmates. Indeed a wonderful and magical book. Highly recommended.</span>  <a data-text-id="3946822242601174458" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review274070323">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" firstReview">      <div id="review_1012980854" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1012980854" />    <a title="Eric Boot" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/33117741-eric-boot"><img alt="Eric Boot" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464627091p2/33117741.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1012980854?book_show_action=false">Aug 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Eric Boot" class="user" name="Eric Boot" href="/user/show/33117741-eric-boot">Eric Boot</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=favs-of-all-times">favs-of-all-times</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=review">review</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=5-stars-totally-freaking-out">5-stars-totally-freaking-out</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33117741-eric-boot?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1012980854" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16768722353136493419">I realize many people have said this and many people can express this way better than I can, but I'll try. I don't know how many times I've read the books so far in my life (I guess around the 5 times) but every time I start reading this series again I realize why this is my favourite series ever (and I'm 99.9% sure it will be never surpassed). I have tried to explain this to others, but I never quite manage to tell why I love these books so much. And I don't know what the Nobel Prize comitee is</span>  <span id="freeText16768722353136493419" style="display:none">I realize many people have said this and many people can express this way better than I can, but I'll try. I don't know how many times I've read the books so far in my life (I guess around the 5 times) but every time I start reading this series again I realize why this is my favourite series ever (and I'm 99.9% sure it will be never surpassed). I have tried to explain this to others, but I never quite manage to tell why I love these books so much. And I don't know what the Nobel Prize comitee is thinking but if there is one person who changed the world by books it's J.K. Rowling. There are many other really, really good books, but if I try to compare them to Harry Potter it mostly goes sth like this:<br /><br />Books I like:<br /><b>1. Harry Potter</b><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />2. The other books <br /><i>(Including Percy Jackson, Throne of Glass and The Mortal Instruments) </i><br /><br />(This is so hard :/ I can't do this)<br /><br /><u>when reading 'normal' books, it often goes as follows:</u><br />I read one hour, then I go on Goodreads/YouTube/I watch the news/whatever for some time (like an hour), I pick up the book again etc. <br /><u>when I'm reading Harry Potter things go more like this:</u><br />I read for 3 hours, then I'm like oh I need to check the news, I watch the news for 5 minutes and I'm like <i>but what am I actually doing? This is nonsense I'D RATHER BE READING</i> <br /><br />And that makes that I can read 5 pretty big books in just one week and feel like I should have read more. <br /><br />And at the same time it makes me ache because I know I've only got two books left. <br /><br />AHHHHHHHHHH<br /><br /><i>(time for another reread)</i><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="16768722353136493419" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer768014819" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16632355356475441423">There is no way I could <b>EVER</b> write a review for this book, so I'm just going to say a few words and leave it at that . . . <br><br><a target="_blank" title="ImageShack - Image And Video Hosting" href="http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/855/q8g.gif/" I can't believe it's been 15 years since I last touched these pages. "It was the best [re-read of my] life, better than winning at Quidditch, or Christmas, or knocking out mountain trolls . . . [I will] never, ever forget."</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"          <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=all-time-favorite-series">all-time-favorite-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=get-it-right-away">get-it-right-away</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6767471-olivia-mccloskey?shelf=boarding-school">boarding-school</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer226968334" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17126119034109119247">"Happiness can be found in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light."<br /><br />Since 1997, the Harry Potter series has enchanted readers, both young and old. Legendary British author, J.K. Rowling's debut novel has gained international acclaim since its initial publication, winning a total of seven awards. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the thrilling first installment of the series where all of the magic began. <br /><br />The novel begins at the small, quiet house on Number Four Pri</span>  <span id="freeText17126119034109119247" style="display:none">"Happiness can be found in the darkest of times, if only one remembers to turn on the light."<br /><br />Since 1997, the Harry Potter series has enchanted readers, both young and old. Legendary British author, J.K. Rowling's debut novel has gained international acclaim since its initial publication, winning a total of seven awards. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone is the thrilling first installment of the series where all of the magic began. <br /><br />The novel begins at the small, quiet house on Number Four Privet Drive, Little Whinging, Surrey where the book's eleven year-old protagonist, Harry Potter, lives in the cupboard under the stairs. He was orphaned at a young age after his parents were killed in a tragic accident and was sent to live with the Dursleys: Aunt Petunia, Uncle Vernon, and their son, Dudley. His only living relatives treat him poorly, making Harry's childhood miserable.<br /><br />Harry's unhappy demeanor is replaced by one of elation when he receives a letter inviting him to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, the finest school for witches and wizards in all of Britain. As the novel unfolds, Harry begins his first year at Hogwarts where he is introduced to the wizarding world, befriends other students, and comes face-to-face with adversity. The twists and turns, mounting suspense, and thrilling perils that Harry encounters render this book life-changning and unforgettable.<br /><br />Rowling has a rare talent for creating believable, realistic characters that gradually change as the story progresses. These characters, as some people would say, possess a certain amount of depth. Their unique personalities and traits distinguish them from the characters in similar novels. Harry embodies all of the characteristics of a true hero: courage, tenacity, and an inclination to protect others. Harry is willing to sacrifice everything, including his own life, to ensure the safety of others. Rowling accurately captures his desire to protect those he loves, whatever the cost.<br /><br />I must admit, Rowling's imagination is extraordinary. Her original vision of a young boy sporting a lighting scar who attended boarding school was transformed into a seven book series teeming with the unimaginable. Rowling's creative prowess enabled her to establish an entirely new world filled with realistic people, magical creatures, and thrilling enchantments. The wizarding world was crafted so thoroughly that it is flawless. No minor detail of this alternate world was excluded, allowing readers to fully immerse themselves in the book.<br /><br />As the plot unfolded, readers received a glimpse of the growing complexity of the series. Rowling introduced specific details throughout the novel which the majority of readers overlook. These seemingly insignificant details, however, have a large impact upon later events within the book. My predictions of the events to come were quite far from the actual events that transpired. The shocking conclusion left me stunned and begging my mother to drive me to Barnes and Noble to purchase the second book.<br /><br />While Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone falls under the "Fantasy" genre, Rowling discretely incorporated many mythological and historical references into the novel, especially those pertaining to the works of Ancient Rome. First and foremost among these allusions is Hagrid's three-headed dog, Fluffy. The concept of such a creature is taken from Greek Mythology; according to legend, Cerberus, a three-headed dog, ferociously guarded the entrance to the Underworld. The only means of subduing Cerberus (and Fluffy, consequently) is the playing of a lyre. Additionally, the Hogwarts motto, "Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus," is Latin for "Never tickle a sleeping dragon." Rowling relies heavily on her knowledge of Latin to create incantations and character names throughout the series.<br /><br />I am most impressed not with the books themselves, but with the author whose rags-to-riches life story has inspired countless people worldwide. J.K. Rowling was born Joanne Kathleen Rowling into a poor family living in Gloucestershire, England. She was accepted at the University of Exeter, where she studied Classics. She was devastated when her mother died shortly after her graduation, having suffered from multiple sclerosis. Several years later, Rowling married Jorge Arantes and gave birth to their daughter, Jessica. The unhappy couple separated 13 months after their marriage. Homeless, penniless, and caring for a newborn, Rowling struggled with depression and contemplated suicide. We almost lost the brilliant, talented mind who is solely responsible for the series that has now become a worldwide phenomenon. Her rags to riches story inspires millions of people in similar situations. Despite her challenges, Rowling's perseverance and determination brought the world of Harry Potter to life.<br /><br />Overall, this series is the most memorable from my childhood. I was originally introduced to the series in third grade and immediately fell in love with the realistic characters, suspenseful plot, and flawless writing style. I was the diehard fan who watched each movie a dozen times at the same movie theater, eventually coming to know the employees at the concessions stand on a first name basis. For Halloween last year, in fact, I dressed up in an old pair of robes, pulled on a wig, and drew a scar on my forehead. And to this day, I find myself reciting quotes from the series. I was crushed after the release of the final book, feeling that part of my childhood had ended with the series. Looking back, I have never once regretted the time I have spent reading and rereading the series, committing it to memory. The Harry Potter series has served as more than a way to pass the time; it has helped to shape the person I am today.</span>  <a data-text-id="17126119034109119247" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review226968334">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link226968334" title="Flag this review as class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_226968334" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 226968334, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">3 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/226968334?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_226968334' style='display:
