ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_134292138" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/134292138" />    <a title="Saoirse Sterling" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling"><img alt="Saoirse Sterling" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478339708p2/4639825.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/134292138?book_show_action=false">Jun 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Saoirse Sterling" class="user" name="Saoirse Sterling" href="/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling">Saoirse Sterling</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bairns">bairns</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=sterling">sterling</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=seen-t-film">seen-t-film</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=childhood">childhood</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ahreet">ahreet</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=infinitevarietybooks">infinitevarietybooks</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=feminine">feminine</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ce20">ce20</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bookshelf">bookshelf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer134292138" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12658698963123474506">[First read: December 2001. 3 stars. <br />Second read: 18th January, 2016. 3 stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target="_blank" href="https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html" rel="nofollow">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br />This was my first read of Harry Potter since 2001. I'm fairly certain I only read it because of the film, which makes me feel neither better or worse for it. <i>and The Philosopher's Stone</i> is a relatively quick read with either very good, wonderful writing or some of the worst writing imaginable. Thankfully, most of the time it wa</span>  <span id="freeText12658698963123474506" style="display:none">[First read: December 2001. 3 stars. <br />Second read: 18th January, 2016. 3 stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target="_blank" href="https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html" rel="nofollow">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br />This was my first read of Harry Potter since 2001. I'm fairly certain I only read it because of the film, which makes me feel neither better or worse for it. <i>and The Philosopher's Stone</i> is a relatively quick read with either very good, wonderful writing or some of the worst writing imaginable. Thankfully, most of the time it was simple children's story writing, which made me feel at home with the book right away.<br /><br />I'll say that the world was rather more lacklustre than I ever really remembered it being. It's quite a small world, really, in this first book and there's not an awful lot of world-building, but such a short book I think that's fair enough. The plot felt a little badly-stitched together in some places, as if they'd be written separately and then threaded together later. There were a few eye-roll moments, and some really ridiculous moments, but there were also some lovely moments, great characters I'd forgotten about and overall a nice flow to how it all panned out.<br /><br />The thing I'm most looking forward to is the development of Hermione. I don't really like Harry all that much, and Ron is just one of those "oh, you're here" characters to me, and my favourite Luna won't be turning up for another four books or so, although I didn't remember that Hermione had been purposefully described as <b>Bossy</b> and I'm so excited to see how she changes in the books. Honestly, she was always my favourite.<br /><br />I'm glad I'm re-reading the series. I'm so glad I'm not going to become obsessed: I'm so glad I'm not going to remove it from my heart altogether, too. It's taken a while, and I needn't have been scared to do this, but that's what happens with <i>Harry Potter</i>, I suppose.</span>  <a data-text-id="12658698963123474506" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" imgcol" href="/user/show/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior"><img alt="Spider the Doof Warrior" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1378350294p2/2348494.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/57105614?book_show_action=false">Nov 25, 2014</a>      <a title="Spider the Doof Warrior" class="user" name="Spider the Doof Warrior" href="/user/show/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior">Spider the Doof Warrior</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2348494-spider-the-doof-warrior?shelf=i-love-this-book">i-love-this-book</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer57105614" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6355634265616560496">First of all, this book ought to be the Philosopher's stone, dang it. We Americans are NOT STUPID.<br />Second of all,this is the book that started it all. It's classic! I first read it in college and I enjoyed it so much, the funny candy names, the characters, the reader is taken along with Harry on a magical adventure they will never forget.<br />I have read this book, this series many times. The enjoyment of it usually doesn't wane. There's maybe a few minor inconsistencies, but all and all it's just too</span>  <span id="freeText6355634265616560496" style="display:none">First of all, this book ought to be the Philosopher's stone, dang it. We Americans are NOT STUPID.<br />Second of all,this is the book that started it all. It's classic! I first read it in college and I enjoyed it so much, the funny candy names, the characters, the reader is taken along with Harry on a magical adventure they will never forget.<br />I have read this book, this series many times. The enjoyment of it usually doesn't wane. There's maybe a few minor inconsistencies, but all and all it's just too enjoyable. It's earl grey tea. It's eating a delicious sundae. It's sprawling in your bed on a weekend just enjoying a good book that doesn't nag you, but it entertains you. It's a great book and you can see why JK Rowling went from being a struggling single mother to a kajillionaire because she is just that good.<br />Not perfect, no writer is, but great enough.<br /><br /><br /><br />It's still very good. But dang it, I hate that Hagrid got everyone in trouble! </span>  <a data-text-id="6355634265616560496" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780590353427" href="/book/show/121121.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=book-to-movie">book-to-movie</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13798293-kristie?shelf=audible">audible</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer438377188" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18124006641072739996">Just finished my third reading of this book, which is saying something for someone who doesn't typically re-read anything. The first time I read this book was the paperback and I bought the rest of the series as they were published. Last time, I listened to the audio and loved Jim Dale's narration, so I just listened to it again. I may actually re-read the paper book at some point too. It is just such a fun story and I have grown to love the characters. I plan to re-read the rest of the series</span>  <span id="freeText18124006641072739996" style="display:none">Just finished my third reading of this book, which is saying something for someone who doesn't typically re-read anything. The first time I read this book was the paperback and I bought the rest of the series as they were published. Last time, I listened to the audio and loved Jim Dale's narration, so I just listened to it again. I may actually re-read the paper book at some point too. It is just such a fun story and I have grown to love the characters. I plan to re-read the rest of the series this time around. <br /><br />Original review: Such a classic. Love the story. I listened to the audio narrated by Jim Dale and he did an amazing job. </span>  <a data-text-id="18124006641072739996" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> style="display:none">TodavU+00EDa no puedo creer una cosa: lo abandonU+00E9 por un tiempo porque se me estaba haciendo aburrido/lento y cuando lo retomU+00E9 me di cuenta de que desde la pU+00E1gina en la que lo abandone en adelante me encantU+00F3, si hubiera leU+00EDdo sU+00F3lo una pU+00E1gina mU+00E1s en su momento lo hubiera terminado en Octubre XD<br />En fin, el principio me pareciU+00F3 muy entretenido, todo lo que pasa en el medio se me hizo taaaaan lento que tuve que abandonarlo y las U+00FAltimas 80 pU+00E1ginas me encantaronU+2665<br /><br />RESEU+00D1A (experiencia personal con el libro SIN SPOILERS): <a target="_blank" href="http://mimundoestaentuspaginas.blogspot.com.ar/2016/02/resena-de-harry-potter-y-la-piedra.html" rel="nofollow">http://mimundoestaentuspaginas.blogsp...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="7644592674023933711" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1526851-will-byrnes?shelf=all-time-favorites-fiction">all-time-favorites-fiction</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer36953952" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14299358753935026946">This is where it all began, where we were introduced to Harry Potter, Rowling's magical world, a series of exciting adventures and the excellent characters and environments she has given to English literature. It set the standard for contemporary fantasy. Rowling make full use of classic literary and mythological references, freeing herself from the confines of the merely topical, while giving it all a daring sense of newness. This series will live forever.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_33809924" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/33809924" />    <a title="asdewi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1302781-asdewi"><img alt="asdewi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1348393946p2/1302781.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/33809924?book_show_action=false">Jan 24, 2013</a>      <a title="asdewi" class="user" name="asdewi" href="/user/show/1302781-asdewi">asdewi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=children-story">children-story</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=5-bintang">5-bintang</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=well-written">well-written</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1302781-asdewi?shelf=i-own">i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer33809924" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15761276931299037260">Wow...nggak kerasa sudah 15 tahun sejak saya kenalan sama Harry Potter dan terpesona pada dunia buatan Madame Rowling ini. Saya tahu kalo saya mestinya bikin review, tapi sebelum itu, rasanya pengen nostalgia saat pertama kenalan sama bocah dengan luka berbentuk petir ini.<br /><br />Saya pertama ketemu Harry Potter di Bras Basah, sekitar akhir 1997. Saat itu saya sedang asyik memilih-milih buku bekas ketika shopkeeper-nya menawari saya buku ini. Dia berpromosi kalo ini buku bagus banget dan sayang banget k</span>  <span id="freeText15761276931299037260" style="display:none">Wow...nggak kerasa sudah 15 tahun sejak saya kenalan sama Harry Potter dan terpesona pada dunia buatan Madame Rowling ini. Saya tahu kalo saya mestinya bikin review, tapi sebelum itu, rasanya pengen nostalgia saat pertama kenalan sama bocah dengan luka berbentuk petir ini.<br /><br />Saya pertama ketemu Harry Potter di Bras Basah, sekitar akhir 1997. Saat itu saya sedang asyik memilih-milih buku bekas ketika shopkeeper-nya menawari saya buku ini. Dia berpromosi kalo ini buku bagus banget dan sayang banget kalo ampe gak saya beli. Dia juga bilang kalo Harry Potter ini lagi happening banget di Inggris sana.<br /><br />Waktu itu saya kenal internet cuma sebatas email dan chatting doang, gak pernah browsing. Saya pun bukan tipe yang langganan majalah ato koran, jadi saya benar-benar gak tahu kalo ada buku berjudul Harry Potter yang lagi booming. Saya malah curiga kalo buku ini adalah buku jelek yang gak laku. Ya logikanya aja, kalo emang tuh buku buagus banget kok udah ada yang jual second-nya di Bras Basah? Dan kalo emang laris buanget, kenapa juga si shopkeeper maksa-maksa saya buat beli? Tebakan saya sih ini buku gak laku dan si shopkeeper mo nepu saya (Oh...how stupid I was).<br />Akhirnya buku Harry Potter 1 itu saya beli juga karena sang shopkeeper menjamin saya boleh tukar dengan buku lain kalo nggak puas. Dan begitulah awalnya saya kenal sama Harry Potter.<br /><br />Rasanya saya gak perlu menulis sinopsis buku ini ato bahkan memberi tahu buku ini termasuk dalam genre apa. I mean, seriously? Sudah 15 tahun lebih sejak demam Harry Potter melanda dunia, it's been all over the news. Kalo bahkan ampe detik ini Anda nggak tahu garis besar cerita Harry Potter, berarti Anda emang gak berminat sama buku ini. Then why bothers now? ;)<br />Jadi lebih baik saya membahas apa yang saya rasakan sewaktu membaca kembali buku ini setelah 15 tahun berlalu.<br /><br />Yang <b>pertama</b> saya rasa sih "aura"nya yang beda. Sewaktu pertama baca Harry Potter dulu, teman-teman saya gak ada yang ngeh sama buku ini (yah sebenernya ampe sekarang temen saya yang baca buku ini juga sedikit sih :| ). Jadi saya heboh sendiri, bahas buku ini sendirian (dan dapat tatapan loe-ngomong-apa-sih dari teman-teman) bahkan fangirling pun sendirian <i>#kasian</i>. Sekarang ini, berkat GR dan BBI, saya jadi kenal banyak orang yang juga ngefans sama Harry Potter bahkan ampe baca bareng. Jelas vibe-nya beda banget. Dan itu menyenangkan. Horeeeee....saya masuk golongan mainstream <i>#hehe</i>.<br /><br />Yang <b>kedua</b>, saya mengubah pandangan saya tentang Harry di buku pertama. Awal baca dulu, saya beranggapan Harry ini kepo banget. <i>"Kenapa sih pusing banget sama kemungkinan Sorcerer Stone dicuri sama Voldemort? Kenapa gak kirim Hedwig aja ke Dumbledore sih buat warning?"</i>-- itu adalah pertanyaan saya dulu.<br />Sekarang saya ngerti kenapa.<br />Seperti yang dibilang Harry, Dumbledore tahu bahwa Harry butuh untuk mencoba melawan karena pertarungan dengan Voldemort itu personal untuk Harry. Gimana pun, Voldemort lah yang membunuh orangtua Harry. Dan Harry sadar kalo Voldemort bisa kembali menyerang dia.<br /><br />Tapi terutama, karena Harry sadar bahwa kembalinya Voldemort dapat membuat dia kehilangan dunia sihir.<br />He was nothing in the muggle world. Gak punya siapa pun dan apa pun. Lalu dia menemukan semuanya di dunia sihir : sahabat, kebahagiaan dan terutama : penerimaan. Penerimaan yang tak pernah dia dapatkan sebelumnya. <br />Gak heran kalo Harry berkeras mempertahankannya. I'd do the same if I were him. I'd fight the nastiest wizard if I have to in order not to let something most precious being taken from me. So I could understand Harry's determination to fight Voldemort even when he's still a kid.<br /><br /><b>Ketiga</b>, ternyata saya sudah suka Ron dari buku ke 1 X).<br />Jangan salah, dari trio itu Ron memang favorit saya kok. Saya suka Ron karena kalimatnya yang witty dan rada sarkastis, belum lagi sindirannya yang tajam. Tapi kualitas itu baru keliatan di buku kedua (ato malah ketiga?). Yang pasti bukan di buku pertama.<br />Dulu saya gak ngerti apa yang bikin saya bersimpati sama Ron sejak awal. Sekarang saya tahu. Karena Ron orang pertama yang "menerima" Harry. Dia gak meremehkan Harry seperti yang dilakukan Malfoy, tapi dia juga gak memujanya secara berlebihan. Dia menganggap Harry sama normalnya dengan dia, and that's enough.<br /><br /><b>Keempat</b>, saya makin kagum dengan persahabatan Ron dan Hermione. They're true bestfriends.<br />Tanpa ragu Ron dan Hermione menemani Harry untuk melawan Voldemort walopun mereka tahu resikonya. I mean, saya ngerti kesetiaan Ron dan Hermione pada Harry di buku ke-7. They've come a long way. Tapi di buku 1? Saat mereka baru kenal 1 tahun kurang serta belum ngeh seberapa parah kondisinya kalo Voldemort kembali berkuasa? That's great.<br /><br /><b>Kelima</b>, perubahan karakter Neville kerasa banget ya. Neville yang penakut dan gak berani membela dirinya sungguh berbeda dengan Neville di buku ke-7. I forgot how awkward, clumsy and shy Neville was. But let's talk about him on the later book.<br /><br /><b>Keenam</b>, wow...penerjemah Harry Potter ini keren sekali ya.<br />Saya sudah pernah sih baca versi Inggris dan terjemahan buku ini (untuk reread yang ini, saya baca versi Inggrisnya lagi), dan dari dulu memang saya tahu penerjemahnya emang canggih. Tapi baru sekarang saya benar-benar ngeh..<br />Mirror of Erised diterjemahkan Cermin Tarsah. Erised yang merupakan anagram dari desire, diterjemahkan jadi tarsah yang anagram dari hasrat. Wow! Dan setelah saya googling, saya dapat info kalo sebenarnya ide Tarsah ini baru kepikir belakangan, menjelang bukunya turun cetak. Karena sang penerjemah berkeras mesti ada padanan yang tepat untuk "erised". Dan iya, beliau emang bener karena erised dan tarsah adalah padanan yang cocok.<br /><br /><b>Ketujuh</b>, hmm....saya tetap gak ngerti kenapa Professor Quirrell gak bisa menyentuh Harry hanya di bagian akhir buku ini? Waktu awal cerita, Harry bertemu Prof. Quirrell di Diagon Alley dan saat itu mereka sudah berjabat tangan. Kok saat itu tangan si Quirrell gak melepuh ya? Padahal sudah jelas kalo Voldemort telah "nebeng" di tubuh Quirrell saat itu.<br /><br /><b>Kedelapan</b>, saya makin kagum deh sama JK Rowling.<br />Oke...saya tahu kalo JKR emang banyak menggunakan bantuan mitos, legenda ato apalah itu dalam ceritanya. So it's not really original. Tapi toh emang gak ada formula yang benar-benar baru. Yang penting sih gimana Rowling bisa meramu bahan yang ada. And she's really good at it.<br /><br />Tapi yang sebenarnya keren dari Rowling adalah : dia benar-benar paham karakter pembacanya.<br />I guess in some points of our life, even if it's just for one time, we ever felt like Harry, who's a misfit and wishing to go to some place new where we could start everything from the scratch or becoming a different people. But not everyone could do that. Apparently Harry is one of those lucky people.<br />Reading Harry's journey gave me happiness. Happiness that comes from knowing that at least there's one person in this world who could fulfill his dreams. It also gave me some hopes that in the end everything will be fine for me too. If this boy whose life was much more miserable than me finally found what he always wanted, how could I not? :)<br /><br />Dan Rowling juga dengan cerdasnya memilih setting di Inggris, suatu tempat yang masih bisa terjangkau dan karenanya masih terasa "dekat". Bukannya tempat jauh antah berantah seperti di Middle Earth sana, atau dunia magic namun tak terjangkau seperti Abarat. Terlibatnya kaum manusia non sihir (aka muggle) juga tempat-tempat di Inggris seperti stasiun King's Cross membuat cerita ini makin terasa dekat di hati, membuat kita (oke...sebenernya sih saya) berani berharap bahwa suatu saat nanti saya juga bisa dapat..ehem...surat saya sendiri. <br />Seorang teman saya bahkan sampe mencoba menekan pilar di tempat yang semestinya jadi peron 9 3/4 waktu dia lagi ada di King's Cross dan waktu salah seorang petugas di sana melihat kelakuan teman saya, si petugas bilang : "You're not the first person who tried looking for that platform." Bhahak....ternyata banyak yang bermimpi ke Hogwarts eh? ;)<br /><br />Dan alasan kenapa saya kasih 5 bintang walopun saya mengakui kalo cerita di buku ini masih kalah spekta dibanding buku-buku berikutnya?<br />Karena ini adalah buku pertama. The one that started it all. Buku ini juga yang bikin saya kenal dan jadi langganan (sampe sekarang) sama sebuah toko di Bras Basah itu. It's always nice to find a new friend because of one certain book.<br /><br />Lastly, just wanna say this : for you all who feel like you don't fit in, who wished for a magical school, or secret garden or magical cupboard that could open secret passage to magical land and still secretly keeping those wish alive : keep on wishing. Keep on hoping. Who knows, maybe your "letter" is on its way now :)</span>  <a data-text-id="15761276931299037260" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/846812430" />    <a title="Kristin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4422684-kristin"><img alt="Kristin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450065875p2/4422684.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/846812430?book_show_action=false">Jun 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Kristin" class="user" name="Kristin" href="/user/show/4422684-kristin">Kristin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780545790352" href="/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Sean </span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Kristin by: </span>      The World  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=young-adult-fantasy">young-adult-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=i-own">i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=5-star-reads">5-star-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=heart-emoji">heart-emoji</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=really-enjoyed">really-enjoyed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=would-recommend">would-recommend</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4422684-kristin?shelf=me-like">me-like</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer846812430" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12448354067514152622">I've honestly read this book so many times I find it kind of boring. {<i>She did not say that!</i>} I think I need to start skipping this when I do my re-reads for awhile because I have this <b>memorized</b>. *Please be aware that for many of my formative years in middle school and high school I only had access to books 1-4 as J.K. was still <s>tormenting her audience</s> working on finishing her series. So I have read this particular book no less than 100 times - no hyperbole in that statement I swear.*<br><br>This is my r</span>  <span id="freeText12448354067514152622" style="display:none">I've honestly read this book so many times I find it kind of boring. {<i>She did not say that!</i>} I think I need to start skipping this when I do my re-reads for awhile because I have this <b>memorized</b>. *Please be aware that for many of my formative years in middle school and high school I only had access to books 1-4 as J.K. was still <s>tormenting her audience</s> working on finishing her series. So I have read this particular book no less than 100 times - no hyperbole in that statement I swear.*<br><br>This is my review of the illustrated version which I found to be an absolute gem and a <b>must own</b> for all Harry Potter fanatics, such as myself. Before I share some photos of my favorite illustrations here are some thoughts about the overall book: <br><br>This may be one of those things that is more of a <i>collectors item</i> versus an essential book for reading. It was fun and offered me a whole different experience to reading the book in general, but I'm not so sure I would be so quick to pick it up again for <i>pure reading purposes</i>. It is very large and heavy. It is awkward to hold and can be difficult to read if you do your reading in bed (guilty). Like I mentioned, it enhances the reading experience but not completely essential to enjoying the book. <br><br>Now, I don't have kids and the last picture book I read was Berenstein Bears. I did personally find the images to be on the darker side and more wacky and whimsical instead of soft and child-like (whatever that means). I feel like these illustrations may appeal to more adults than kids but I don't read to kids before bed or even know what kids like. I don't even have the faintest idea who Jim Kay illustrates for so take that tidbit with a grain of salt. <br><br>Here are some of my favorite illustrations so enjoy!<br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/e71826a9-1add-4b29-aaa5-74a4b3a93ec0_zpszheuhqk3.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449888420i/17353816._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo e71826a9-1add-4b29-aaa5-74a4b3a93ec0_zpszheuhqk3.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>The house in the middle of the ocean.<br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/2f670f04-33d0-49d2-85eb-f4266486719d_zpsyxe4n6ku.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449888606i/17353850._SY540_.jpg" alt=" photo 2f670f04-33d0-49d2-85eb-f4266486719d_zpsyxe4n6ku.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>Harry and Hagrid.<br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/be4ab146-9652-4288-a431-46d034c94d61_zpslgnpocp8.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449888985i/17353912._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo be4ab146-9652-4288-a431-46d034c94d61_zpslgnpocp8.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>Diagon Alley.<br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/f9739824-36d5-4dce-91d4-6f5cbf77e139_zpskoh5gewv.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449889146i/17353937._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo f9739824-36d5-4dce-91d4-6f5cbf77e139_zpskoh5gewv.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>Hogwarts Express - full version of the cover.<br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/1c174dfe-b36e-49ec-8350-f9a16d8e145a_zpsvipsj66u.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449888985i/17353913._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo 1c174dfe-b36e-49ec-8350-f9a16d8e145a_zpsvipsj66u.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>Some insanely cool ghosts. (Prob my fav of the book - not sure why I abbreviated those words)<br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/3e97fc32-aa1a-424c-b000-e0c6c99d3453_zpsbokgojqj.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449889517i/17354033._SY540_.jpg" alt=" photo 3e97fc32-aa1a-424c-b000-e0c6c99d3453_zpsbokgojqj.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>The potions master! <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Also affectionately referred to as the Half-Blood Prince. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br><a href="http://s1381.photobucket.com/user/Kristin_Tarver/media/Mobile Uploads/a44a6b0e-025b-4480-a166-0876142ffcda_zpsjbt7f50g.jpg.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1449889517i/17354034._SX540_.jpg" alt=" photo a44a6b0e-025b-4480-a166-0876142ffcda_zpsjbt7f50g.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>I <b>loved</b> Hagrid's hut in this book! I would visit this place every weekend too if I could!!!!<br><br>So there's that for you! I really just posted all of these for Sean so I hope he enjoys them!</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="12448354067514152622" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_582889789" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/582889789" />    <a title="Angela" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4255477-angela"><img alt="Angela" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398251387p2/4255477.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/582889789?book_show_action=false">Mar 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Angela" class="user" name="Angela" href="/user/show/4255477-angela">Angela</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/13570308-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read">2013-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read-sequels">2013-read-sequels</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=kindle">kindle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=buddy-read-cory">buddy-read-cory</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2016-read">2016-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer582889789" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9209097822129950840">I've read this book a few of dozen times over the years. I've tried, each time, to figure out how to put into words my feelings on it. I fail every time. But here I am, trying once again. I'm going to try and speak of just this book in this review - so (beyond these few statements) I won't touch on how incredibly built the series is. Each book is builds on the ones before it, widening and strengthening the world. There are foreshadowings and moments peppered throughout the series that sometimes</span>  <span id="freeText9209097822129950840" style="display:none">I've read this book a few of dozen times over the years. I've tried, each time, to figure out how to put into words my feelings on it. I fail every time. But here I am, trying once again. I'm going to try and speak of just this book in this review - so (beyond these few statements) I won't touch on how incredibly built the series is. Each book is builds on the ones before it, widening and strengthening the world. There are foreshadowings and moments peppered throughout the series that sometimes don't come into play for many books to come. As Harry grows and becomes more mature, so too do these books. It's something that's almost impossible to realize here, in the first one, and that I still appreciate each and every time I pick up this series.<br />When I first picked up Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone I had no idea the impact it would have on my life. It was just a story, about a boy that finds out he's a wizard and has to fight the forces of evil. That's what I thought when I started it that first time. <br /><br />Very quickly I was drawn into the world of magic that J.K. Rowling penned, surrounded by witches and wizards, magic, and muggles. When I try to examine my feelings for this (and all future books), I run into the problem of not being able to quantify what makes it so special. <br />The story is a classic; boy finds out he's special, learns about world, fights evil, wins. The world is intricate and fun, with a lot of cleverness - plays on words, simple ciphers, and logic puzzles made me smile - while still being straightforward. The characters, though varied and three-dimensional, are fairly standard.<br /><br />And yet, this all combines into this wonderful, fantastical world that pulls me in and makes me wonder what's hiding behind that brick wall over there, or what I might be missing out of the corner of my eye.<br /><br />I remember, distinctly, the feeling of sorrow that I had upon finishing this first book and realizing I was already too old to get a letter to Hogwarts. The world is so enchanting that I can't help but want to be a part of it. It's all about the feeling that it evokes in me. It makes me feel like there's magic in the world, and it's not necessarily the turn-a-mouse-into-a-snuff-box type of magic, or the type where the chess pieces actually fight each other (though, how awesome would that be?). It's the type where friendship is stronger than anything that gets thrown at it. Where people, kids, can fight against injustice and wrong - and win. It lets you know that life isn't always fair, and that you might have to battle against things that are scary and horrible, but the happiness at the end is always worth it.<br /><br />And I suppose that's what keeps me coming back, time and time again, to re-read, revisit, and relive this story. It makes me feel a part of something amazing.<br /><br />And that is definitely magical.<br /><br />Review also available at <a href="http://thebookeaters.net/2016/03/09/review-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone/" rel="nofollow">The Book Eaters</a><br /><br />Harry Potter holds a forever-place in my heart. His story is one of my favorites ever. This re-read just reinforced that thought. </span>  <a data-text-id="9209097822129950840" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review582889789">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a href="/flaggedew?resource_id=582889789&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_582889789'><a id="like_count_review_582889789" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/582889789?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">24 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_582889789" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_582889789" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=24&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=582889789&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/582889789?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_582889789' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_44834361" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/44834361" />    <a title="Gabrielle" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1163731-gabrielle"><img alt="Gabrielle" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1213826226p2/1163731.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/44834361?book_show_action=false">Jan 30, 2009</a>      <a title="Gabrielle" class="user" name="Gabrielle" href="/user/show/1163731-gabrielle">Gabrielle</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer44834361" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8188024269711021837">Pathetic. Really pathetic.<br /><br />Harry Potter is more of a Mary-Sue than Eragon. More than Nancy Drew. More than the worst of fanfiction I've seen.<br /><br />He's rich, popular and famous for absolutely nothing of his own doing. He destroys the power of the big bad guy before he's a year old. He has the whole angsty past down pat. He instantly becomes the best at flying without ever having done it before, wasting all the older and more experienced flyers. And get this - he fries bad guys when they touch his skin</span>  <span id="freeText8188024269711021837" style="display:none">Pathetic. Really pathetic.<br /><br />Harry Potter is more of a Mary-Sue than Eragon. More than Nancy Drew. More than the worst of fanfiction I've seen.<br /><br />He's rich, popular and famous for absolutely nothing of his own doing. He destroys the power of the big bad guy before he's a year old. He has the whole angsty past down pat. He instantly becomes the best at flying without ever having done it before, wasting all the older and more experienced flyers. And get this - he fries bad guys when they touch his skin because the power of his mother's love is so amazing that it protects him.<br /><br />I mean, gosh, the only Sueish habit we aren't subjected to is multipage rants on his appearance each morning. Or the devoted unicorn of unusual powers, of course, but I'm expecting him to show up in the very next book. After all, she has to keep some plot devices for the next one, doesn't she? Can't put all her brilliant twists out at once...<br /><br />*heavy sarcasm*<br /><br />Don't even get me started on the plot. Epic failure. 'Nuff said.<br /><br />Harry wasn't any excuse for a hero. He did nothing, he just sat around and things happened to him. End of story. His fame was inherited, his fortune was inherited, he lived with his relations and allowed them to bully him, and couldn't even manage to read his own mail. His wonderful skills were not worked at and studied for years but picked up instantly, and he bet the bad guys by electrocuting them with his infamous zapper skin.<br /><br />I could go on for hours. The thing that really gets to me is that <i>this</i> is the great literature of our age? What hope is there for any decent writers if all kids want to read is this utter garbage? What hope is there for the world if kids are growing up thinking this is good literature?<br /><br />This is a dangerous book. It made me consider both suicide and mass homicide, and it is definitely not suitable for children.</span>  <a data-text-id="8188024269711021837" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review44834361">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link44834361" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=44834361&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_44834361'><a id="like_count_review_44834361" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/44834361?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">25 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_44834361" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_44834361" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=25&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=44834361&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_44834361" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 44834361, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">21 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/44834361?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_44834361' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/44834361/comments?reverse=true">View all 21 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_154578247" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Emi" href="/user/show/55370673-emi"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assetsophoto/user/f_25x33-d79c46f9428d2aea1444d67c091766a6.png" alt="F 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/55370673-emi">Emi</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer862386997564451374">It's a "Mary Sue" BECAUSE IT STARTED ALL OF IT. And also Harry knows that he inherited all the fame. It's actually a main point in the story. And it's</span>  <span id="freeText862386997564451374" style="display:none">It's a "Mary Sue" BECAUSE IT STARTED ALL OF IT. And also Harry knows that he inherited all the fame. It's actually a main point in the story. And it's not like other real people haven't inherited fame.I respect that it is your opinion and that I have no right to bash your opinion. So best of luck.</span>  <a data-text-id="862386997564451374" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jul 21, 2016 07:50PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_154653269" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Polandmangoes12" class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_542217182" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/542217182" />    <a title="Mizuki" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16842102-mizuki"><img alt="Mizuki" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1368277474p2/16842102.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/542217182?book_show_action=false">Oct 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Mizuki" class="user" name="Mizuki" href="/user/show/16842102-mizuki">Mizuki</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer542217182" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10929619113309683092">Before I say anything, I want to show you the anime I watched in the cinema when I was a five years old kid:<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1383822355i/6677236.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>After that my parents bought me My Neighbor Totoro storybook and many other storybooks also by Studio Ghibli. I read each of these books until they fell apart.<br><br>I hope that might help you to understand why I have never been impressed by the Harry Potter series.<br><br><i>Edited@01/10/2016:</i><br><br>Although I usually don't have many good things to say about Harry Potter series, but this animinized (or manga) ver</span>  <span id="freeText10929619113309683092" style="display:none">Before I say anything, I want to show you the anime I watched in the cinema when I was a five years old kid:<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1383822355i/6677236.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>After that my parents bought me My Neighbor Totoro storybook and many other storybooks also by Studio Ghibli. I read each of these books until they fell apart.<br><br>I hope that might help you to understand why I have never been impressed by the Harry Potter series.<br><br><i>Edited@01/10/2016:</i><br><br>Although I usually don't have many good things to say about Harry Potter series, but this animinized (or manga) version of HP is so adorable: <a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qxNES79fPY" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qxNE...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="10929619113309683092" href="#" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer810964657619581868">No os pasa que siempre llega un momento en el aU+00F1o en el que decU+00EDs: <i>uf, quU+00E9 ganas de releer Harry Potter.</i> Entonces te sientes mal porque tienes un montU+00F3n de libros por leer en casa y los de HP ya los has leU+00EDdo mil millones de veces, pero aU+00FAn asU+00ED lo haces igualmente.<br /><br />Y bueno, poco tengo yo quU+00E9 decir de esta maravilla de libro y de saga. Leer la ediciU+00F3n ilustrada ha sido una gozada, las ilustraciones son preciosas y representan muy bien el espU+00EDritu del libro. He disfrutado de esta historia tanto com</span>  <span id="freeText810964657619581868" style="display:none">No os pasa que siempre llega un momento en el aU+00F1o en el que decU+00EDs: <i>uf, quU+00E9 ganas de releer Harry Potter.</i> Entonces te sientes mal porque tienes un montU+00F3n de libros por leer en casa y los de HP ya los has leU+00EDdo mil millones de veces, pero aU+00FAn asU+00ED lo haces igualmente.<br /><br />Y bueno, poco tengo yo quU+00E9 decir de esta maravilla de libro y de saga. Leer la ediciU+00F3n ilustrada ha sido una gozada, las ilustraciones son preciosas y representan muy bien el espU+00EDritu del libro. He disfrutado de esta historia tanto como cada vez que la leo. La magia de Hogwarts, supongo.<br /><br />Tampoco me quiero alargar porque no voy a decir nada de este libro que no se haya dicho ya. <br /><br /><b>Maravilloso.</b><br /> Fin.</span>  <a class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1418783456" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1336036990031061038"><b>RE-read</b><br />There are things that get less beautiful every time you see them , Somehow you get accustomed to their charm . It's not that beauty itself is lost , you just aren't startled or awed by it anymore. <br /><b>And</b> There are things that just get more beautiful every new time . Harry potter is one , for the very second time my heart is a joyous weight .<br />And I dont think i should proceed , i dont think i even need to write a review . For if i decide on writing a review to do the book justice , i should wr</span>  <span id="freeText1336036990031061038" style="display:none"><b>RE-read</b><br />There are things that get less beautiful every time you see them , Somehow you get accustomed to their charm . It's not that beauty itself is lost , you just aren't startled or awed by it anymore. <br /><b>And</b> There are things that just get more beautiful every new time . Harry potter is one , for the very second time my heart is a joyous weight .<br />And I dont think i should proceed , i dont think i even need to write a review . For if i decide on writing a review to do the book justice , i should write a very long one and there is this fact : whatever what i will say , whatever what i will write is most certainly already said and written . </span>  <a data-text-id="1336036990031061038" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/431944347" />    <a title="Alex U+2623 Deranged KittyCat U+2623" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat"><img alt="Alex U+2623 Deranged KittyCat U+2623" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459538128p2/13555222.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/431944347?book_show_action=false">Oct 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Alex U+2623 Deranged KittyCat U+2623" class="user" name="Alex U+2623 Deranged KittyCat U+2623" href="/user/show/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat">Alex U+2623 Deranged KittyCat U+2623</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13555222-alex-deranged-kittycat?shelf=magic">magic</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer431944347" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11432602050386966228">This might just be the very first book I've ever read in English. I was in high school at the time. I remember desperately trying to find out the meaning of the word "tantrum". Hahaha! The good old days. I need to find the time to reread this series, and its last book. I've never had the strength to finish reading the last one. It launched the year I had my son. It felt too much reading it. I didn't want it to end. That was nine years ago. I think it's high time I read it.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_72481690" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/72481690" />    <a title="Mike (the Paladin)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin"><img alt="Mike (the Paladin)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473374585p2/2187043.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/72481690?book_show_action=false">Feb 28, 2012</a>      <a title="Mike (the Paladin)" class="user" name="Mike (the Paladin)" href="/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin">Mike (the Paladin)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=ya-fantasy">ya-fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer72481690" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7195723816018549309">I read this years ago...my kids were still young.<br /><br />Did it bother anyone else that the publishers assumed Americans were too ignorant to know what the "philosopher's stone" was?<br />yeah, me to.<br /><br />Well anyway, I've read and listened to this (these) and gone back to them several times since. Even though my children are grown I still enjoy this series of books. As originally written the series (considering the time between publication of each volume) actually grew with the first generation of kids who read t</span>  <span id="freeText7195723816018549309" style="display:none">I read this years ago...my kids were still young.<br /><br />Did it bother anyone else that the publishers assumed Americans were too ignorant to know what the "philosopher's stone" was?<br />yeah, me to.<br /><br />Well anyway, I've read and listened to this (these) and gone back to them several times since. Even though my children are grown I still enjoy this series of books. As originally written the series (considering the time between publication of each volume) actually grew with the first generation of kids who read them. They do get gradually darker as they go on, but (originally) the children who'd started were growing to. So, they actually matured with the story. (My only caveat is that parents should be sure their children are mature enough now to move to each volume. Now a ten year old could conceivably buy the set and read them one after the other, so, parents need to be proactive and be sure their "youths" are ready, mature enough for each book.)<br /><br />I'm amazed at how much I still "feel" I know these characters and care about them even though they are fictional in a fantasy world. It's an accomplishment that's seen in the best of novels. Congratulations Ms.Rowling. While they have their flaws these are wonderful books. I had started to give them 4 stars, I give very few 5 star ratings. BUT upon consideration, I realized I'd read them several times and still enjoyed them greatly. These are wonderfully written novels. I rate it 5 stars.<br /><br />This novel opens the story of Harry Potter, the boy who lived. We get to meet Harry, his aunt, uncle and cousin. We are introduced to the "wizarding world" and we go to Hogworts. And of course, we meet Ron and Hermione. I'd say if you're not charmed by this book and don't find yourself caring about Harry and his friends...maybe you should check for Grinch blood??? <br /><br />Enjoy.</span>  <a data-text-id="7195723816018549309" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1525039890" />    <a title="Alexandra" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/51939827-alexandra"><img alt="Alexandra" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454442287p2/51939827.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1525039890?book_show_action=false">Apr 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Alexandra" class="user" name="Alexandra" href="/user/show/51939827-alexandra">Alexandra</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1525039890" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9886690540601277945">Harry Potter changed my life. <br /><br />I don't say this lightly.<br /><br />I was very young when I started reading these, I was 9. The librarian at the ary I was attending pulled me aside and gave me this book to take home to read, her own personal copy, because at the time Harry Potter hadn't been read and approved for the library yet. She may have broke some rules at the time, but I'll bet she doesn't know that breaking that rule made me who I am today.<br /><br />This story is magical. Literally. I re-read this serie</span>  <span id="freeText9886690540601277945" style="display:none">Harry Potter changed my life. <br /><br />I don't say this lightly.<br /><br />I was very young when I started reading these, I was 9. The librarian at the ary I was attending pulled me aside and gave me this book to take home to read, her own personal copy, because at the time Harry Potter hadn't been read and approved for the library yet. She may have broke some rules at the time, but I'll bet she doesn't know that breaking that rule made me who I am today.<br /><br />This story is magical. Literally. I re-read this series every year. Every September. Sometimes twice a year if I feel the need. No matter how old I get, when I pick up these books I feel like a kid again. You don't have to be a kid to love Harry Potter, you don't have to like fantasy to like Harry Potter, you don't even have to be a big reader to love Harry Potter. All you have to do is open your mind (and your heart :').) <br /><br />Please pick up one of these books if you haven't yet. I don't care if you're 6 or 60, they will enlighten you to a whole new world. They will make you feel happiness, sadness, anger, all of the feelings, all of the time. <br /><br />I LOVE YOU J.K. ROWLING. I mean that. haha. </span>  <a data-text-id="9886690540601277945" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1525039890">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1525039890" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=1525039890&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1525039890'><a id="like_count_review_1525039890" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1525039890?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">34 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1525039890" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1525039890" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=34&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1525039890&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1525039890" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1525039890, true, &#39;&#39;); was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13061577-clau-r?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13061577-clau-r?shelf=perfection">perfection</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13061577-clau-r?shelf=hilarious-humor">hilarious-humor</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"     >            <span id="freeTextContainer5232756205906473913">I simply adored this book <3. It was such a fast and funny read! Also, it brought childhood memories back, because I saw the first Harry Potter movie when I was 10 years old, and I was so nostalgic remembering it all <3.<br /><br />I'm not used to read books after I watched the movies, but it'll be that way with my Harry Potter books, because I'm a huge fan of the movies and I've already saw them all. The good thing is that I don't really remember anything at all, haha (just the "big" parts. Oh, and a</span>  <span id="freeText5232756205906473913" style="display:none">I simply adored this book <3. It was such a fast and funny read! Also, it brought childhood memories back, because I saw the first Harry Potter movie when I was 10 years old, and I was so nostalgic remembering it all <3.<br /><br />I'm not used to read books after I watched the movies, but it'll be that way with my Harry Potter books, because I'm a huge fan of the movies and I've already saw them all. The good thing is that I don't really remember anything at all, haha (just the "big" parts. Oh, and also the deaths *cries*). <br /><br />Sooo, I loved this book and I'm impressed by that! I mean, I knew I was going to like it! But it was so much more. Since the first page it had me hooked. J.K. Rowling has such a fluid writing style! I never got bored and I was gasping in some parts even when I knew what was going to happen!<br /><br />Can't wait to read the next books :). </span>  <a data-text-id="5232756205906473913" href="#" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16954025526727929477">Aunque parezca raro leer el primer libro de una saga que ha impactado y encantado a tantos lectores de todas las edades, despuU+00E9s de que hace un buen rato todas sus entregas han sido llevadas a la pantalla grande, con bastante U+00E9xito por cierto, quise comprobar por mi misma cual es la "magia" de Harry Potter, y aquU+00ED estoy terminando "...la piedra filosofal". <br /><br />Debido a que esta primera entrega estaba dirigida principalmente a un pU+00FAblico infantil, pensU+00E9 que me iba a lectores de todas las edades, despuU+00E9s de que hace un buen rato todas sus entregas han sido llevadas a la pantalla grande, con bastante U+00E9xito por cierto, quise comprobar por mi misma cual es la "magia" de Harry Potter, y aquU+00ED estoy terminando "...la piedra filosofal". <br /><br />Debido a que esta primera entrega estaba dirigida principalmente a un pU+00FAblico infantil, pensU+00E9 que me iba a aburrir y lo iba a abandonar, pero sorprendentemente me encontrU+00E9 con un libro fabuloso, emocionante y emotivo, con muy buenos diU+00E1logos y entraU+00F1ables personajes. Sinceramente creo que la pelU+00EDcula no le hace justicia.          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});        } else {          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});        } e.next();            swapContent(lessLink);          }        });      });//]]></script>  <script type="text/javascript">  //<![CDATA[      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');      var $copy;      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_14146679" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/14146679" />    <a title="Chris" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/858949-chris"><img alt="Chris" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1208350750p2/858949.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/14146679?book_show_action=false">Feb 09, 2008</a>      <a title="Chris" class="user" name="Chris" href="/user/show/858949-chris">Chris</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780590353427" href="/book/show/121121.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/858949-chris?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/858949-chris?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer14146679" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15627168335751404131"><i>Since pretty much everyone I know has read these books, I figure reviewing them is pretty pointless. But with the new book coming out in a couple of weeks, I have to go through them beginning to end. To make the reviews more entertaining, I will be doing them in a variety of unexpected formats. For this review, I will be writing as someone incapable of suspending his disbelief.</i><br /><br />This book was terrible! I mean, this author is obviously on drugs or insane or something like that, and why she has been</span>  <span id="freeText15627168335751404131" style="display:none"><i>Since pretty much everyone I know has read these books, I figure reviewing them is pretty pointless. But with the new book coming out in a couple of weeks, I have to go through them beginning to end. To make the reviews more entertaining, I will be doing them in a variety of unexpected formats. For this review, I will be writing as someone incapable of suspending his disbelief.</i><br /><br />This book was terrible! I mean, this author is obviously on drugs or insane or something like that, and why she has been allowed to publish such patent nonsense is beyond me. What is even more horrifying is that so many people, adults and children, are supporting this madwoman. I mean, even some of my friends and family, people I respect have come under her spell!<br /><br />Her spell. Ha! As though such things as spells and magic really exist. I know she and her hoard of followers believe so, but we, the right-thinking, rational people of the world know better, don't we?<br /><br />The beginning was okay, and I had high hopes for it. I thought it might be an interesting story about this family, the Dursleys, who seem to be people after my own heart. Sensible, no-nonsense folk, these, who know what's real and what isn't. But within ten pages, I knew something wasn't right. Think about this - some crazy old man in robes shows up with a tiny device that can put out streetlights from a distance? A cat changes into a woman? Outrageous! And then the flying motorcycle, and nonsensical ravings about magicians and dark lords and curses, and that's where it all started to go downhill.<br /><br />I forced myself to slog through this mess of nonsense, though by the time I got to chapter five, I had pretty much given up. Nothing this book describes could possibly take place in the real world, and it is almost criminal that she should get this kind of fame and attention. She is a font of nonsense and mayhem, poisoning the minds of everyone her work touches. If you haven't read these books, I recommend that you stay away from them. If you have, then I beg you to come to your senses and embrace the real world. Give up this madness and join us over here in the world where truth is truth and Harry Potter is meaningless vapor.</span>  <a data-text-id="15627168335751404131" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="freeTextContainer600670234337245076">Yesterday my friend prodded me to read this book and from many other times, she asked me I said no. After that, she promised she would leave me alone only if I read the first chapter. <br />When I finished the last page of this book I asked, Why in the HELL did I not get to this sooner!!!!??</span>
