</div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_51957271" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/51957271" />    <a title="Meg" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1009267-meg"><img alt="Meg" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1206746236p2/1009267.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/51957271?book_show_action=false">Feb 01, 2010</a>      <a title="Meg" class="user" name="Meg" href="/user/show/1009267-meg">Meg</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Meg by: </span>      ummm... the entire human race?  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1009267-meg?shelf=read-with-kids">read-with-kids</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer51957271" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5435271619601185295">LEAH'S RATING (age 4): 5 STARS<br />RAEF'S RATING (age 6): 4 STARS<br />MEG'S RATING (age--none of your business): 5 STARS<br /><br />LEAH'S REVIEW:<br /><br />I liked the book and I liked the movie. It was exciting when they destroyed the troll.<br /><br />LEAH'S FAVORITE QUOTE:<br /><br />"Welcome!" (Dumbledore) said. "Welcome to a new year at Hogwarts! Before we begin our banquet, I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak! Thank you."<br /><br /><br />RAEF'S REVIEW:<br /><br />They should have figured out the answers faster and had better</span>  <span id="freeText5435271619601185295" style="display:none">LEAH'S RATING (age 4): 5 STARS<br />RAEF'S RATING (age 6): 4 STARS<br />MEG'S RATING (age--none of your business): 5 STARS<br /><br />LEAH'S REVIEW:<br /><br />I liked the book and I liked the movie. It was exciting when they destroyed the troll.<br /><br />LEAH'S FAVORITE QUOTE:<br /><br />"Welcome!" (Dumbledore) said. "Welcome to a new year at Hogwarts! Before we begin our banquet, I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak! Thank you."<br /><br /><br />RAEF'S REVIEW:<br /><br />They should have figured out the answers faster and had better questions. The part I liked was the part when they were trying to get the Sorcerer's Stone at the end. The ending was a surprise.<br /><br />RAEF'S FAVORITE QUOTE:<br /><br />"And what if I wave my wand and nothing happens?"<br />"Throw it away and punch him on the nose," Ron suggested.<br /><br />MEG'S REVIEW:<br /><br />I get it! I finally get Harry Potter! I know it's not exactly rocket science, but I didn't fully understand the obsessive fascination with this series until I read the first book to my kids. They were absolutely RIVETED the entire time. Every magical enchantment was rewarded with an "ooohhh" and "ahhh," every one of Ron's jokes met with hysterical laughter, and I could actually watch my son and daughter grow stronger with each impossible obstacle or horrific monster Harry overcame. In one early scene, Leah literally started crying when Harry thought he would be thrown out of school and sent back to the Dursley's. Now THAT is a sure sign of someone who is LIVING a book, not reading it.<br /><br />So that's why my kids loved it. Here's why *I* loved it: Harry is strong. He stands up for what is right regardless of who stands against him (friend, enemy, authority figure, incorporeal undead wizard of darkness, etc.), which makes him a powerful hero for my 4- and 6-year-old. He's brave, self-sacrificing, and honorable. I think Harry proves his own character, and addresses the book's central theme itself, in a scene he shares with Malfoy near the beginning of his time at Hogwarts. In this particular scene, Malfoy gives a snotty little spiel on how he can introduce Harry to the best wizarding families and help him stay away from the "wrong sort." Harry then refuses to shake Malfoy's hand and responds, "I think I can tell who the wrong sort are for myself, thanks." And isn't that the essence of growing up? Moving away from simply doing what others tell us to do and learning to discern right and wrong for ourselves? Then, as soon as we know what's right, we can work on growing strong enough to stand up for it regardless of who stands against us. Harry is brilliant! Almost as brilliant as his author, who's created a story that is both wonderful and wonderfully told. Bravo!<br /><br />MEG'S FAVORITE QUOTES (and, of course, Dumbledore says most of them):<br /><br />Scars can come in handy.<br /><br />Harry wished he had about eight more eyes. <br /><br />The very dust and silence seemed to tingle with some secret magic.<br /><br />From that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.<br /><br />It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.<br /><br />One can never have enough socks.<br /><br />Death is but the next great adventure.<br /><br />Humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.<br /><br />The truth... is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.<br /><br />To have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever. It is in your very skin.<br /><br />There are all kinds of courage. It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.<br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="5435271619601185295" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1324845572" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1324845572" />    <a title="Donna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6217162-donna"><img alt="Donna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1430955688p2/6217162.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1324845572?book_show_action=false">Nov 04, 2015</a>      <a title="Donna" class="user" name="Donna" href="/user/show/6217162-donna">Donna</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780545790352" href="/book/show/24490481-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6217162-donna?shelf=favorite-books">favorite-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6217162-donna?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6217162-donna?shelf=coming-of-age">coming-of-age</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1324845572" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16995230059219793391">What can I say about this book that hasn't already been said? I can only tell you my experience in reading it for the very first time in the form of the illustrated version. <br /><br />I had such a great time reading this book. I had only watched a handful of the films prior to picking it up and had forgotten many of the scenes, so this story had some surprises for me. But just as wonderful in the surprise department were the amazing illustrations which never intruded upon the story and only enhanced it. O</span>  <span id="freeText16995230059219793391" style="display:none">What can I say about this book that hasn't already been said? I can only tell you my experience in reading it for the very first time in the form of the illustrated version. <br /><br />I had such a great time reading this book. I had only watched a handful of the films prior to picking it up and had forgotten many of the scenes, so this story had some surprises for me. But just as wonderful in the surprise department were the amazing illustrations which never intruded upon the story and only enhanced it. Other than viewing some of them online, I purposefully didn't peek ahead in the book, but waited until the illustrations were revealed as the story unfolded, never knowing what I'd find as I turned each page. Would there be this scene or that one next? And from which perspective would I get to view something--from above, from below, or from straight on? Which character would I get to see next? How much color or detail would there be? How much emotion would be conveyed? Not every page had an official illustration on it, but every page had a little something extra included that made it a treat to look at, whether the page looked marbled or had mysterious looking splotches on it. But even when there were full color illustrations on a page, I was able to use my imagination just as well as if there hadn't been any at all. Mr. Kay really did this book credit. I'm very happy for him since he was so worried that he wouldn't. <a target="_blank" href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/books/what-to-read/harry-potter-illustrated-jim-kay/" rel="nofollow">http://www.telegraph.co.uk/books/what...</a><br /><br />But getting back to the story, which I haven't even talked about yet, what I liked best about it were the growing bonds between the characters, the slippery lines between good and evil, the many forms in which bravery appeared, the hope and optimism stirring in the hearts and minds of the characters, even when all seemed lost, and finally, the magic woven within this book which had nothing to do with the spells cast. <br /><br />I don't know why I waited so long to begin this series, but in a way I'm glad I did, just so I could kick off reading it with this very special edition. I wish I could wait to read all the books in this form, but no way! I'm sure I'll have read the entire series before the next illustrated book comes out. Then I guess I'll just have to read them again in the illustrated form. I will have no problem at all doing that. </span>  <a data-text-id="16995230059219793391" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1564446067?book_show_action=false">Apr 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Tuba U+00D6zkat" class="user" it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9789750802942" href="/book/show/8696793-harry-potter-ve-felsefe-ta">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1564446067" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15714505282440127492">Tabii ki gU+00FCzeldi, sonuU+00E7ta bu Harry Potter. Filmlerini toplasanU+0131z 100 defa izlemiU+015Fimdir, ama iU+00E7imde okumaya dair o his yoktu. Sonra bir gU+00FCn bir gif gU+00F6rdU+00FCm, kitaptan bir kU+0131sU+0131m ve o kU+0131smU+0131n filme yansU+0131yU+0131 U+015F U+0131 vardU+0131. Kitaptan verilen kU+0131sU+0131mda, Dumbledore sakince, "Harry, AteU+015F Kadehi'ne adU+0131nU+0131 sen mi attU+0131n?" diye sordu. diyordu. "SAKU+0130NCE." Filmdeki sahnedeyse Dumbledore o sahnede koU+015Fup fU+0131rlayarak geliyor, Harry'e baU+011F U+0131rarak soruyordu. Ben de sonra kitapta ne kadar farklU+0131 kU+0131sU+0131mlar olabileceU+011Fini dU+00FC U+015F U+00FCndU+00FCm, U+00E7ok</span>  <span id="freeText15714505282440127492" style="display:none">Tabii ki gU+00FCzeldi, sonuU+00E7ta bu Harry Potter. Filmlerini toplasanU+0131z 100 defa izlemiU+015Fimdir, ama iU+00E7imde okumaya dair o his yoktu. Sonra bir gU+00FCn bir gif gU+00F6rdU+00FCm, kitaptan bir kU+0131sU+0131m ve o kU+0131smU+0131n filme yansU+0131yU+0131 U+015F U+0131 vardU+0131. Kitaptan verilen kU+0131sU+0131mda, Dumbledore sakince, "Harry, AteU+015F Kadehi'ne adU+0131nU+0131 sen mi attU+0131n?" diye sordu. diyordu. "SAKU+0130NCE." Filmdeki sahnedeyse Dumbledore o sahnede koU+015Fup fU+0131rlayarak geliyor, Harry'e baU+011F U+0131rarak soruyordu. Ben de sonra kitapta ne kadar farklU+0131 kU+0131sU+0131mlar olabileceU+011Fini dU+00FC U+015F U+00FCndU+00FCm, U+00E7ok sevdiU+011Fim o dU+00FCnyanU+0131n daha fazlasU+0131nU+0131 gU+00F6rebilirim dedim. <br><br>Tabii ki U+00F6nceden de biliyordum bunu, ilk defa kitap uyarlamasU+0131 izlemiyordum. KitaplarU+0131nU+0131 deli gibi okuduU+011Fum, uyarlamalarU+0131nU+0131 izlediU+011Fim U+015Feyler vardU+0131. Ama diyorum ya, iU+00E7imden gelmiyordu. Ama o gifi gU+00F6rU+00FCnce "artU+0131k okumalU+0131yU+0131m" dedim. (Gifi aU+015FaU+011F U+0131 ekliyorum :D ) <br><br>Ve okudum, sevdim. BazU+0131 kU+0131sU+0131mlar farklU+0131 U+00E7 U+0131kU+0131nca mutlu oldum ve filme ne kadar gU+00FCzel uyarladU+0131klarU+0131nU+0131 fark ettim. Cidden, bir kitabU+0131n uyarlamasU+0131 bu kadar gU+00FCzel olabilir :) Hagrid'in Harry'i sevdiU+011Fini biliyordum, ama BU KADAR sevdiU+011Fini bilmiyordum. :) Sondaki hediyesi falan U+00E7ok gU+00FCzeldi. Yasak Orman sahnesinde Neville'in olmasU+0131... Sevdim yani.<br><br>KitabU+0131n U+00E7eviri ya da edisyonundaki bazU+0131 U+015Feyleri sevmedim. SonuU+00E7ta bu bir U+00E7ocuk kitabU+0131, deU+011Fil mi? U+00C7ocuk kitabU+0131 olmasa bile "Mr." ve "Miss" diye bU+0131rakU+0131lmasU+0131 inanU+0131lmaz sinirimi bozdu. "Bay" ve "Bayan" kelimelerinin suyu mu U+00E7 U+0131kmU+0131 U+015FtU+0131? Bir de "ilk kere" lafU+0131 U+00E7ok acayibime gitti. Harry bunu ilk kere gU+00F6rU+00FCyordu. Garip... Bir tane daha vardU+0131 okurken garip bulduU+011Fum ama unutuverdim :)) <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457634368i/18382898.jpg" width="350px" height="350px" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1440346044ra/15964621.gif" width="350px" height="350px" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="15714505282440127492" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/5226952?book_show_action=false">Sep 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Dawn Michelle" class="user" name="Dawn amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="uitext reviewText">ANYONE!!</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite"              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/316327-dawn-michelle?shelf=2016-52-book-challenge">2016-52-book-challenge</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer5226952&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer5226952" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12882373197980115530"><br />Read~November 1, 2001<br />Hardcover<br /><br />I fought the Harry Potter phenom for so long that when I finally did succumb to it, I was blown away at why I resisted for so freaking long!!!!<br />WHAT a great series! But as I am very Type-A, I am going to review each book individually as they all have interesting aspects to them.<br />This is the first book in the series. You meet Harry. You learn a tiny bit about who he is and why he is with his Aunt and Uncle at the very beginning of the book. You learn quickly to DESPISE</span>  <span id="freeText12882373197980115530" style="display:none"><br />Read~November 1, 2001<br />Hardcover<br /><br />I fought the Harry Potter phenom for so long that when I finally did succumb to it, I was blown away at why I resisted for so freaking long!!!!<br />WHAT a great series! But as I am very Type-A, I am going to review each book individually as they all have interesting aspects to them.<br />This is the first book in the series. You meet Harry. You learn a tiny bit about who he is and why he is with his Aunt and Uncle at the very beginning of the book. You learn quickly to DESPISE his Aunt and Uncle and lovely cousin Dudley. ICK!<br />And then you go to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. What an awesome place. I know that there has to be other people other than myself that wish that this was a real place and that we could all go there. Ghosts, pictures that move from one frame to another and 3-headed dogs named Fluffy!<br />You also learn about Voldemort, who is the reason Harry has to live with the Dursley's in the first place. Voldemort killed Harry's parents, and tried to kill Harry, but the spell backfired! So Voldemort is wandering around out in the world just biding his time when he can come back and finish Harry off !!<br />There is so much going on in this book, that I feel you have to read it more than once to get it all. <br />Fantastic read!!!<br /><br />~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br />I have reread this book so many times; I think this is my 6th reread of it [possibly more] and I never kept track. I will be doing so from this point forward! :-)<br />Reread September 18, 2016<br /><br />I still love this book so very much. I love how you discover everything right along with Harry. It is always such a joy to reread this book. </span>  <a data-text-id="12882373197980115530" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> <div class="section">      <div id="review_1103990679" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1103990679" />    <a title="Caitlyn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6322902-caitlyn"><img alt="Caitlyn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1415759502p2/6322902.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1103990679?book_show_action=false">Dec 27, 2015</a>      <a title="Caitlyn" class="user" name="Caitlyn" href="/user/show/6322902-caitlyn">Caitlyn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6322902-caitlyn?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6322902-caitlyn?shelf=ya-reads">ya-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6322902-caitlyn?shelf=my-childhood">my-childhood</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1103990679" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6729152423760063123">I do an annual re-reading of this series around winter time. December is the ideal time to start because Harry Potter has always seemed like a <i>winter</i> type series to me. I don't know why or how I started this tradition but I always attempt to follow it. <br /><br />This is the first year I'll be writing a review for my rereading because I realized I never did a proper one for the books. I think the reason is that I don't think I can find the words to describe just how much I love and adore this series. J.K.</span>  <span id="freeText6729152423760063123" style="display:none">I do an annual re-reading of this series around winter time. December is the ideal time to start because Harry Potter has always seemed like a <i>winter</i> type series to me. I don't know why or how I started this tradition but I always attempt to follow it. <br /><br />This is the first year I'll be writing a review for my rereading because I realized I never did a proper one for the books. I think the reason is that I don't think I can find the words to describe just how much I love and adore this series. J.K. Rowling created a world that I can sink into, that I can immerse myself into at any point in my life. I grew up with Harry, I remember reading GoF when I was 14, knowing that I couldn't have done what Harry did even though we were the same age. I remember realizing I was 18, that eighteen year olds didn't attend Hogwarts anymore. <br /><br />As Harry grew, I grew. I grew as a person, I grew as a fan of this series. I went from standing in line to see GoF with my mom when I was 9 to repurchasing the entire set so that I would have copies in my first apartment. It's always a relief to remember that Harry, Ron, and Hermione have, and never will, change. They have stayed constant during my life. It may sound so cliche but Hogwarts, and these series, will always be there. They are one of my childhood homes that I can visit again and again with just a flip of the cover. </span>  <a data-text-id="6729152423760063123" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1103990679">  <td src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1388976384p2/175635.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/18447489?book_show_action=false">Mar 23, 2008</a>      <a title="Trevor" class="user" name="Trevor" href="/user/show/175635-trevor">Trevor</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/175635-trevor?shelf=children-s-literature">children-s-literature</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer18447489" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11808929665270316414">It wasn't called this at all - but for some reason the title changed in the US and there is no original title versions of this on this site, which is also strange. How terribly odd. <br /><br />Anyway, I read this to the kids - in fact, the first four books to them - just before the tidal wave of popularity. We had just finished reading all the books of Dahl and were looking for something else to be getting on with - and there was this article in the paper saying that the Fundamentalist Christians wanted th</span>  <span id="freeText11808929665270316414" style="display:none">It wasn't called this at all - but for some reason the title changed in the US and there is no original title versions of this on this site, which is also strange. How terribly odd. <br /><br />Anyway, I read this to the kids - in fact, the first four books to them - just before the tidal wave of popularity. We had just finished reading all the books of Dahl and were looking for something else to be getting on with - and there was this article in the paper saying that the Fundamentalist Christians wanted this book banned.<br /><br />Well, let's face it, there is no higher recommendation for a book and I remain grateful to the Christian community for pointing me in the right direction with this one.<br /><br />After the forth book my youngest daughter started reading them to me - there are few joys in life that are surpassed by books or daughters, mixing them together was always going to be a highlight, and how could it not be?<br /><br />These books got better as they went on - the last one was particularly good.</span>  <a data-text-id="11808929665270316414" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1665558808" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1665558808" />    <a title="Tanu Gill" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11326705-tanu-gill"><img alt="Tanu Gill" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478087936p2/11326705.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1665558808?book_show_action=false">Jun 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Tanu Gill" class="user" name="Tanu Gill" href="/user/show/11326705-tanu-gill">Tanu Gill</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1665558808" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13529075832189379548">There are no words I can think to write that can even come near to doing this book justice. This is a series that can only be savoured, like a top-dollar meal in a restaurant. There is only one way to appreciate it, and that is to just inhale every word of it.<br /><br />I had kept this on my mental shelf as a series that I would read one day, just not sure about the timeline. It got hurried along, but I don't regret it for even a single moment. I've enjoyed the movies, but they are, quite easily, dried-out</span>  <span id="freeText13529075832189379548" style="display:none">There are no words I can think to write that can even come near to doing this book justice. This is a series that can only be savoured, like a top-dollar meal in a restaurant. There is only one way to appreciate it, and that is to just inhale every word of it.<br /><br />I had kept this on my mental shelf as a series that I would read one day, just not sure about the timeline. It got hurried along, but I don't regret it for even a single moment. I've enjoyed the movies, but they are, quite easily, dried-out versions of the real deal that is the actual books. I'm just in Hogwarts-heaven right now and lovin' it!;-) </span>  <a data-text-id="13529075832189379548" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1310358493" />    <a title="Michael" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7810503-michael"><img alt="Michael" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464435544p2/7810503.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1310358493?book_show_action=false">Jun 17, 2015</a>      <a title="Michael" class="user" name="Michael" href="/user/show/7810503-michael">Michael</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7810503-michael?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1310358493" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16374305188685903740">Having just read this for the first time, I definitely missed the boat. My taste in books now skews a little darker. At the same time, I'm glad I finally read it and though I don't think it was the best book of all time or anything, I can definitely understand the hype. I'm sure I'll eventually read all the books, in which case I'll understand the fandom and probably be a super fan myself.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8377084-anushka?shelf=awesomeness-quadripled">awesomeness-quadripled</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8377084-anushka?shelf=adapted-on-screen">adapted-on-screen</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3433586679713446814"><b> You don't like this series? Well, fuck off then. You and I are N-E-V-E-R going to get along. </b><br /><br /></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1116433719" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1116433719" />    <a title="Maxwell" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1381728-maxwell"><img alt="Maxwell" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474578952p2/1381728.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1116433719?book_show_action=false">Nov 27, 2014</a>      <a title="Maxwell" class="user" name="Maxwell" href="/user/show/1381728-maxwell">Maxwell</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582889" href="/book/show/17372039-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=i-own-it">i-own-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=2014">2014</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1116433719" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6154398902309817155"><i>Reread November 2014</i><br /><br />Obviously this isn't my first time reading <i>Sorcerer's Stone</i>; I think this is the 3rd reading for me. And as every time before, I loved it immensely. I really am just reminded of how incredible J.K. Rowling is at crafting a story, a whole world, and setting up the rest of the series, while still writing a smart, entertaining children's book. Because in reality, this first book is very young feeling, but it's never dumbed down. <br /><br />Since most people have read this or know the plot,</span>  <span id="freeText6154398902309817155" style="display:none"><i>Reread November 2014</i><br /><br />Obviously this isn't my first time reading <i>Sorcerer's Stone</i>; I think this is the 3rd reading for me. And as every time before, I loved it immensely. I really am just reminded of how incredible J.K. Rowling is at crafting a story, a whole world, and setting up the rest of the series, while still writing a smart, entertaining children's book. Because in reality, this first book is very young feeling, but it's never dumbed down. <br /><br />Since most people have read this or know the plot, I thought I would instead share some fun thoughts I had or noticed upon rereading this book:<br />-What do you think the sorting hat said to Hermione, Ron, or any of the other characters when they tried it on?<br />-Dumbledore's Chocolate Frog card mentions his defeat of Grindewald, a fact that doesn't come to be important until book 6 or 7!<br />-The Weasley twins are hilarious as always, and they know the secret passages already (probably thanks to the Marauder's Map) that shows up in book 3.<br />-I wonder why Hermione wasn't in Ravenclaw. (I'm sure there is some sort of answer for this one, I had just never thought of it before).<br />-I want Mrs. Weasley to knit me a sweater.<br />-The Mirror of Erised's inscription backwards says, "I show not your face but your heart's desire."<br />-In the book, when Harry first finds the Mirror of Erised, he sees a reflection of his mom, dad, and the rest of his family. But in the film it only shows Lily and James. That would've been cool to see in the film.<br />-Apparently, chess is the only thing that Hermione ever lost at (p.217). If she is so smart, don't you think she'd be really good at the strategy of chess?<br />-After seeing Quirrell/Voldemort in the Forbidden Forest, Harry starts to have nightmares about the face dripping unicorn blood. I wonder if this is Voldemort already using Occlumancy on Harry?<br />-In the film, the protections that Harry, Ron, and Hermione have to get through to find the Sorcerer's Stone leave out the troll (placed by Quirrel) and the potions challenge (Snape's). Would've been fun to see Hermione tackle that one.<br />-Voldemort's face on the back of Quirrell's head is described as pale with red, slit eyes like a snake (like movie Voldemort). Why isn't that how they portrayed him in the first film?!<br />-Also, Neville's best exam grade was in Herbology. Aww. <br /><br />Overall, I just thought it was remarkable to note how many things Rowling references already! It makes me even more excited to jump right into <i>Chamber of Secrets</i> next!<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="6154398902309817155" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1116433719">  <td colspan="2">    <div </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1107093480" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1107093480" />    <a title="U+1D04 U+1D00 U+1D0D" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36976651"><img alt="U+1D04 U+1D00 U+1D0D" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465107032p2/36976651.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1107093480?book_show_action=false">Jul 25, 2015</a>      <a title="U+1D04 U+1D00 U+1D0D" class="user" name="U+1D04 U+1D00 U+1D0D" href="/user/show/36976651">U+1D04 U+1D00 U+1D0D</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788478886548" href="/book/show/15868.Harry_Potter_y_la_piedra_filosofal">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36976651?shelf=2015">2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36976651?shelf=on-my-shelf">on-my-shelf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1107093480" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10217406788762968081">Oh shit !! Porfin comencU+00E9 esta saga, era hora !! PensU+00E9 que esta lectura no me iba a sorprender tanto y a gustar tanto ya que habU+00EDa visto la pelU+00EDcula, pero todo lo contrario. A medida que iba leyendo el libro parecU+00EDa que no habU+00EDa visto al pelU+00EDcula. El hecho de que hace un montU+00F3n que no la veU+00EDa de nuevo ayudo un montU+00F3n tambiU+00E9n. Ademas de que obviamente un montU+00F3n de escenas no estU+00E1n en la pelU+00EDcula, o le cambiaron cosas pequeU+00F1as (porque las pelU+00EDculas de hp son bastante fieles, i think).<br>En cuanto a p</span>  <span id="freeText10217406788762968081" style="display:none">Oh shit !! Porfin comencU+00E9 esta saga, era hora !! PensU+00E9 que esta lectura no me iba a sorprender tanto y a gustar tanto ya que habU+00EDa visto la pelU+00EDcula, pero todo lo contrario. A medida que iba leyendo el libro parecU+00EDa que no habU+00EDa visto al pelU+00EDcula. El hecho de que hace un montU+00F3n que no la veU+00EDa de nuevo ayudo un montU+00F3n tambiU+00E9n. Ademas de que obviamente un montU+00F3n de escenas no estU+00E1n en la pelU+00EDcula, o le cambiaron cosas pequeU+00F1as (porque las pelU+00EDculas de hp son bastante fieles, i think).<br>En cuanto a personajes, Harry es uno que a pesar que no haya amado, me encanta esa personalidad de todo a la mierda, yo lo hago igual. Y pensar que es super chico igual ajaja. Hermione es bastante infumable a veces, pero se nota que como amiga es excelente, amo sus ironU+00EDas y su sentido del humor, me encanta !! Ron es otro personaje que me gusta muchU+00EDsimo, es como un gran amigo fiel. Hagrid es como un padre con mentalidad de niU+00F1o ajajaj, me encanta, su personalidad, su sentido del humor, sus bromas, lo fiel que es, etc. Draco es el tU+00EDpico niU+00F1o malvado, que de vez en cuando se manda de las suyas, pero al final de todo, termina perdiendo!! Toma Draco, por gilipollas. <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1428046105ra/14354784.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Le di 5 estrellas porque en este libro se introduce todo lo que es el mundo mU+00E1gico de Hogwarts y de todo este mundo. Es increU+00EDble la imaginaciU+00F3n de esta mujer! Cada cosa que hay en este mundo es increU+00EDble (a no ser los muggles, los muggles son mierda). Me sorprendU+00ED MUCHO en el final, porque sinceramente yo creU+00EDa <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[que Gryffindor ganaba el trofeo de las casas, y estaba terminando el libro y todo declaraba que ganaba Slytherin y como como whaaat? y cuando gano Gryffindor al final fue como YO SABIA BITCHES!! TOMEN GILES <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1428046105ra/14354785.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>La parte final, en la que Ron, Hermione y Harry van en busca de la piedra filosofal, es super intensa y emocionante. Voldemort, hate u.<br>En fin, imposible no amar esta perfecciU+00F3n de libro, espero seguir con el resto pronto !! </["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="10217406788762968081" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27246143-m-ni-muenisbookworld?shelf=feels">feels</a>,               <a id="reviewTextContainer1141023966" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5930231161665649913">This is Harry Potter. And this is his story.<br /><b>J.K. Rowling wrote a fantastic book. And this is not only a childrens book. This is an ALL-Age book. She wrote about a world which is magical and beauiful at the same time. She wrote about creatures and spells which people use today. I am still impressed by this author and her creativity. There is no book I could compare to Harry Potter.</b><br />Without Harry Potter we wouldn't have Harry Potter.<br />Especially the movies have a special place in my heart.</span>          </span>         </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1464250692" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer430898815793069526"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631057._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Rating: 5+/5</b><br><br>A venit U+00EEn sfU+00E2rU+0219it momentul cU+00E2nd pot face U+0219i eu o recenzie pentru una dintre seriile mele preferate: <b>Harry Potter</b>. Primul volum al acestei serii scrise de <b>J.K. Rowling</b>se numeU+0219te <b>Harry Potter U+0219i Piatra FilosofalU+0103</b>U+0219i a apU+0103rut recent la <b>Editura Arthur</b>sub o nouU+0103 traducere care U+00EEi aparU+021Bine lui <b>Florin Bican</b>.<br><br>Nu am mai citit cap-coadU+0103 <b>seria Harry Potter</b> U+00EEn <b>traducerea veche a Ioanei Iepureanu</b> de cU+00E2 U+021Biva ani buni, dar aceea este traducerea cu care eu am crescut U+0219i care m-a atras, U+00EEn ciuda pU+0103reri</span>  <span id="freeText430898815793069526" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631057._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Rating: 5+/5</b><br><br>A venit U+00EEn sfU+00E2rU+0219it momentul cU+00E2nd pot face U+0219i eu o recenzie pentru una dintre seriile mele preferate: <b>Harry Potter</b>. Primul volum al acestei serii scrise de <b>J.K. Rowling</b> se numeU+0219te <b>Harry Potter U+0219i Piatra FilosofalU+0103</b> U+0219i a apU+0103rut recent la <b>Editura Arthur</b> sub o nouU+0103 traducere care U+00EEi aparU+021Bine lui <b>Florin Bican</b>.<br><br>Nu am mai citit cap-coadU+0103 <b>seria Harry Potter</b> U+00EEn <b>traducerea veche a Ioanei Iepureanu</b> de cU+00E2 U+021Biva ani buni, dar aceea este traducerea cu care eu am crescut U+0219i care m-a atras, U+00EEn ciuda pU+0103rerilor negative. AjunsU+0103 acum la o vU+00E2rstU+0103, U+0219i trecutU+0103 prin mai multe cU+0103rU+021Bi, pot spune U+00EEntr-adevU+0103r cU+0103 traducerea unor nume proprii dintr-o limbU+0103 U+00EEn alta, fU+0103rU+0103 a se face referire la numele originale, nu este un lucru bun U+00EEntrucU+00E2t se pierde din farmecul creat de autor.<br><br><b>Florin Bican</b> revine cu o traducere mult mai bunU+0103 din punctul acesta de vedere, numele proprii sunt la fel ca cele din englezU+0103 (<b>Malfoy </b>U+0219i nu <b>ReacredinU+021B U+0103</b>, <b>Quidditch</b> U+0219i nu <b>VU+00E2jhaU+021B</b>, <b>Gryffindor </b>U+0219i nu <b>CercetaU+0219i</b>, etc.).<br><br>Am auzit o serie de <b>discuU+021Bii</b> despre cum <b>traducerea de la Egmont</b> nu era una corectU+0103 cu privire la ce am menU+021Bionat mai sus, dar U+0219i deoarece existau pasaje din cartea originalU+0103 care nu au fost traduse U+00EEn U+00EEntregime. Eu nu am apucat sU+0103 citesc seria <b>HP U+00EEn limba englezU+0103</b> (este U+00EEn proces acest amU+0103nunt), aU+0219a cU+0103 nu pot spune cu certitudine acest lucru, dar adevU+0103rul este cU+0103 am avut senzaU+021Bia cU+0103 traducerea veche era un pic cam simplistU+0103, ca U+0219i cU+00E2nd lipsea ceva pe alocuri.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631058._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Noua traducere</b> de la <b>editura Arthur</b> este <b>U+00EEncU+00E2ntU+0103toare</b>, U+0219i pot spune cU+0103 dupU+0103 ce am fU+0103cut o <b>comparaU+021Bie cu ediU+021Bia de la Egmont</b>, aceastU+0103 nouU+0103 ediU+021Bie este mult mai recomandatU+0103 fiind una completU+0103 U+0219i corectU+0103, sensul ideilor din englezU+0103 nepierzU+00E2ndu-U+0219i originalitatea.<br><br>U+00CEntU+00E2lnim U+0219i aici o serie de traduceri de care sunt sigurU+0103 cU+0103 sunteU+021Bi curioU+0219i: <b>Salcia Plesnitoare</b> (nope, Severus PlesnealU+0103 nu mai existU+0103, U+00EEn cazul U+00EEn care vU+0103 U+00EEntrebaU+021Bi; Severus Snape a rU+0103mas U+0219i U+00EEn traducere - <b>Whomping Willow</b>, <b>Salcia BU+0103tU+0103uU+0219 U+0103</b> U+00EEn traducerea veche), <b>Mageamii </b>(<b>Muggles</b>, sau <b>U+00CEncuiaU+021Bi </b>dupU+0103 traducerea veche), <b>Nick-Cel-Decapitat-Un-Pic</b> (<b>Nearly Headless Nick</b>, <b>Nick Aproape-FU+0103r-de-Cap</b> U+00EEn traducerea veche), <b>Baronul-BU+0103i-de-SU+00E2nge</b> (<b>Bloody Baron</b>, <b>Baronul SU+00E2ngeros</b> U+00EEn traducerea veche), <b>Nimbus DouU+0103 Mii</b> (<b>Nimbus Two Thousand</b>, <b>Nimbus 2000</b> U+00EEn traducerea veche), <b>TrU+00E2ntorul</b> (<b>Scabbers</b>, <b>PungaU+0219ul</b> U+00EEn traducerea veche), etc.<br><br>Aceasta a fost o selecU+021Bie de denumiri care mie mi-au sU+0103rit U+00EEn atenU+021Bie mai mult. Unele dintre ele U+00EEmi plac cum sunU+0103 U+0219i U+00EEn noua traducere, multe U+00EEmi plac U+0219i U+00EEn traducerea veche. Cu toate cU+0103 majoritatea numelor proprii nu au fost traduse, am observat U+0219i mici excepU+021Bii.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631059._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Revenind la <b>povestea cU+0103rU+021Bii</b>, pentru cU+0103 nu am apucat sU+0103 vU+0103 zic nimic U+00EEncU+0103! AceastU+0103 <b>primU+0103 carte a seriei</b> este una <b>absolut magicU+0103</b>. <b>Lumea Harry Potter</b> este una dintre lumile care m-a fascinat U+00EEn copilU+0103rie, cU+0103rtile U+0219i filmele fiind prietenele mele care mU+0103 amuzau U+0219i mU+0103 liniU+0219teau de fiecare datU+0103.<br><br><b>Povestea bU+0103iatului</b> care a reuU+0219it sU+0103 supravieU+021BuiascU+0103 atacului celui mai mare vrU+0103jitor U+00EEntunecat va dU+0103inui probabil U+00EEncU+0103 multU+0103 vreme de acum U+00EEn colo. L-am urmU+0103rit cu drag pe <b>Harry</b> U+00EEn primul lui an U+00EEn care se U+00EEnscrie la <b>U+0219coala de magie Hogwarts</b>, acolo unde au fost U+0219i pU+0103rinU+021Bii sU+0103i pe care nu a apucat sU+0103 U+00EEi cunoascU+0103.<br><br><b>VrU+0103jile</b>, <b>fantomele</b> plutitoare din <b>castelul Hogwarts</b>, bucuria rezolvU+0103rii de <b>mistere</b> a lui <b>Harry</b> alU+0103turi de prietenii sU+0103i <b>Ron </b>U+0219i <b>Hermioane</b>, m-au fU+0103cut sU+0103 U+00EEndrU+0103gesc fiecare capitol al acestei cU+0103rU+021Bi, U+0219i sU+0103 mU+0103 bucur de un univers unde <b>fantasticul</b> abia U+00EE U+0219i deschide aripile, urmU+00E2nd ca urmU+0103toarele cU+0103rU+021Bi sU+0103 mU+0103 dea pe spate din ce U+00EEn ce mai mult.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631060._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>DacU+0103 nu aU+021Bi citit aceastU+0103 carte (serie) pU+00E2nU+0103 acum, eu cred cU+0103 aveU+021Bi acum ocazia sU+0103 vU+0103 apucaU+021Bi de o cU+0103lU+0103torie fantasticU+0103 de care vU+0103 veU+021Bi aminti multU+0103 vreme! Ca sU+0103 fiU+021Bi U+0219i mai atraU+0219i de aceastU+0103 carte, la U+00EEnceput veU+021Bi gU+0103si U+0219i o <b>hartU+0103 interesantU+0103</b> a locurilor de care veU+021Bi auzi U+00EEn <b>lumea magicU+0103 Harry Potter</b>.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631061._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>Ca aspect</b>, <b>noua ediU+021Bie</b> este parU+021Bial mulU+021Bumitoare. U+00CEmi place foarte mult cU+0103 are o <b>copertU+0103 cartonatU+0103</b> care are aproape acelaU+0219i aspect ca U+0219i <b>supracoperta</b> (aceasta din urmU+0103 avU+00E2nd U+00EEn plus un titlu lucios auriu), <b>calitatea paginilor</b> este ok, <b>scrisul</b> este potrivit ca mU+0103rime, avem parte U+0219i de o <b>harta minunatU+0103</b> la U+00EEnceputul cU+0103rU+021Bii, U+00EEnsU+0103 <b>imaginea de pe copertU+0103</b> mi-aU+0219 fi dorit sU+0103 fie U+00EEn U+00EEntregime ca cea originalU+0103. ExistU+0103 numeroase ediU+021Bii pentru coperta primului volum, U+0219i cred cU+0103 se putea lucra mai mult la acest detaliu care uneori este cel mai atractiv pentru mulU+021Bi cititori.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631062._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631063._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631064._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631065._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1451998560i/17631066._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><blockquote><b>Citate:</b><br>"Tocmai ridicase bagheta, cU+00E2nd uU+0219a compartimentului se deschise din nou. BU+0103iatul cu broasca se U+00EEntoarse, de astU+0103 datU+0103 U+00EEnsoU+021Bit de o fatU+0103. Fata purta deja mantia de la Hogwarts.<br>- A vU+0103zut cineva o broascU+0103? A pierdut-o Neville.<br>Vorbea pe un ton autoritat. Avea o claie de pU+0103r U+0219aten, iar dinU+021Bii din faU+021B U+0103 U+00EEi erau cam mari.<br>- Deja i-am spus cU+0103 nu i-am vU+0103zut broasca, o informU+0103 Ron, dar fata nu pU+0103rea sU+0103 asculte ce zice.<br>Se uita la bagheta din mU+00E2na lui.<br>- A, fU+0103ceai o vrajU+0103? Ia sU+0103 vedem.<br>Fata se aU+0219ezU+0103 pe banchetU+0103. Ron pU+0103rea luat prin surprindere.<br>- U+0102 U+0103 U+0103. Bine.<br>U+00CE U+0219i drese glasul.<br><i><br>Margarete, margarinU+0103, raze aurii de soare,<br>U+0218obolanul U+0103sta gras, sU+0103 fie galben la culoare.<br></i><br>AgitU+0103 bagheta, dar nu se U+00EEntU+00E2mplU+0103 nimic. TrU+00E2ntorul rU+0103mase cenuU+0219iu U+0219i adormit." (p.123-124)<br><br>"Era deosebit de greu. Harry U+0219i Seamus roteau bagheta U+0219i U+0219fichiuiau aerul cu ea din rU+0103sputeri, dar pana pe care li se ceruse s-o trimitU+0103 U+00EEn slU+0103vi rU+0103mU+00E2nea U+00EEn faU+021Ba lor nemiU+0219catU+0103. Seamus U+00EE U+0219i pierduse rU+0103bdarea U+00EEn asemenea mU+0103surU+0103, U+00EEncU+00E2t U+00EEi dU+0103du bietei pene un ghiont ajutU+0103tor cu bagheta U+0219i-i dU+0103du foc. Harry trebui sU+0103 stingU+0103 cu pU+0103lU+0103ria flU+0103cU+0103rile izbucnite ca urmare a acestei manevre.<br>Nici Ron, la masa alU+0103turatU+0103, nu pU+0103rea sU+0103 aibU+0103 mai mult noroc.<br>- Wingardium Leviosa! striga el cU+00E2t U+00EEl U+021Binea gura, rotindu-U+0219i braU+021Bele lungi de parcU+0103 era o moarU+0103 de vU+00E2nt.<br>- Nu pronunU+021Bi corect, o auzi Harry pe Hermione repezindu-l. Se spune Wing-gar-dium Levi-o-sa, pronunU+021B U+0103 frumos silava U+00ABgarU+00BB - cu U+00ABaU+00BB lung.<br>- De ce n-o pronunU+021Bi tu, dacU+0103 eU+0219ti aU+0219a deU+0219teaptU+0103? mU+00E2rU+00E2i Ron.<br>Hermione U+00EE U+0219i suflecU+0103 mU+00E2necile robei, U+0219fichiui aerul cu bagheta U+0219i zise:<br>- Wingardium Leviosa!<br>Pana decolU+0103 de pe pupitru U+0219i U+00EEncepu sU+0103 graviteze pe deasupra lor, la o U+00EEnU+0103lU+021Bime apreciabilU+0103.<br>- Bravo, excelent! aplaudU+0103 profesorul Flitwick. AtenU+021Bie, toatU+0103 lumea! DomniU+0219oara Granger a reuU+0219it!<br>La sfU+00E2rU+0219itul orei, Ron era un pachet de nervi." (p.197)<br><br>"- UitaU+021Bi-vU+0103 colo, spuse Hagrid. VedeU+021Bi ceva care strU+0103luceU+0219te pe pU+0103mU+00E2nt? Ceva argintiu? U+0102la-i sU+00E2nge de unicorn. U+00CEn PU+0103dure e un unicorn pe care l-a rU+0103nit ceva, nu se U+0219tie ce. Da' rU+0103u de tot... E a doua oarU+0103 sU+0103ptU+0103mU+00E2na asta cU+00E2nd se U+00EEntU+00E2mplU+0103 aU+0219a ceva. Miercurea trecutU+0103 am gU+0103sit un unicorn mort. De data asta, o sU+0103 U+00EEncercU+0103m sU+0103 gU+0103sim bietu' animal rU+0103nit. S-ar putea sU+0103 trebuiascU+0103 sU+0103-l omorU+00E2m, ca sU+0103 nu se mai chinuie.<br>- U+0218i ce se U+00EEntU+00E2mplU+0103 dacU+0103, U+00EEnainte sU+0103 gU+0103sim noi unicornul, ne gU+0103seU+0219te fiara care l-a rU+0103nit? U+00EEntrebU+0103 Malfoy, incapabil sU+0103-U+0219i ascundU+0103 frica din glas.<br>- Nimic din pU+0103durea asta nu vU+0103 poate face vreun rU+0103u atU+00E2ta vreme cU+00E2t sunteU+021Bi cu mine sau Fang, spuse Hagrid. U+0218i sU+0103 nu vU+0103 abateU+021Bi de la potecU+0103. Gata - acu' ne-mpU+0103rU+021Bim U+00EEn douU+0103 echipe U+0219i urmU+0103m poteca U+00EEn direcU+021Bii opuse. E sU+00E2nge peste tot - tre' sU+0103 se fi tU+00E2rU+00E2t de colo-colo cel puU+021Bin noaptea trecutU+0103.<br>- U+00CEl vreau pe Fang, se repez Malfoy, privind la colU+021Bii lungi ai cU+00E2inelui.<br>- N-ai decU+00E2t, da' te previn, e un fricos, spuse Hagrid. Io, Harry U+0219i Hermione o s-o luU+0103m U+00EEntr-o parte U+0219i Malfoy, Neville U+0219i Fang - U+00EEn cealaltU+0103. U+0218i cine gU+0103seU+0219te unicornu', lanseazU+0103 U+00EEn sus scU+00E2ntei verzi. Ne-am U+00EEnU+021Beles? ScoateU+021Bi-vU+0103 baghetele U+0219i exersaU+021Bi puU+021Bin chiar acum. AU+0219a... Iar dacU+0103 cineva are probleme, lansaU+021Bi scU+00E2ntei roU+0219ii U+0219i-o sU+0103 venim toU+021Bi sU+0103 vU+0103 gU+0103sim. FiU+021Bi cu bU+0103gare de seamU+0103. SU+0103 mergem!" (p.283-284)</blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="430898815793069526" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1276761791" />    <a title="U+2665 U+2661 U+00A2 U+03C3 U+03C3 U+043A U+03B9 U+0454 U+2665 U+2661 (Krystle) " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5076023-krystle"><img alt="U+2665 U+2661 U+00A2 U+03C3 U+03C3 U+043A U+03B9 U+0454 U+2665 U+2661 (Krystle) " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470623118p2/5076023.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1276761791?book_show_action=false">Apr 05, 2016</a>      <a title="U+2665 U+2661 U+00A2 U+03C3 U+03C3 U+043A U+03B9 U+0454 U+2665 U+2661 (Krystle) " class="user" name="U+2665 U+2661 U+00A2 U+03C3 U+03C3 U+043A U+03B9 U+0454 U+2665 U+2661 (Krystle) " href="/user/show/5076023-krystle">U+2665 U+2661 U+00A2 U+03C3 U+03C3 U+043A U+03B9 U+0454 U+2665 U+2661 (Krystle) </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1276761791" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17130526581168886389"><b> <i>You can read this review and more on my blog:</i> </b><br><div> <a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/" title="Kookie Krysp Reads" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1435883476i/15384366.png" alt="Kookie Krysp Reads" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> </div>This was my first time reading this book. I have never even watched the movies, and somehow I was lucky enough to avoid any spoilers. I got to enjoy the story like it was meant to be enjoyed so I know more than a few of you Potter fans wish you were me right now and got to fall in love with this series for the first time.<br><br>What can I say?<br><br><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape.gif" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668858.gif" alt="world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape" width="500" height="190" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br><br><p>While reading this, I felt simultaneously transported back in time and into another world.The world was filled</p></span>  <span id="freeText17130526581168886389" style="display:none"><b>  <i>You can read this review and more on my blog:</i></b><br><div>  <a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/" title="Kookie Krysp Reads" rel="nofollow">    <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1435883476i/15384366.png" alt="Kookie Krysp Reads" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a></div>This was my first time reading this book. I have never even watched the movies, and somehow I was lucky enough to avoid any spoilers. I got to enjoy the story like it was meant to be enjoyed so I know more than a few of you Potter fans wish you were me right now and got to fall in love with this series for the first time.<br><br>What can I say?<br><br><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape.gif" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668858.gif" alt="world-without-harry-potter-gifs-snape" width="500" height="190" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br> <br><p>While reading this, I felt simultaneously transported back in time and into another world.The world was filled with magic and mythical creatures and the time was when I was eleven years old and filled with imagination and wonder. I've read my fair share of children's books, but I've never read one that so perfectly captured the feeling of how wonderful and freeing it is to be a child.<br><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/xYjjO.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668859.gif" alt="xYjjO" width="500" height="214" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br> <br></p><p>I loved the moments when Harry, Ron, and Hermoine got to play, eat sweets, and find mischief like normal kids just as much as I liked the moments when they were learning magic and fighting monsters. Even the most mundane activities were written in such a wistful and intriguing way that I was afraid to miss a single word. Usually if I my eyes glaze over I just keep reading until I get caught up but that was impossible to do with this book. I was scared that if I looked away for even a moment I might miss something.<br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/giphy.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668860.gif" alt="giphy" width="500" height="202" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br> <br></p><p>When the story began, I hated the Dursleys with such a passion. A group of more miserable and hateful people has never been found. After a while, I had to remind myself to chill out because things were going to get better for Harry eventually. And that's the only way I made it though those first chapters without throwing my book across the room.<br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_inline_myy3ue9qRV1rguask.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668861.gif" alt="tumblr_inline_myy3ue9qRV1rguask" width="500" height="190" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br> <br></p><p>But something happened when Harry met Ron's mom for the first time. I was so relieved when she was sweet and motherly towards him that I realized why the Dursleys had to be so terrible. There are plenty of mean and horrible people Harry has to deal with, but those bad people make the friends Harry meets seem all the more wonderful.<br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Trio-3-harry-ron-and-hermione-26030628-500-207_large.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668862.gif" alt="Trio-3-harry-ron-and-hermione-26030628-500-207_large" width="500" height="207" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br> <br></p><p>After I realized how necessary the villains were to the story, I started to enjoy them more. When Harry and the gang got in trouble, instead of just feeling dread and worrying about them, I also looked forward to seeing how they were going to get out of their current scrape.<br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/125f9c80-016c-0133-f461-0e18518aac2f.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668863.gif" alt="125f9c80-016c-0133-f461-0e18518aac2f" width="499" height="201" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br> <br></p><p>There was a chemistry between all the characters in this book that was such a pleasure. Harry is an innocent and heroic little boy who is lucky to have a loyal and brave friend like Ron, and Hermione is the smart, mother hen. She worries about them both, tells them when their ideas are stupid, and then goes along to keep them out of trouble. And Dumbledore is insanely funny it only took two scenes for me to fall in love with him and wish he was my crazy great-uncle. <br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_mqz0icMkiR1syf0pdo1_500.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668864.gif" alt="tumblr_mqz0icMkiR1syf0pdo1_500" width="500" height="250" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br> <br></p><p>I honestly can't think of a thing I didn't love about this book. I even loved the names! (Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington is the best name in the history of names, and I will never refer to him as U+201CHeadless NickU+201D.)<br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_inline_ne06i4BIwd1s8wp3s.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668865.gif" alt="tumblr_inline_ne06i4BIwd1s8wp3s" width="245" height="180" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br> <br></p><p>Everything was so well thought out and planned, and there were more than a few surprising moments that I never saw coming.<br></p><p><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/giphy-1.gif" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668866.gif" alt="giphy (1)" width="489" height="198" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a>.<br> <br></p><p>I am so glad that I waited as long as I did to read this. I have always liked to read, but when I was a kid, I didn't love it the way I do now. I finally know why everyone loves this book so much. It's not because it is the greatest piece of literature that has ever been written, It's because this book shows how joyful and fun reading can be. Reading doesn't have to be intimidated and hard to be good. The best books--the books that stick with you and make you smile when you think about them--are the ones that challenge you, teach you something useful, and entertain the heck out of you.<br></p><p>  <a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/tumblr_mmma0qjTvP1s5po2no1_500.gif" rel="nofollow">    <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1459880305ra/18668867.gif" alt="tumblr_mmma0qjTvP1s5po2no1_500" width="480" height="270" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a>  <br></p><p>This book did all that and more.<br> <br></p><p>This is the first book I have every read that I can honestly recommend everyone read.<br> <br><br><em>I'm not even sure how to do the parental guidance on this one. I recommend the parent read it first and then decide if their child can handle it. At the very least, the parent will have some fun.</em><br><br><br><a href="http://kookiekrysp.com/review-40/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">This review was originally posted on Kookie Krysp Reads</a></p></span>  <a data-text-id="17130526581168886389" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1276761791">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1606685969" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1606685969" />    <a title="Rachel Nicole Wagner" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25652076-rachel-nicole-wagner"><img alt="Rachel Nicole Wagner" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460007621p2/25652076.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1606685969?book_show_action=false">Oct 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Rachel Nicole Wagner" class="user" name="Rachel Nicole Wagner" href="/user/show/25652076-rachel-nicole-wagner">Rachel Nicole Wagner</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582889" href="/book/show/17372039-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25652076-rachel-nicole-wagner?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1606685969" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16563229331654394992">**5/5 Stars but I wish I could give it about 9 3/4 out of 5! hehe. It's so wonderful! <br /> I gotta be honest, I missed the Harry Potter train whenever I was a wee tyke. I had never seen the movies or read the books until last year whenever my grandmom gave me and my sister the whole movie collection and told us we had to watch them because they're, "simply amazing," as she said. :) So, last year, me and my sister sat down and watched all of the movies, in order. I was absolutely amazed at how great</span>  <span id="freeText16563229331654394992" style="display:none">**5/5 Stars but I wish I could give it about 9 3/4 out of 5! hehe. It's so wonderful! <br /> I gotta be honest, I missed the Harry Potter train whenever I was a wee tyke. I had never seen the movies or read the books until last year whenever my grandmom gave me and my sister the whole movie collection and told us we had to watch them because they're, "simply amazing," as she said. :) So, last year, me and my sister sat down and watched all of the movies, in order. I was absolutely amazed at how great the storyline really is, how wonderful all of the characters are and ultimately, how MAGICAL it really is. This past summer, my family and I went on our annual trip to Anaheim, California. We always go to Disneyland, Huntington Beach, and Universal Studios. I was really excited to hear that Universal Studios had a new "Diagon Alley," area that was supposed to be as "magical" as the Harry Potter movies. Let's just say, I was in absolute wonder. We spent almost our entire day in Diagon Alley, we only had time to ride two other rides in the whole park before closing time because we stayed there that late. I was amazed by how magical it all was. The shops, the food, the wands, the tricks, the staff, the rides, everything was completely and utterly themed for Harry Potter and I honestly felt like I was in Diagon Alley and Hogsmead. It was INCREDIBLE. So, while we were there, I decided that I HAD TO read the books. I wanted more of this wizarding world, I wanted to know more about the characters and everything that surrounds this world. So, we came home, I got on e-bay, found a brand new set of the special edition books that have spines make the castle and I bought them! As soon as they came in, I couldn't wait to start reading them. Becuase of school (I'm triple majoring in Nursing, English and Business) and because of the time I have to work (preceptorship hours for my BSN in Nursing) I haven't had near as much time to read. It's been difficult but I finally got caught up enough in school and finished the books that I was reading over this summer where I could start this book. <br />Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone! The first book in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter books. I must say that I was not disappointed at all. In fact, I'm even more in love with the world of Harry Potter and these characters that the INCREDIBLE J.K. Rowling has created. It's such a lovely book that explores being different, outcasted, standing up for what's right, being afraid and brave at the same time, and never losing your curiosity. It's such an amazing book. I'm so excited that I've finally got to start reading these lovely books and I can't wait to continue on! :) <br />5/5 Stars but I wish I could give it about 9 3/4 out of 5! hehe. It's so wonderful! <br />Thank you, J.K. Rowling, for writing these books and creating this world. I believe you're never too old to discover the magic in this world and become a part of it. This is just excellent! :) <br /><br />xo, <br />Rachel </span>  <a data-text-id="16563229331654394992" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>
