</div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1457011560" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1457011560" />    <a title="Lily" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1899725-lily"><img alt="Lily" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451003929p2/1899725.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1457011560?book_show_action=false">Dec 19, 2015</a>      <a title="Lily" class="user" name="Lily" href="/user/show/1899725-lily">Lily</a>          added it          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Audiobook 9781907545016" href="/book/show/8040193-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1899725-lily?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1899725-lily?shelf=2015">2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1899725-lily?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1457011560" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18359149202169207461">I can't rate Harry Potter any more than I can rate hot chocolate or weekends or the feeling of being nuzzled by a puppy. But I can say that the experience of reading this book now, when I'm older than Lily and James were when they had their son, was very different from the experience of reading it for the first time when I was younger than Harry. <br /><br />Before I had ever seriously said goodbye to anyone, I thought that the first chapter was comical. Now, it's a struggle not to cry alongside Hagrid, McG</span>  <span id="freeText18359149202169207461" style="display:none">I can't rate Harry Potter any more than I can rate hot chocolate or weekends or the feeling of being nuzzled by a puppy. But I can say that the experience of reading this book now, when I'm older than Lily and James were when they had their son, was very different from the experience of reading it for the first time when I was younger than Harry. <br /><br />Before I had ever seriously said goodbye to anyone, I thought that the first chapter was comical. Now, it's a struggle not to cry alongside Hagrid, McGonagall, and Dumbledore. <br /><br />I used to immerse myself in the wizarding world without thinking too much about it. Now, I'm fascinated by how JKR's writing choices make that immersion possible. Magical cultures, histories, and economies are hinted at in a way that resembles how we usually interact with their real-life counterparts, rather than being explained through info-dumps that forcefully remind us that we're being introduced to a fictional world.<br /><br />I used to look up to Harry, thinking of him as a practically grown-up hero. Now, I'm struck by his social astuteness and his lack of pretension - I loved seeing him figure out how to share with Ron without making Ron feel embarrassed, as well as his matter-of-fact acceptance of Quirrell's speech impediment. I was also surprised at how manipulative he is under certain circumstances - he would indeed have done well in Slytherin. Mostly, I just wish I could hug him and Hedwig and the others, and protect them from the terrible things in the not-too-distant future. And yet, I think their willingness to confront the future is part of what makes them so lovable. In some ways, I still look up to them. <br /><br />Finally, this reading experience created a bridge to the version of myself that opened the book over 15 years ago. In the time since then, we've been inundated with other people's (mostly filmmakers') ideas of what Harry's world looks and sounds like. It took a bit of conscious effort, but by displacing those images I rediscovered the world that my own imagination once created - part of it modeled after people and places in my own life at the time, part of it purely invented and then seemingly forgotten, but just waiting to be brought back to life.</span>  <a data-text-id="18359149202169207461" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1457011560">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1457011560" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=1457011560&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1457011560'><a id="like_count_review_1457011560" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1457011560?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">20 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1457011560" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1457011560" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=20&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1457011560&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1457011560" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1457011560, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">13 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1457011560?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1457011560' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1457011560/comments?reverse=true">View all 13 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_144470212" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Lily" href="/user/show/1899725-lily"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451003929p1/1899725.jpg" alt="1899725" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/1899725-lily">Lily</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer9900038869916586225"><i>Seemita wrote: "Aww.. it feels good to revisit the Potter World through your lovely review, Lily! I know I read like this series like a manic; and was</i></span>  <span id="freeText9900038869916586225" style="display:none"><i>Seemita wrote: "Aww.. it feels good to revisit the Potter World through your lovely review, Lily! I know I read like this series like a manic; and was so taken by the lessons on life that Rowling subtly induced th..."</i><br /><br />Your imagination should fly to its heart's content, Seemita! :) I also find it difficult to talk about any particular volume of the series without having in mind things that happened in the books that came before and after.</span>  <a data-text-id="9900038869916586225" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Dec 16, 2015 09:18PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_144470286" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Lily" href="/user/show/1899725-lily"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451003929p1/1899725.jpg" alt="1899725" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/1899725-lily">Lily</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer6951499448504839018"><i>Cecily wrote: "Lily wrote: "At one point in life, I wasn't too fond of re-reading books. I've lately become more appreciative..."<br /><br />I know what you mean,</i></span>  <span id="freeText6951499448504839018" style="display:none"><i>Cecily wrote: "Lily wrote: "At one point in life, I wasn't too fond of re-reading books. I've lately become more appreciative..."<br /><br />I know what you mean, and I'm still wary. With a big pile of books I know I want ..."</i><br /><br />It's definitely tricky! And I honestly still don't re-read very much. Most of the other re-reads that I've done this year have been of books that I finished reading for the first time and then decided to re-read right away.</span>  <a data-text-id="6951499448504839018" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Dec 16, 2015 09:21PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1457011560' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1457011560, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_407336608" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/407336608" />    <a title="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder"><img alt="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476896265p2/3048260.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/407336608?book_show_action=false">Jan 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" class="user" name="Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*" href="/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder">Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780439362139" href="/book/show/219069.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=a-own-book-form">a-own-book-form</a>, href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=movie-seen">movie-seen</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer407336608" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1503736620179541251"><br /><b></b>U+201CIt does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.U+201D<br /><br />3.5 stars<br /><br />IU+2019m sure this thick book became even more legendary than the author ever dreamed it would.<br /><br />Rowling uses cookie cutter characters to create a fascinating world of magic, wizardry, and the great divide between good and evil which has always captivated all age groups and which always will. The world building is one reason the novels U+2013 and then movies U+2013 became so famous. Getting that invite to Hogwarts must be such fun - IU+2019m sure many no</span>  <span id="freeText1503736620179541251" style="display:none"><br /><b></b>U+201CIt does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.U+201D<br /><br />3.5 stars<br /><br />IU+2019m sure this thick book became even more legendary than the author ever dreamed it would.<br /><br />Rowling uses cookie cutter characters to create a fascinating world of magic, wizardry, and the great divide between good and evil which has always captivated all age groups and which always will. The world building is one reason the novels U+2013 and then movies U+2013 became so famous. Getting that invite to Hogwarts must be such fun - IU+2019m sure many normals in this world fantasize it happening to them at that age.<br /><br />Harry Potter is likeable, but simple. His friends are the same. The villain promises to be a fascinating one but heU+2019s not really uncovered yet save for whispers of legends and foreshadowing. <br /><br />The book was especially enjoyable at the beginning, where Harry is unfortunate in his demented average family. ThereU+2019s humor that works, sometimes, pushing the story along. The real excitement starts when Harry steps foot onto Hogwarts ground, meeting the bizarre blend of professors, other students, potions, classes, and challenges.<br /><br />I know the movie was rated poorly by some in comparison to the book. To me itU+2019s almost word for word, including dialogue. Some of it, such as emotion, worked better in page form. I do have to prefer some of the movie though, especially when playing Quidditch, because the effects made it more interesting. I think Rowling drug it out too long in book form, and because of this dragging on I grew a little bored at times.<br /><br />Overall a cute and quirky, simple novel that opens a door to a world that skyrocketed. IU+2019m hoping I enjoy the later novels more, just like I did with the movies.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="1503736620179541251" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855898" href="/book/show/21523103-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46731504-irshad?shelf=excellent-reads">excellent-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46731504-irshad?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46731504-irshad?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46731504-irshad?shelf=worth-a-second-read">worth-a-second-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46731504-irshad?shelf=audio-booked">audio-booked</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1571682018" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3451289349636288973"><b>Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone by J.K Rowling - 5/5 stars</b><br /><br />I wished that I had read this book when I was younger. It really is amazing. The plot development and the characters in this book were so good! I just can't get enough of it. <br /><br />In this tale of the Philosopher's Stone, Harry discover that he is a wizard. He lives with muggles and is treated rather poorly even though his muggle family know that he is a wizard. <br />On his eleventh birthday, Harry receives a letter from <i>Hogwarts,</i> the schoo</span>  <span id="freeText3451289349636288973" style="display:none"><b>Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone by J.K Rowling - 5/5 stars</b><br /><br />I wished that I had read this book when I was younger. It really is amazing. The plot development and the characters in this book were so good! I just can't get enough of it. <br /><br />In this tale of the Philosopher's Stone, Harry discover that he is a wizard. He lives with muggles and is treated rather poorly even though his muggle family know that he is a wizard. <br />On his eleventh birthday, Harry receives a letter from <i>Hogwarts,</i> the school for wizards and witches. He eventually attends Hogwarts and meets his friends, Ron and Hermoine. The friendship between these three will definitely be one of my favorites easily, I can already tell. <br /><br />I loved the entire book and breezed through it. It left my mind amazed and bewildered. I have watched the films countless of times and now I SEE THE MISSING PORTIONS that are so relevant to the plot. The book makes everything much more clear and I loved the casting of spells and the sorting hat where Harry was sorted into Gryffindor! <br /><br />Will definitely be reading this series throughout this year and I can't wait. Planning to listen to the auidobooks for a new experience as well. </span>  <a data-text-id="3451289349636288973" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/141449726?book_show_action=false">Jun 14, 2012</a>      <a title="Anzu The Great Destroyer" class="user" name="Anzu The Great Destroyer" href="/user/show/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer">Anzu The Great Destroyer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810545" href="/book/show/7955579-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">everyone</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=ya-is-dead">ya-is-dead</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=must-reads">must-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=excitement">excitement</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=ya-fantasy-something">ya-fantasy-something</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=casper-ate-my-sandwich">casper-ate-my-sandwich</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=well-arent-you-mister-popularity">well-arent-you-mister-popularity</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=great-concept">great-concept</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2278800-anzu-the-great-destroyer?shelf=bbc-100">bbc-100</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer141449726" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10078560795913177104">I am short on words, so I'll keep it simple. I started Harry Potter late, and I kept telling myself <i>better late than never</i>. Yes, that does work to an extent. And then I think of my younger version, reading all the crap our school teachers used to give us. And then I think how much fun would have been to read Harry Potter at that age. Why didn't anyone tell me about the book back then? Why didn't my parents buy it for my birthday? Or Christmas? <br /><br />Of course I blame my parents. Parents are responsibl</span>  <span id="freeText10078560795913177104" style="display:none">I am short on words, so I'll keep it simple. I started Harry Potter late, and I kept telling myself <i>better late than never</i>. Yes, that does work to an extent. And then I think of my younger version, reading all the crap our school teachers used to give us. And then I think how much fun would have been to read Harry Potter at that age. Why didn't anyone tell me about the book back then? Why didn't my parents buy it for my birthday? Or Christmas? <br /><br />Of course I blame my parents. Parents are responsible for everything. Well, almost everything. So mum, if you're reading this, shame on you! You took away from me the privilege of growing up with Harry Potter. That is a crime! A crime I say!<br /><br />But seriously you guys, Harry Potter is epic! I canU+2019t wait to get my hands on <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>.</span>  <a data-text-id="10078560795913177104" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1469903020" />    <a title="Kaitlin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19126246-kaitlin"><img alt="Kaitlin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466422085p2/19126246.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1469903020?book_show_action=false">Dec 17, 2015</a>      <a title="Kaitlin" class="user" name="Kaitlin" href="/user/show/19126246-kaitlin">Kaitlin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408845646" href="/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19126246-kaitlin?shelf=my-sff-faves">my-sff-faves</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1469903020" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13552676377351581927">Naturally this was a phenomenal because it's Harry Potter and I have always loved these books since I first read them, but this edition is the brand new illustrated edition and I have to say that Jim Kay was BY FAR a wonderful choice to illustrate these because he's represented the wonder, quirk and magic of the world and characters beautifully! I had so many pages within this that I adored, the colour palette is beautiful and has such a great vibe, and the style is free, flowing and fabulous.<br /><br />Th</span>  <span id="freeText13552676377351581927" style="display:none">Naturally this was a phenomenal because it's Harry Potter and I have always loved these books since I first read them, but this edition is the brand new illustrated edition and I have to say that Jim Kay was BY FAR a wonderful choice to illustrate these because he's represented the wonder, quirk and magic of the world and characters beautifully! I had so many pages within this that I adored, the colour palette is beautiful and has such a great vibe, and the style is free, flowing and fabulous.<br /><br />The story was like coming home to friends of course, and I am so excited to keep reading the next few soon!! 5*s of course (although Harry Potter defies all rating systems)</span>  <a data-text-id="13552676377351581927" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="/user/show/39455253-thegirlwhoreadssbooks">thegirlwhoreadssbooks</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback " href="/book/show/23506567-harry-potter-e-a-pedra-filosofal">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/39455253-thegirlwhoreadssbooks?shelf=bookshelf">bookshelf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1718820848" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5218125582098559546">Que saudades que tinha deste mundo! Depois de ler o mais recente livro de Harry Potter, deu-me uma vontade imensa de voltar a reler esta saga, que marcou a minha infU+00E2ncia e adolescU+00EAncia! E assim comeU+00E7ou a re-leitura.<br />Como nunca escrevi nenhuma opiniU+00E3o dos 7 livros de Harry Potter, no blogue, vou fazU+00EA-lo agora U+00E0 medida que for relendo os livros! por isso, podem contar com uma opiniU+00E3o em breve ;)<br /><br />OpiniU+00E3o aqui: <a target="_blank" href="https://thegirlwhoreadssbooks.wordpress.com/2016/08/11/harrypottereapedrafilosofal/" rel="nofollow">https://thegirlwhoreadssbooks.wordpre...</a><br /><br />Agora.. Vou ver o filme hehe</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1718820848"> U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9789722325332" href="/book/show/3484606-harry-potter-e-a-pedra-filosofal">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3591471-pam-gon-alves?shelf=tenho">tenho</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14029602036786352840">TU+00E1 liberado chorar de saudade?<br />HU+00E1 tanto tempo que eu nU+00E3o mergulhava nessa histU+00F3ria que foi quase como se eu tivesse lendo pela primeira vez novamente. Quase. Ver os personagens tU+00E3o novos e tU+00E3o corajosos, me impressionar com os perigos que eles jU+00E1 se colocavam... <br /><br />O mais legal de reler o livro foi que eu estava com muitos detalhes do filme na cabeU+00E7a, entU+00E3o vU+00E1rias coisas eu nU+00E3o lembrava que havia acontecido. Como eu disse, foi quase como ler pela primeira vez. Nostalgia total.<br /><br /><3 Muito amor!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1373239436" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8146426155048420005">Re-reading "Harry feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1373239436">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1373239436" title="Flag this ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_539250222" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/539250222" />    <a title="Cait (Paper Fury)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury"><img alt="Cait (Paper Fury)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1356324709p2/11375137.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/539250222?book_show_action=false">Feb 17, 2013</a>      <a title="Cait (Paper Fury)" class="user" name="Cait (Paper Fury)" href="/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury">Cait (Paper Fury)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=magical-fantasy">magical-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=5-star">5-star</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=read-2013">read-2013</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer539250222" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7457913009706399703">The hype of Harry Potter passed me by when I was small, so itU+2019s only now (at age nineteen) that I borrowed the famed (and very tattered) novel from the library and immersed myself in the world of Hogwarts. It was strictly for U+201CresearchU+201D, okay? I canU+2019t call myself a childrenU+2019s author and yet have skipped the most impacting and controversial childrenU+2019s novel of all time. <br /><br />So first of all, I loved it. <br /><br />IU+2019m not fan of the U+201CclassicsU+201D style, but the clean prose of Harry Potter and the PhilosopherU+2019s Ston</span>  <span id="freeText7457913009706399703" style="display:none">The hype of Harry Potter passed me by when I was small, so itU+2019s only now (at age nineteen) that I borrowed the famed (and very tattered) novel from the library and immersed myself in the world of Hogwarts. It was strictly for U+201CresearchU+201D, okay? I canU+2019t call myself a childrenU+2019s author and yet have skipped the most impacting and controversial childrenU+2019s novel of all time. <br /><br />So first of all, I loved it. <br /><br />IU+2019m not fan of the U+201CclassicsU+201D style, but the clean prose of Harry Potter and the PhilosopherU+2019s Stone, the quirky description and the subtle humour could very well convert me. ItU+2019s written in omnipresent narrative, again, not my U+201CthingU+201D U+2013 with POV everywhere and by anyone. Once Harry turned eleven, we delved more into his viewing of the world, but at the beginning, we see out of everyoneU+2019 eyes. Even that catU+2019s. <br /><br />The character? Oh, the characters! My personal taste requires a book to be well written and have gripping characters. (Everything else is open for negotiation.) I loved Hagrid! And Dumbledore. And Snape (urgh). And Harry! Ron and the Weasley twins were instant favourites of course (the latterU+2019s antics keeping me smiling the whole way through). But, IU+2019ll go right ahead and say that Hermoine is my utter favourite. I loved her from the beginning and every aspect of her character was so well written, not to mention hilariously brought across. Ron and HarryU+2019s understandable disgust of her is epic. The only character I said, U+201CMehU+201D, at was Voldemort. He had so much hype around him from chapter one that I didnU+2019t think he could possibly be that scary. He wasnU+2019t. Any villain who doesnU+2019t kill his victims straight away is going to end up defeated U+2013 probably by a preteen and his little gang of snivelly nosed adventure-seekers. <br /><br />Being over ten years old, the style of childrenU+2019s books as changed since Harry Potter first hit the shelves. Does that affect this novel? No! It stands in a classy light of itU+2019s own. It canU+2019t be accused of being U+201CclichU+00E9 U+201D, because it started everything! ItU+2019s well written and well plotted and I think my only complaint is Harry having to spend his summer holidays back with the Dursely family. <br /><br />As to the controversial aspect? Witchcraft? Wizardry? Is JK Rowling promoting children to immerse themselves in the occult? Should we be scared of this book and ban and burn it? Well, apart from my personal conviction that a book should never be burned, I canU+2019t see much difference to reading about dragons and fairies, to frolicking through HarryU+2019s adventures in Hogwarts. JK Rowling presents a side for evil and a side for good. It can be argued, how is magic ever good? And it can also be argued, is there such a thing as magic? (Or fairies, for that matter! And I still believe in them!) Harry Potter is a fairy tale. Take it or leave it at that. If I had a small child (which I donU+2019t, beingU+2026well, a teen and all) I would probably not let them read Harry Potter until they were ten or so. Then we could discuss it. <br /><br />It is an epic classic, still standing after decades, and still inspiring children to imagine, have adventures, and write. Or find their letter to Hogwarts. That option might outweigh the others. </span>  <a data-text-id="7457913009706399703" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review539250222">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a href="/flaggedew?resource_id=539250222&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_539250222'><a id="like_count_review_539250222" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/539250222?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">19 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_539250222" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_539250222" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_83629646" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/83629646" />    <a title="Elisa " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3112505-elisa"><img alt="Elisa " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452314605p2/3112505.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/83629646?book_show_action=false">Mar 15, 2014</a>      <a title="Elisa " class="user" name="Elisa " href="/user/show/3112505-elisa">Elisa </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780590353403" href="/book/show/77523.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3112505-elisa?shelf=kids-fiction">kids-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3112505-elisa?shelf=seven-greatest-books-ever">seven-greatest-books-ever</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer83629646" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9530948086888677516">I highly doubted that I would ever write a review for any of the Harry Potter books. Instead, I created a shelf called "seven greatest books ever" and threw them all in there, hoping that would be enough to display my immense love for them. <br /><br />After seeing Part 1 of the Deathly Hallows movie, I decided that I would kick start the re-reading process before the release of Part 2, so I picked up <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_" title="Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a> for probably the 15th time, and began to read. I realized part way th</span>  <span id="freeText9530948086888677516" style="display:none">I highly doubted that I would ever write a review for any of the Harry Potter books. Instead, I created a shelf called "seven greatest books ever" and threw them all in there, hoping that would be enough to display my immense love for them. <br /><br />After seeing Part 1 of the Deathly Hallows movie, I decided that I would kick start the re-reading process before the release of Part 2, so I picked up <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_" title="Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a> for probably the 15th time, and began to read. I realized part way through, that even if I didn't want to review it for its literary merit, I still had much to say about the book solely regarding how it makes me <i>feel</i>.<br /><br />At twenty three years of age, the book is still everything that it was for me when I was only twelve. I remember seeing it in a book order (remember those?) in the sixth grade and putting a star next to it to take home to my mom. My mom, not wanting to buy me a book I'd never read, denied me my request, adding that it looked pretty silly anyway (the joke was on her though, she came to love them too). Anyway, the next year, my cool uncle (don't we all have one?) decided <i>he</i> was going to buy them for my cousin and <i>she</i> was going to have to let me borrow them. So I began the Harry Potter books, and suddenly being twelve- awkward and unpopular, wasn't quite so lonely as it had always been. <br /><br />I dreamed myself right into Harry Potter's world; not in a dangerous, psychotic way, but in a starry eyed, childlike way. Harry, Ron, and Hermione were better friends to me than anyone I met throughout my junior high and high school years, which in a way is a bit sad, but I have no regrets.<br /><br />This was the first time that I've read Sorcerer's Stone since Deathly Hallows came out, and it inevitably made for a far more emotional experience than the first time around. What was once just good, innocent, fun can't exactly be viewed as such when you've seen the big picture. I literally burst into tears at the end of the chapter in which Harry and Ron finally take Hermione as their friend. Oh, what the heck? I'll go ahead and post the paragraph, in case anyone else is wanting to ride the high of that emotional wave:<br /><br /><i>But from that moment on, Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.</i><br /><br />Ah! Knowing what they were in store for- years of utter devotion to one another made this moment so much bigger now than it had seemed at first. Either way though, it's a very moving moment. I love this book. I will always love this book. And I full intend to disown any future children of mine who can't appreciate it with me (I haven't decided as to whether or not that's a joke yet).</span>  <a data-text-id="9530948086888677516" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review83629646">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link83629646" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=83629646&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_83629646'><a id="like_count_review_83629646" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/83629646?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">19 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_83629646" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_83629646" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=19&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=83629646&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_83629646" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 83629646, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">4 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/83629646?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_83629646' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/83629646/comments?reverse=true">View all 4 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_146010958" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Cassandra Fischer" href="/user/show/39426345-cassandra-fischer"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464635605p1/39426345.jpg" alt="39426345" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/39426345-cassandra-fischer">Cassandra Fischer</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer9848085957512619142">I just realized that my children are going to be forced to read the series. As soon as they master "See Jane run" a copy of "The Sorcerer's Stone will</span>  <span id="freeText9848085957512619142" style="display:none">I just realized that my children are going to be forced to read the series. As soon as they master "See Jane run" a copy of "The Sorcerer's Stone will be thrust into their confused little fingers. They will also not be exposed to anyone who can give them spoilers.</span>  <a data-text-id="9848085957512619142" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1951251" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1951251" />    <a title="Namratha" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/114559-namratha"><img alt="Namratha" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1406702134p2/114559.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1951251?book_show_action=false">May 12, 2015</a>      <a title="Namratha" class="user" name="Namratha" href="/user/show/114559-namratha">Namratha</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=mystery">mystery</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=journey-within">journey-within</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=classics">classics</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=childrens-fantasy">childrens-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=ya-lit">ya-lit</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=tween-time">tween-time</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=books-i-love">books-i-love</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=pottermania">pottermania</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=epic-fantasy">epic-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=children-s">children-s</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1951251" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15799495979121441769">I was expecting my return trip to Hogwarts to be something of a dampener. I had finished the series and after all, how many <i>more</i> surprises could the first book reveal? The magic must have faded over time and the characters must surely have achieved the status of house-guests who had overstayed their welcome. <br /><br />Predictably enough, I was wrong. <br /><br />Returning to the first book in what I can now proudly say is my most favourite series <b>EVER</b> was nothing short of magical. It was enchanting to see how the com</span>  <span id="freeText15799495979121441769" style="display:none">I was expecting my return trip to Hogwarts to be something of a dampener. I had finished the series and after all, how many <i>more</i> surprises could the first book reveal? The magic must have faded over time and the characters must surely have achieved the status of house-guests who had overstayed their welcome. <br /><br />Predictably enough, I was wrong. <br /><br />Returning to the first book in what I can now proudly say is my most favourite series <b>EVER</b> was nothing short of magical. It was enchanting to see how the complex and multifaceted characters of the later books started off as nervous, unsure <i>ickle-firsties</i>. <br /><br />It was a time for firsts: <br /><br />a) Ill-treated, neglected 11-year old orphan <b>Harry Potter</b> discovers that he is a wizard - an actual, honest-to-goodness, wand-swishing wizard.<br />b) There is a magical school called Hogwarts for young witches and wizards like him and at Hogwarts, Harry Potter is a legend and so much more than a small boy who lives in a cupboard under the stairs.<br />b) He discovers that he had brave parents who loved him dearly and lost their lives to the most powerful dark wizard in existence in a misguided attempt to save their tiny son.<br />c) It will be the first time that he will meet his soon-to-be best friends <b>Ron Weasley</b> and <b>Hermione Granger</b>, not knowing that it would be the start of many unforeseen and memorable adventures for the trio.<br /><br />For me, the charm lay in reacquainting myself with my favourite cast of characters: the great and twinkly-eyed Headmaster <b>Albus Dumbledore</b>, stern <b>Prof. McGonagall</b> with a staunchly hidden soft-center, quivering <b>Neville Longbottom</b> who is brave enough to stand up to his friends, nasty <b>Draco Malfoy</b>, lovable <b>Hagrid</b>, the irrepressible <b>Fred</b> and <b>George</b> and of course, delightfully detestable <b>Severus Snape</b>. <br /><br />I also liked the fact that <b>  <u>J.K.Rowling</u></b> carved out a story that was a blend of fantasy and realism. She refused to patronize her young readers. She spoke about death in a manner that doesn't usually finds it's way into a children's book. With minimal sugar-coating, she created a world that was rife with pain, loss and love.<br /><br />In this book, Harry Potter faces his vile enemy for the very first time with nerve and bravery. He gets his first opportunity to prove that he is more than just a legendary kid with a mysterious past.<br /><br />The book sets an adequate pace, lays the foundation for future awesomeness and needless to say....the rest is history.<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="15799495979121441769" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1534014764" />    <a title="Lisa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29661942-lisa"><img alt="Lisa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1448713603p2/29661942.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1534014764?book_show_action=false">Jul 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Lisa" class="user" name="Lisa" href="/user/show/29661942-lisa">Lisa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover " href="/book/show/28550610-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerer-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29661942-lisa?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29661942-lisa?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29661942-lisa?shelf=reading-challenge-2016">reading-challenge-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1534014764" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer207250302965778441"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443470366ra/16363719.gif" width="400" height="296" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I'm just going to be honest here: <b>It is impossible for me to write an unbiased review of Harry Potter.</b><br><br>I <i>know</i> Harry Potter has it's flaws, I <i>know</i> J.K. Rowling makes mistakes. But Harry Potter is one of those series where you could give me a list naming all its faults, .... and I honestly couldn't care less.<br>I grew up with Harry, and it will always be my favourite book series. No matter if I'm happy or sad, I will always pick it up again eventually. <br><br>So, now that you've been warned, let's review thi</span>  <span id="freeText207250302965778441" style="display:none"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443470366ra/16363719.gif" width="400" height="296" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I'm just going to be honest here: <b>It is impossible for me to write an unbiased review of Harry Potter.</b><br><br>I <i>know</i> Harry Potter has it's flaws, I <i>know</i> J.K. Rowling makes mistakes. But Harry Potter is one of those series where you could give me a list naming all its faults, .... and I honestly couldn't care less.<br>I grew up with Harry, and it will always be my favourite book series. No matter if I'm happy or sad, I will always pick it up again eventually. <br><br>So, now that you've been warned, let's review this book (or, rather: this edition)<br><br><b>  <u>The Story</u></b><br><br>I don't really need to go into much detail, I think everyone knows what the first book is about: Harry's first year at Hogwarts and his first encounter with Voldemort and magic. <br><b>I love Rowling's writing</b> and the pace of the plot. There really is not a single dull page in this one.<br><br><b>  <u>The Edition</u></b><br><br>I wanted to re-read Philosopher's Stone for a while now, but with all the TBR books in my shelf, I never really allowed myself to. <br>So I was more than happy when I got this beautiful book for christmas. <br>I don't need to tell you that the illustration in this are <b>amazing</b>, because if you took one look at the cover you know that <b>Jim Kay can draw</b>. <br><br>Now, what might be more interesting: Is it worth buying?<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1429128776ra/14534361.gif" width="400" height="172" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>For every Potterhead: YES DEFINITELY<br><br>For everyone that just liked Harry Potter: Mhh, if you own a copy of the normal edition, it might not be necessary to buy this one, because the text inside is exactly the same, the only bonus are the illustrations. Even if you don't already own a copy, I don't know if it would be wise to buy this, because this book really is <b>huge</b>. Alas, hard to transport. No taking this book to work or school to read during break. <br><b>But:</b> If you don't plan to bring it with you wherever you go, why not? <br><br>For me, this book is definitely worth the money and if I ever were to have kids, this is the book I'm going to read them. </span>  <a data-text-id="207250302965778441" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> </div>  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_140374900" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/140374900" />    <a title="Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4793251-aja-the-narcoleptic-ninja"><img alt="Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444962167p2/4793251.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/140374900?book_show_action=false">Aug 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja" class="user" name="Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja" href="/user/show/4793251-aja-the-narcoleptic-ninja">Aja: The Narcoleptic Ninja</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer140374900" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9146830968725882947">This is the book that made me love reading. When I was younger I used to hate reading. I couldn't do it and I had no interest in learning it, but I could memorize. So in kindergarten reading groups that was exactly what I did. I memorized. I memorized the reading group books and passed through them all without ever learning how to read. It was my first grade teacher that figured me out and spent four weeks teaching me to read. I owe a lot to that woman. Still, I didn't really like to do it. It</span>  <span id="freeText9146830968725882947" style="display:none">This is the book that made me love reading. When I was younger I used to hate reading. I couldn't do it and I had no interest in learning it, but I could memorize. So in kindergarten reading groups that was exactly what I did. I memorized. I memorized the reading group books and passed through them all without ever learning how to read. It was my first grade teacher that figured me out and spent four weeks teaching me to read. I owe a lot to that woman. Still, I didn't really like to do it. It wasn't until second or third grade my mom brought this home and handed it to me and told me to give it a shot. <br /><br />Chapter one I handed it back and said I didn't like it, she handed it back and told me to try again. Rinse and repeat for a few chapters until something amazing happened. I didn't want to give the book back. I didn't want to put it down to go eat dinner and I certainly didn't want to put it down and go to bed. I stayed up until I was falling asleep on the pages and then I took it to school and started my bad habit of reading in class. Then I read through lunch and recess and silent reading time until I finished this book. <br /><br />I devoured all the others when I could get my hands on them but between Harry Potter books I didn't know what to do with myself. So my parents did a little digging around and found me another book I liked and then another and another until I became the family bookworm. I started borrowing books from my older sister, I started reading books to my younger brother, I read just about everything and anything I could find and I loved every minute of it. <br /><br />It's really hard to rate a book that I grew up on, but if any book deserves five stars, it's this one because it helped turn me into the person I am. The series itself got me through a lot of hard times and I love going back to it and re-reading it because it feels like coming home. </span>  <a data-text-id="9146830968725882947" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43792706-andrea-manzanilla?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43792706-andrea-manzanilla?shelf=reads-2016">reads-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1392591047" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11777397880502899488">4.25/5<br /><br />Ya se, no hay ninguna excusa para el hecho de que no habU+00EDa leU+00EDdo Harry Potter hasta ahora, aunque en mi defensa cuando se publico estaba en el vientre de mi madre, pero bueno mejor tarde que nunca. U+00BFNo?<br /><br />No creU+00ED que me fuera a apegar con los personajes y la historia desde el principio aunque a lo mejor influyo el hecho de que ya habU+00EDa visto las pelU+00EDculas anteriormente, lo bueno es que no recuerdo nada de las pelU+00EDculas asU+00ED que puedo leerlo con nuevos ojos. <br /><br />El mundo en este primer libro esta m</span>  <span id="freeText11777397880502899488" style="display:none">4.25/5<br /><br />Ya se, no hay ninguna excusa para el hecho de que no habU+00EDa leU+00EDdo Harry Potter hasta ahora, aunque en mi defensa cuando se publico estaba en el vientre de mi madre, pero bueno mejor tarde que nunca. U+00BFNo?<br /><br />No creU+00ED que me fuera a apegar con los personajes y la historia desde el principio aunque a lo mejor influyo el hecho de que ya habU+00EDa visto las pelU+00EDculas anteriormente, lo bueno es que no recuerdo nada de las pelU+00EDculas asU+00ED que puedo leerlo con nuevos ojos. <br /><br />El mundo en este primer libro esta muy bien construido al igual que los personajes para tener tan pocas paginas. Obviamente mis personajes favoritos fueron Harry, Ron y Hermonie, pero los gemelos Weasley sin duda tambiU+00E9n estU+00E1n entre mis favoritos. <br /><br />Rowling tiene una imaginaciU+00F3n que va mas allU+00E1 de mi comprensiU+00F3n y una pluma fluida que te atrapa sin dejarte respirar, en el buen sentido. <br /><br />No se que mas puedo decir que ya no se haya dicho acerca de este maravilloso libro, asU+00ED que hasta aquU+00ED mi reseU+00F1a. Si no lo han leU+00EDdo no sigan mi ejemplo y lU+00E9anlo lo mas rU+00E1pido posible. <br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="11777397880502899488" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1306715706?book_show_action=false">Sep 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Carmine" class="user" name="Carmine" href="/user/show/43396096-carmine">Carmine</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar href="/book/show/1482132.Harry_Potter_e_la_pietra_filosofale">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1306715706" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16548360392928543058">Pilastro dell'infanzia.<br />Quello che sono diventato adesso - manco fossi un astrofisico o un calciatore che deve spalare i soldi davanti a casa per entrare - U+00E8 anche grazie alla lettura di "Harry Potter", vero e proprio compagno di viaggio della mia infanzia, non sempre felice e solare.<br />La storia U+00E8 chiaramente acerba e narrata con un piglio molto fanciullesco, ma il tutto U+00E8 felicemente controbilanciato dall'impareggiabile atmosfera di Hogwarts e dagli innumerevoli personaggi iconici e riusciti, trio</span>  <span id="freeText16548360392928543058" style="display:none">Pilastro dell'infanzia.<br />Quello che sono diventato adesso - manco fossi un astrofisico o un calciatore che deve spalare i soldi davanti a casa per entrare - U+00E8 anche grazie alla lettura di "Harry Potter", vero e proprio compagno di viaggio della mia infanzia, non sempre felice e solare.<br />La storia U+00E8 chiaramente acerba e narrata con un piglio molto fanciullesco, ma il tutto U+00E8 felicemente controbilanciato dall'impareggiabile atmosfera di Hogwarts e dagli innumerevoli personaggi iconici e riusciti, trio principale compreso.<br />Indimenticabile, tra i tanti passaggi memorabili, la tesissima discesa verso la pietra filosofale nei sotterranei di Hogwarts.<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="16548360392928543058" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/821544680?book_show_action=false">Jul 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Markus" class="user" name="Markus" href="/user/show/26681101-markus">Markus</a>          added it                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=childrens-books">childrens-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=read-more-than-once">read-more-than-once</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer821544680" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6196035221592607519">Hello, Harry. We meet again. It seems we got off on the wrong foot the last time.<br /><br />It took me more than ten years to read this book for the second time. A full review, and a full explanation of my experience with this series, to come.<br /><br />Rating and some words on the actual quality of the book and series will come later as I progress through the sequels. Other than that, I will mostly focus on my own personal thoughts.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1615776967" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12671362478806256345">Why have I not read Harry Potter before now, itU+2019s totally amazing! From the first page till the last one I was hooked. I always thought I wouldnU+2019t enjoy a book about a wizard boy who is 11U+2026but damn I was so wrong! Harry, Ron, and Hermoine are probably the best characters ever. They are smart, loyal, brave, funny, and so much more; you canU+2019t help but love them. Honestly, I canU+2019t wait till I get started with the rest of the series.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border href="/user/show/9299051-krystal-bond"><img alt="Krystal Bond" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459308338p2/9299051.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/978362315?book_show_action=false">Feb 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Krystal Bond" class="user" amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer978362315" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10311404637668250958">No question that I would be giving this story 5 stars. I can't believe it has been 19 years since I've last read this novel. I absolutely adored it even after all these years. By far my favorite series ever written. I look forward to re-reading the other books in the series throughout the year. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border
