 </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_54881998" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/54881998" />    <a title="Liz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2191574-liz"><img alt="Liz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1249122143p2/2191574.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/54881998?book_show_action=false">May 27, 2010</a>      <a title="Liz" class="user" name="Liz" href="/user/show/2191574-liz">Liz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781551923963" href="/book/show/742576.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Liz by: </span>      Just about everyone I know. They were all brainwashed.  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2191574-liz?shelf=2009">2009</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer54881998" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9822252944981548622">It is a bewildered girl who writes this. <i>After all,</i> her mind reasons, <i>isnU+2019t this THE childrenU+2019s series? The best thing to have hit the bookstores since Narnia? There must be something tragically wrong with me. Surely my mind has twisted this into something other than whatU+2019s really there. Right?</i><br /><br />Unfortunately, I donU+2019t think so. You see, IU+2019ve realised something. I might only have just finished book one (yeah, IU+2019m just a little behind the times), but IU+2019ve realised something. Harry Potter is a Mary S</span>  <span id="freeText9822252944981548622" style="display:none">It is a bewildered girl who writes this. <i>After all,</i> her mind reasons, <i>isnU+2019t this THE childrenU+2019s series? The best thing to have hit the bookstores since Narnia? There must be something tragically wrong with me. Surely my mind has twisted this into something other than whatU+2019s really there. Right?</i><br /><br />Unfortunately, I donU+2019t think so. You see, IU+2019ve realised something. I might only have just finished book one (yeah, IU+2019m just a little behind the times), but IU+2019ve realised something. Harry Potter is a Mary Sue, Gary Stu, Marty Stu, whatever you want to call him. Let me say it again.<br /><br />HARRY POTTER IS A SUE.<br /><br />No wonder it was boring and bothering me so much. I can hear you future readers (at present I have exactly none) demanding to know why, just why, I think he is a Sue, and how dare I? Those of you who havenU+2019t fainted, that is.<br /><br />*puts on mafia boss accent* You wanna know why? Let me count the ways. If you could just keep track on your fingersU+2013oh, it looks like youU+2019ll need your toes as wellU+2013that would be really helpful.<br /><br />Right. Here we go.<br /><br />1. HeU+2019s hated by all the nasty (some of them ridiculously evil) people.<br /><br />2. And liked by all the good ones.<br /><br />3. He has a cool scar, black hair, and green eyes. Like, yeah. He looks cool. This is the reason I stay away from the black hair/green eyes combo in my own writing: itU+2019s really something that gets doled out by most authors to their specialest favouritest characters. And boy, is Harry Potter special or what?<br /><br />4. HeU+2019s famous. Not only that, but everyone bows to him in the street. I think we just discovered BuddhaU+2019s successor.<br /><br />5. HeU+2019s rich. Insanely rich. What are the odds?<br /><br />6. He got into the best school for magic around. Without even applying.<br /><br />7. HeU+2019s a Gryffindor, the most fantabulous house in the school.<br /><br />8. HeU+2019s fantastic at broomsticking even though heU+2019s never had any practice whatsoever.<br /><br />9. Immediately, instead of getting punished for breaking the rules, he gets put on the Quidditch team even though itU+2019s unheard of for someone so young to be there. And this is after the teacher sees one single display of catching a Remembrall. Ever heard of beginnersU+2019 luck? Adrenaline-fuelled ability, perhaps? Heightened senses? With all this, she still decides that Harry should be in the Quidditch team.<br /><br />10. Continuing the theme of complete and utter Sueness: FREE BROOMSTICK! Not only that, itU+2019s the latest in broomstick technology.<br /><br />11. He got given his broomstick by a teacher. I will leave you to guess the phrase that applies here. Starts with U+2018tU+2019 and ends with U+2018eacherU+2019s petU+2019. Wow. You got it. Tell me, have you applied for Mensa yet?<br /><br />12. He then impresses everybody on the Quidditch team with his special specialness to such an extent that heU+2019s likened to the greatest Quidditch player in a hundred years (who was also definitely older than Harry when he played Quidditch).<br /><br />13. Invisible cloak. HeU+2019s got all this, and then to add to it, he gets an invisible cloak.<br /><br />14. HeU+2019s smart.<br /><br />15. HeU+2019s brave.<br /><br />16. HeU+2019s good at magic. These last three combined are a Sueness Overload in themselves.<br /><br />17. And yet, even with all these qualities, heU+2019s so generous and brave, is purported to have such good judgement, etc., that you feel as if the urge to like him is being shoved down your throat, stirred until properly combined, and left to set for three hours.<br /><br />18. This is the part that made me almost throw up: Hermione, for no good reason, throws her arms around Harry and tells him how great he is, and that sheU+2019s basically not worth half of what he is. Just stuff some more Sueness down our throats, why donU+2019t you, J?<br /><br />19. Harry just escaped major Sue-ity again because Neville LongbottomU+2019s final points are the ones that win Gryffindor the House Cup/Trophy/thing. Still, Ron and Hermione win a generic fifty points each. Harry, of course, has to get sixty. Minor Sue-ness.<br /><br />20. Yeah, he loses Gryffindor a massive 150 points, but he gets it all back, doesnU+2019t he? Being treated like an outcast doesnU+2019t really seem to have made an impression on him at all.<br /><br />21. Instead of being punished for heading into the third-floor corridor, he is rewarded. Now, make no mistake, I do see that there are times when we should break the rules for the right reasons. But surely, to maintain order, shouldnU+2019t the U+2018perpetratorsU+2019 be punished on the surface of things? Surely Harry should be given grunt work or detention or something, right? Wrong.<br /><br />22. The way he was saved from the evil Lord Voldemort is by nothing other than Pure Love. *cue sparkles*<br /><br />23. Dumbledore turns out to have given Harry the cloak. Surely, having been a teacher for many years, he would recognise what mischief kids get up to, and would really NOT want a boy whose friends include the brother of Fred and George Weasley to have access to an invisible cloak. Or, if it comes to that, any kid at all. T-E-A-C-H-E-R-S-P-E-T.<br /><br />I wouldnU+2019t care if HP only displayed a couple of these characteristics, but heU+2019s got the whole lot! The thing that really drives me up the wall is that surely this should be the ultimate guide for what not to do when writing a book, and yetU+2026 and yetU+2026 itU+2019s a bestseller. ItU+2019s not sour grapes that keep me writing this post. ItU+2019s sheer confuzzled amazement.<br /><br />The writing style is boring and forgettable. No description to speak of, no real thoughts. There are some allusions to historical figures and terms, and so on, but they arenU+2019t presented in an interesting way. And couldnU+2019t we have at least met Nicholas Flamel?<br /><br />The morals in Harry Potter and the PhilosopherU+2019s Stone are negligible at best. ItU+2019s just me, me, me propaganda in disguiseU+2014one lying, sneaking, and even U+2018immobilisingU+2019 episode after another. And thatU+2019s from the so-called U+2018goodU+2019 characters.<br /><br />ClichU+00E9 after clichU+00E9 abounds in this book. ItU+2019s there in DumbledoreU+2019s white beard. ItU+2019s there in HarryU+2019s surprisingly quick Quidditch triumph. ItU+2019s there in Professor QuirrelU+2019s turban. And most of all, itU+2019s there in Draco Malfoy, a character so flat he couldU+2019ve been made out of paper and then run over with a steamroller and his original shape would have been slightly rounder.<br /><br />Added to which, the plot is so unoriginal. Can anyone say U+2018CinderellaU+2019? Orphaned child mysteriously left with a mean, boring family who doesnU+2019t want him and treats him terribly. Discovers that he really belongs to a world beyond his wildest dreams. And that heU+2019s very, very rich. Almost immediately, heU+2019s at home there. Sure, he has his enemies, but who doesnU+2019t? And they get dealt with anyway. Added to which, it turns out that his parents are super-cool.<br /><br />If thatU+2019s original, then IU+2019m Neville LongbottomU+2019s true love. Turns out everybody who keeps calling this original is Neville's honeybunchkins.<br /><br />I had to struggle to finish this book. Really struggle. I had it out from the library for nine weeks because I kept putting it down for ten days or so, then realizing I should probably finish it to see if it got better. IU+2019d pick it up and realise that IU+2019d forgotten what had happened before, meaning I had to go back to the beginning and start all over again. This, as you may well imagine, drove me nuts.<br /><br />Eventually, with the help of SparkNotes, I managed to figure it out and IU+2019ve just taken book 2 out of the library. IU+2019m wondering if it gets any better. After all, J.K. RowlingU+2019s run out of Cinderella storyline. Considering how much people love this series (to me at this point in time, they are inexplicably popular), IU+2019m not going to end with a pessimistic U+201CI donU+2019t think soU+201D. I might go with something more like this:<br /><br />ItU+2019s got to, right? Right???<br /><br />--------<br /><br />*Disclaimer: As I am not at this point in time a Harry Potter fan, IU+2019ve probably gotten a couple of things wrong, although IU+2019ve checked and double-checked to the best of my ability. (If you see any errors, please comment and let me know.) However, even if a few things are a bit off, there are still about twenty points on this list. Surely thatU+2019s enough to merit consideration anyway.</span>  <a data-text-id="9822252944981548622" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review54881998">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link54881998" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flaggedew?resource_id=54881998&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_54881998'><a id="like_count_review_54881998" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/54881998?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">18 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_54881998" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_54881998" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=18&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=54881998&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_54881998" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 54881998, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">26 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/54881998?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=9">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_54881998' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/54881998/comments?reverse=true">View all 26 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_144585937" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Alana" href="/user/show/31897768-alana"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450038386p1/31897768.jpg" alt="31897768" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/31897768-alana">Alana</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer11438584070495303099">The way I see it, the author has created an entire world and all of its people. The main character could've been anyone, after all it was her choice,</span>  <span id="freeText11438584070495303099" style="display:none">The way I see it, the author has created an entire world and all of its people. The main character could've been anyone, after all it was her choice, she just decided to show what happened to one of the most interesting characters and let the story play out from there. Though I will respect the opinion that you and others have, I personally loved this book and the rest in its series</span>  <a data-text-id="11438584070495303099" href="#" <span id="reviewTextContainer968087717" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15185019419747763579">Son okuyuU+015Fumun U+00FCzerinden beU+015F yU+0131ldan uzun zaman geU+00E7miU+015F olduU+011Funu fark edince, seriyi -herhalde 80. kez- baU+015Ftan okumaya karar verdim. OkumalarU+0131n arasU+0131na birkaU+00E7 yU+0131l, serinin kitaplarU+0131nU+0131n arasU+0131na da farklU+0131 birkaU+00E7 kitap aldU+0131 U+011F U+0131nU+0131z takdirde Harry Potter'larU+0131 U+00F6lene dek tekrar tekrar okuyabilir ve aynU+0131 keyfi alabilirsiniz gibi bir teorim var :) Bu vesileyle daha U+00F6nce <a href="http://kedilervekitaplar.blogspot.com.tr/search/label/Harry Potter" rel="nofollow">bloU+011Fumdan</a> paylaU+015FtU+0131 U+011F U+0131m Harry Potter yazU+0131larU+0131nU+0131 da ekliyorum buraya: <br /><br />Yedi kitaplU+0131k serinin birincisi olan Felsefe TaU+015F U+0131, bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FClU+00FCk dU+00FCnyasU+0131na bi</span>  <span id="freeText15185019419747763579" style="display:none">Son okuyuU+015Fumun U+00FCzerinden beU+015F yU+0131ldan uzun zaman geU+00E7miU+015F olduU+011Funu fark edince, seriyi -herhalde 80. kez- baU+015Ftan okumaya karar verdim. OkumalarU+0131n arasU+0131na birkaU+00E7 yU+0131l, serinin kitaplarU+0131nU+0131n arasU+0131na da farklU+0131 birkaU+00E7 kitap aldU+0131 U+011F U+0131nU+0131z takdirde Harry Potter'larU+0131 U+00F6lene dek tekrar tekrar okuyabilir ve aynU+0131 keyfi alabilirsiniz gibi bir teorim var :) Bu vesileyle daha U+00F6nce <a href="http://kedilervekitaplar.blogspot.com.tr/search/label/Harry Potter" rel="nofollow">bloU+011Fumdan</a> paylaU+015FtU+0131 U+011F U+0131m Harry Potter yazU+0131larU+0131nU+0131 da ekliyorum buraya: <br /><br />Yedi kitaplU+0131k serinin birincisi olan Felsefe TaU+015F U+0131, bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FClU+00FCk dU+00FCnyasU+0131na bir giriU+015F niteliU+011Finde, U+00E7ok eU+011Flenceli bir giriU+015F hem de. BildiU+011Fimiz dU+00FCnya, sihirle dolu bir dU+00FCnya daha saklamaktadU+0131r. BU+00FCyU+00FCyle ilgisi olmayan, bizim gibi sU+0131radan insanlar (yani 'Muggle'lar) olur da bir U+015Fekilde haberdar olursa sihrin varlU+0131 U+011F U+0131ndan, derhal Sihir BakanlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'ndaki yetkin kiU+015Filerin bU+00FCyU+00FCleriyle bildikleri unutturulur, bU+00F6ylece sihirden uzak insanlarla bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FCler, birbirlerine karU+0131 U+015Fmadan, yanyana yaU+015Far gider. U+0130kisi de bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FC olan anne ve babasU+0131nU+0131 da U+00F6ldU+00FCren karanlU+0131k bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FCnU+00FCn, kimsenin nedenini bilmediU+011Fi U+015Fekilde U+00FCzerinde iU+015Flemeyen U+00F6ldU+00FCrU+00FCcU+00FC lanetinden kurtulan 1 yaU+015F U+0131ndaki Harry Potter, ona bakmasU+0131 iU+00E7in teyzesinin evine bU+0131rakU+0131lU+0131r. Bu arada kendisine saldU+0131ran kU+00F6tU+00FC bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FCnU+00FCn yaptU+0131 U+011F U+0131 bU+00FCyU+00FC geri tepmiU+015F, gU+00FC U+00E7lerinin U+00E7oU+011Funu elinden almU+0131 U+015FtU+0131r, artU+0131k Voldemort U+00F6lU+00FC mU+00FC, saU+011F mU+0131 belli deU+011Fildir, ondan adU+0131nU+0131 sU+00F6yleyemeyecek kadar U+00E7ok korkan bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FC dU+00FCnyasU+0131 (ondan bahsederken Kim-OlduU+011Funu-Bilirsin-Sen derler) rahatlamU+0131 U+015F, eski refahlarU+0131na, barU+0131 U+015F iU+00E7indeki dU+00FCzenlerine kavuU+015FmuU+015Ftur. <br /><br />On yU+0131l geU+00E7er, Harry'nin teyzesi, teyzesinin kocasU+0131 ve yeU+011Feniyle birlikte geU+00E7irdiU+011Fi on korkunU+00E7 yU+0131l. Dursley'ler Harry'e U+00F6yle kU+00F6tU+00FC davranU+0131rlar ki, Harry merdiven altU+0131ndaki dolapta yaU+015Far, yeU+011Feni Dudley'nin artU+0131klarU+0131nU+0131 yer ve giyer, evde akrabalarU+0131ndan herhangi bir sevgi gU+00F6rmediU+011Fi gibi, sU+00FCrekli azar yer, okulda da hiU+00E7 arkadaU+015F U+0131 yoktur, U+00E7 U+00FCnkU+00FC kimse kabadayU+0131 Dudley ile papaz olmayU+0131 gU+00F6ze alamaz. Bunlara raU+011Fmen Harry (filmlerdekinin aksine) ezik bU+00FCzU+00FCk, sU+00FCnepe bir tip olmamU+0131 U+015FtU+0131r; gayet muzip, gU+00FC U+00E7lU+00FC karakterli ve zeki bir U+00E7ocuktur, etrafU+0131ndakileri de bolca "idare eder". Son derece sU+0131kU+0131cU+0131 Muggle'lar olan teyzesi ve eniU+015Ftesi bU+00FCyU+00FC dU+00FCnyasU+0131ndan nefret ettikleri -ve deli gibi korktuklarU+0131- iU+00E7in, Harry'e kU+00F6kenlerini, anne babasU+0131nU+0131n ne olduU+011Funu, nasU+0131l U+00F6ldU+00FC U+011F U+00FCnU+00FC anlatmamU+0131 U+015FlardU+0131r bile -Harry bU+00FCyU+00FCnU+00FCn b'sinden habersizdir. Bu nedenlerle bir gU+00FCn kapU+0131da saU+00E7 U+0131 sakalU+0131na karU+0131 U+015FmU+0131 U+015F bir dev belirdiU+011Finde ve Harry'e bir bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FC olduU+011Funu, U+00FCstelik bir bebekken farkU+0131na varmadan da olsa Voldemort'un gU+00FC U+00E7lerini yok ettiU+011Fi iU+00E7in bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FCler dU+00FCnyasU+0131nda U+00E7ok U+00FCnlU+00FC bir bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FC olduU+011Funu, bundan sonra Hogwarts CadU+0131lU+0131k ve BU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FClU+00FCk Okulu'na gideceU+011Fini sU+00F6ylediU+011Finde, Harry'ciU+011Fin U+015FaU+015FkU+0131nlU+0131 U+011F U+0131nU+0131 tahmin edersiniz. Felsefe TaU+015F U+0131 da, Harry'nin arkadaU+015Flarla ve dU+00FC U+015Fmanlarla, U+00FC U+00E7 baU+015FlU+0131 kU+00F6pekler ve trollerle, uU+00E7an sU+00FCpU+00FCrgeler ve ejderhalarla dolu geU+00E7en okuldaki ilk yU+0131lU+0131nU+0131 anlatU+0131r.<br /><br />Kitap dostluk, cesaret ve sadakat kavramlarU+0131nU+0131 iU+015Fliyor ancak U+00F6yle kU+00F6r gU+00F6ze parmak U+015Feklinde sU+00FCslU+00FC methiyeler, aU+015F U+0131rU+0131 U+00F6vgU+00FCler yok, kU+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCk hadiseler U+00FCzerinden incelikli biU+00E7imde iU+015Fleniyor her tU+00FCrlU+00FC U+00F6 U+011Fe. Bu ilk kitap U+00F6zellikle U+00E7ocuk kitabU+0131 olarak tanU+0131mlanabilecek olmasU+0131na raU+011Fmen metnin mesaj kaygU+0131lU+0131 olmamasU+0131, yazarU+0131n da okuyucusunu kU+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCk gU+00F6rmemesi, verdiU+011Fi mesajlarU+0131 U+00E7ok U+015F U+0131k biU+00E7imde zekice vermesi U+00E7ok hoU+015Fuma gitmiU+015Fti ilk okuduU+011Fumda.<br /><br />Rowling'in basit, dolaysU+0131z bir anlatU+0131m dili var; gU+00F6steriU+015Fe, dramatize etmeye yer olmuyor metinlerinde. U+00DCstelik tarzU+0131nU+0131 genel olarak U+00E7ok nU+00FCktedan buluyorum, bazU+0131 bU+00F6lU+00FCmler son derece ince, U+00E7ok da komik esprilerle dolu. Felsefe TaU+015F U+0131'nU+0131n dili U+00E7ocuksu sayU+0131labilir, en azU+0131ndan serinin U+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCncU+00FC kitabU+0131 ve ardU+0131ndan gelenler kadar "yaU+015FsU+0131z" olmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131 kesin, ancak bu kitabU+0131n bU+00FCyU+00FCsU+00FCnU+00FC azaltmU+0131yor. AyrU+0131ca dili inanU+0131lmaz akU+0131cU+0131, kurgusu da okuyucuyu esir alU+0131cU+0131 olduU+011Fu iU+00E7in, U+00E7ocukU+00E7a olsa da olmasa da kendinizi kaptU+0131rU+0131yor ve bir oturuU+015Fta yiyip yutuyorsunuz.<br /><br />BU+00FCyU+00FC dU+00FCnyasU+0131nda geU+00E7mesine raU+011Fmen, altmetinlerde bolca gerU+00E7ek hayattan kesitlere rastlamak mU+00FCmkU+00FCn. Harry Potter serisi her U+015Feyden U+00F6nce U+0131rkU+00E7 U+0131lU+0131k ve ayrU+0131mcU+0131lU+0131k U+00FCzerine zaten. Rowling Felsefe TaU+015F U+0131'nU+0131n hemen her bU+00F6lU+00FCmU+00FCne, sonraki kitaplarda olacaklar iU+00E7in ipuU+00E7larU+0131 serpiU+015FtirmiU+015F. HiU+00E7bir devamlU+0131lU+0131k hatasU+0131 yok, yazar detaylara olaU+011FanU+00FCstU+00FC U+00F6nem vermiU+015F. Bu kitabU+0131 bitirince bir HP baU+011F U+0131mlU+0131sU+0131na dU+00F6nU+00FC U+015Fmeyeceksiniz bU+00FCyU+00FCk ihtimalle, ama baU+015Flarken duyduU+011Funuz kU+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCmseme hisleri yok olmuU+015F olacak ve daha fazlasU+0131nU+0131 merak edeceksiniz. U+0130kinci kitap da aynU+0131 U+015Fekilde sU+00FCrU+00FCkleyici olduU+011Fu iU+00E7in, o da bir gecede bitecek ve U+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCncU+00FC kitabU+0131n ortalarU+0131nda bir yerde, U+00E7oktan bir baU+011F U+0131mlU+0131 olmuU+015F olacaksU+0131nU+0131z. ArtU+0131k daha fazla zaman yitirmeyin, kendinizi Harry Potter'U+0131n olaU+011FanU+00FCstU+00FC dU+00FCnyasU+0131ndan yoksun bU+0131rakmayU+0131n :)</span>  <a data-text-id="15185019419747763579" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1761984337?book_show_action=false">Sep 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Faroukh Naseem" class="user" name="Faroukh Naseem" href="/user/show/47239298-faroukh-naseem">Faroukh Naseem</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747532743" href="/book/show/72193.Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher_s_Stone">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1761984337" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9665388691942857290">I'm not even sure if it's a good idea to 'review' Harry Potter. *hides in the corner*<br /><br />I did not expect this, 10 pages in I realized I was reading with a fake British accent and dramatizing the dialogues in my mind! #theguywiththebookreview presents Harry Potter and the Philosophers stone.<br /><br />The only reason I've started this series is because of my sister Sumaiyya @sumaiyya.books Thank you very much!<br /><br />Writing: Early on in the book I was captivated by the writing style but midway through the book I real</span>  <span id="freeText9665388691942857290" style="display:none">I'm not even sure if it's a good idea to 'review' Harry Potter. *hides in the corner*<br />U+200E<br />I did not expect this, 10 pages in I realized I was U+200Ereading with a fake British accent and dramatizing the dialogues in my mind!U+200E #theguywiththebookreview presents Harry Potter and the Philosophers stone.<br /><br />The only reason I've started this series is because of my sister Sumaiyya @sumaiyya.books Thank you very much!<br /><br />Writing: Early on in the book I was captivated by the writing styleU+200E but midway through the book I realized although the writing is unique, the tale had taken over and you get engrossed so much in the story that you don't really care about the writing (The previous time this happened with me was A Thousand Splendid Suns by Khaled Hosseini)<br />U+200E<br />Story: What surprised me most was although I'm far from my teenage days, I related to a lot of things 'said' between the lines. Friendship, Loyalty, Judgmental attitude, everything is somehow squeezed into it.<br /><br />The HP world: I've always felt that some of the best books are those which don't describe a lot and manage to tickle your imaginary bones. Yes, a lot of things have been minutely described, the look of the characters, some of the Hogwarts rooms, but there is a lot left out which somehow you piece together yourself, like Jenga, you know there are some missing pieces and you can picture the tower in its entirety if you want to!<br /><br />Characters: Even Hedwig seemed to have a personality of its own! And can we have some more Draco please? I loved the trio (I think they are called the golden trio?) Hermoine was so cute but I would stay so far away from such girls in school (because, you know, I so want to be Slytherin!) I couldn't help but relate a few of my school friends to Ron. Harry's character was a bit calm and I expect him to come out of his cave in the next book. The faculty was so intriguing, and now I know why Snape is so talked about. And shoutout to the Big Friendly Giant, Hagrid!<br /><br />Pace: I didn't really care about it. I'm not even sure if the book was fast or slow. It was well put together and something or the other was constantly happening. Ace.<br />U+200E</span>  <a data-text-id="9665388691942857290" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer948008261" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11623020451366466064"><b>*Primera vez leU+00EDdo desde el 25 de May. hasta el 1 de Jun. del 2014*<br />*Segunda vez leU+00EDdo/ReleU+00EDdo desde el 18 de Ene. hasta el 20 de Ene. del 2015*</b><br /><br /><blockquote> <i>U+201COh, podrU+00E1s pensar que no soy bonito,<br />pero no juzques por lo que ves.<br />Me comerU+00E9 a mU+00ED mismo si puedes encontrar<br />un sombrero mU+00E1s inteligente que yo.<br />Puedes tener bombines negros,<br />sombreros altos y elegantes.<br />Pero yo soy el Sombrero Seleccionador de Hogwarts<br />y puedo superar a todos.<br />No hay nada escondido en tu cabeza<br />que el Sombrero Seleccionador no pueda ver.<br />AsU+00ED qu</i></blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText11623020451366466064" style="display:none"><b>*Primera vez leU+00EDdo desde el 25 de May. hasta el 1 de Jun. del 2014*<br />*Segunda vez leU+00EDdo/ReleU+00EDdo desde el 18 de Ene. hasta el 20 de Ene. del 2015*</b><br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>U+201COh, podrU+00E1s pensar que no soy bonito,<br />pero no juzques por lo que ves.<br />Me comerU+00E9 a mU+00ED mismo si puedes encontrar<br />un sombrero mU+00E1s inteligente que yo.<br />Puedes tener bombines negros,<br />sombreros altos y elegantes.<br />Pero yo soy el Sombrero Seleccionador de Hogwarts<br />y puedo superar a todos.<br />No hay nada escondido en tu cabeza<br />que el Sombrero Seleccionador no pueda ver.<br />AsU+00ED que pruU+00E9bate y te dirU+00E9<br />dU+00F3nde debes estar.<br />Puedes pertenecer a Gryffindor,<br />donde habitan los valientes.<br />Su osadU+00EDa, temple y caballerosidad<br />ponen aparte a los de Gryffindor.<br />Puedes pertenecer a Hufflepuff,<br />donde son justos y leales.<br />Esos perseverantes Hufflepuff<br />de verdad no temen el trabajo pesado.<br />O tal vez a la antigua sabidurU+00EDa de Ravenclaw,<br />Si tienes una mente dispuesta,<br />porque los de inteligencia y erudiciU+00F3n<br />siempre encontrarU+00E1n allU+00ED a sus semejantes.<br />O tal vez en Slytherin<br />harU+00E1s tus verdaderos amigos.<br />Esa gente astuta utiliza cualquier medio<br />para lograr sus fines<br />U+00A1AsU+00ED que pruU+00E9bame! U+00A1No tengas miedo!<br />U+00A1Y no recibirU+00E1s una bofetada!<br />U+00C9stas en buenas manos (aunque yo no las tenga).<br />Porque soy el Sombrero Pensante.U+201D</i></blockquote><br /><br />Es hora de confesarme: <b>  <i>Harry Potter no es mi libro de la infancia como todo el mundo (no me burlo ni nada) a decir verdad, ni tengo libro de infancia. TambiU+00E9n, U+00BFSaben cuU+00E1ndo supe que las pelU+00EDculas de HP eran adaptadas en los libros? <u>En la U+00FAltima pelU+00EDcula</u>, y no me avergU+00FCenzo de decirlo, hasta me alegro de leerlo mucho aU+00F1os despuU+00E9s de que se han publicado los libros y las pelU+00EDculas igual.</i></b><br /><br />La primera vez que leU+00ED Harry Potter fue el aU+00F1o pasado en ePub/inglU+00E9s, ademU+00E1s fue mi primer libro en inglU+00E9s que leU+00ED -<i>Gracias Carmen</i>- y fue bastante fU+00E1cil y sencillo leerlo, pero ahora que lo releo -me prometU+00ED que lo iba a releer iniciando el aU+00F1o- <b>lo amU+00E9.</b> Solamente para aclarar, lo he releU+00EDdo en espaU+00F1ol/fU+00EDsico.<br /><br /><b>AmU+00E9 demasiado este libro.</b> Aunque ha sido el primero de esta saga -y espero que en los demU+00E1s mejore-, no me pudo gustar menos. <br /><br />U+00A1Por fin pude entender todas las dudas que tenU+00EDa mientras veU+00EDa las pelU+00EDculas! Todas las aventuras que tiene Harry son increU+00EDbles, el trama solamente me hizo continuar hasta acabar el libro ademU+00E1s de que tenU+00EDa sus partes cU+00F3micas y conocU+00ED mU+00E1s a fondo todos los detalles: los personajes, Howgarts, el trama, el misterio, todo.<br /><br /><b>U+00A1Gracias J.K. por haber creado este mundo!</b> Lo digo muy tarde pero da igual, he amado demasiado este libro.<br /><br />No espero para continuar con <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/357545.Harry_Potter_y_la_c_mara_secreta__Harry_Potter___2_" title="Harry Potter y la cU+00E1mara secreta (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter y la cU+00E1mara secreta</a>.<br /><br /><i>Gracias Yas, y Cande por leerlo conmigo. Son las mejores.</i></span>  <a data-text-id="11623020451366466064" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1744060873" />    <a title="Frances" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/17651062-frances"><img alt="Frances" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466778265p2/17651062.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1744060873?book_show_action=false">Sep 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Frances" class="user" name="Frances" href="/user/show/17651062-frances">Frances</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17651062-frances?shelf=women-authors">women-authors</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17651062-frances?shelf=wish-list">wish-list</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1744060873" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10936107112400238140">I am 18 yrs late to this party and to make a review on this book in 2016 is probably silly. <br /><br />This was published few years after I was born and gotten its hype in the early 2000s, well based on where I'm from, Philippines. My cousins were so utterly obsessed on the films (apparently they're not into books, only me and my uncle loves to read) and they would watch HP films over and over again. I lost count on how many times they've watched it in our family room, every time they'd get. Back then I th</span>  <span id="freeText10936107112400238140" style="display:none">I am 18 yrs late to this party and to make a review on this book in 2016 is probably silly. <br /><br />This was published few years after I was born and gotten its hype in the early 2000s, well based on where I'm from, Philippines. My cousins were so utterly obsessed on the films (apparently they're not into books, only me and my uncle loves to read) and they would watch HP films over and over again. I lost count on how many times they've watched it in our family room, every time they'd get. Back then I think they're crazy. The wizard world just did not interest me. <br /><br />I was into something only grown-ups were allowed to read. But I still did since I was fff excited to grow-up only to find out <i>adulting</i> is never fun at all. Also, what I was reading back then were works of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/9068.Sidney_Sheldon" title="Sidney Sheldon">Sidney Sheldon</a>, and all those other crime-mystery novels I could easily get off of our shelf.<br /><br />Then there came the <i>regret.</i> *cringe*<br /><br />Not reading HP when I should have, years ago, was my choice. I guess the hype was to blame since everyone was talking about HP left and right and since I was a rebel, I did not gave-in. I also did not watched the films although we have all the CDs back home. I didn't know what I was getting myself into but what I now know was, although I've missed so much on enjoying this magical series when I was younger, I could still catch-up on it and experience it all, and feel like I'm a kid again. As cliche as it may sound, it never is too late for Hogwarts.<br /><br />I may have lost those years, but Harry Potter will always be there to bring me to a world where good triumphs evil, where friendship is true and gold, where everything is possible, and where <b>  <i>Magic</i></b> does exists.<br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="10936107112400238140" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1765701336" />    <a title="Emma" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9405795-emma"><img alt="Emma" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473024127p2/9405795.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1765701336?book_show_action=false">Sep 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Emma" class="user" name="Emma" href="/user/show/9405795-emma">Emma</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408845646" href="/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9405795-emma?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1765701336" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10213411252291315909">The illustrations in this book are stunning, and re-reading it with the images alongside the text for the first time brings a whole new experience. The perfect illustrator was chosen too in my opinion, with the artwork an excellent combination of cute, creepy, and magical. <br /><br />Cannot wait for the next books to all be released in this edition! </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1765701336">  <td ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_421014699" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/421014699" />    <a title="Arielle Walker" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker"><img alt="Arielle Walker" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452561487p2/6762949.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/421014699?book_show_action=false">May 30, 2015</a>      <a title="Arielle Walker" class="user" name="Arielle Walker" href="/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker">Arielle Walker</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=fantasy-unusual">fantasy-unusual</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=children">children</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer421014699" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5886381497420297151">This is less a review, and more a sort of miniature memoir of my Harry Potter experience. Gushy emotions and etc follow, so feel free to skip this review with no more than my recommendation that if you have not read this series you should do so immediately.<br /><br />Every so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books -</span>  <span id="freeText5886381497420297151" style="display:none">This is less a review, and more a sort of miniature memoir of my Harry Potter experience. Gushy emotions and etc follow, so feel free to skip this review with no more than my recommendation that if you have not read this series you should do so immediately.<br /><br />Every so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books - in order - over the course of around two days (I've read them so often that I can devour them in almost a single go now) followed by as many of the films as I can fit into the time I have left, before I'm forced back into reality. <br /><br />I am one of the Harry Potter generation. I was four when this first book was published, fourteen when the series concluded, and around the same age as the characters in the films when they eventually came out. I still remember my mother insisting that I was too young to read this (at the age of 5) and hiding it under the sofa cushions so I could read in secret anyway.<br /><br />It's a series that I grew up with, and as such, cannot comment on its literary merits without bias. All I know is that these books are a comfort, and feel almost like family. They may not technically be the best books I have ever read, but for a reading experience they are truly unparalleled.<br /><br /><b>30 Day Book Challenge, Day 3: Favourite series.</b> (It has to be, there is no other series of books I've read this many times, and will read again another hundred. I can (and sometimes do) read the entire series in three days or less now, as I am so familiar with the words I can simply slip through them for the comfort of the story...)</span>  <a data-text-id="5886381497420297151" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="/user/show/325918-patrick-henderson"><img alt="Patrick Henderson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1188969912p2/325918.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/5362406?book_show_action=false">Sep 04, 2007</a>      <a title="Patrick Henderson" class="user" name="Patrick Henderson" href="/user/show/325918-patrick-henderson">Patrick Henderson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">anyone</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/325918-patrick-henderson?shelf=crack">crack</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer5362406" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5768231245346544065"><br />Oh go to hell. These things are like crack.<br /><br />So I just finished the 7th one and I have no intention of re-reading them, though I do have fond memories of them. My most recent encounter with Harry Potter was on an airplane a couple of days ago. This humongous 16 year old kid from North Dakota was sitting next to me reading the 5th book. He smelled like cereal and farts and was audibly mouth-breathing for the whole flight. I tried to engage him in conversation periodically to get his little whistle</span>  <span id="freeText5768231245346544065" style="display:none"><br />Oh go to hell. These things are like crack.<br /><br />So I just finished the 7th one and I have no intention of re-reading them, though I do have fond memories of them. My most recent encounter with Harry Potter was on an airplane a couple of days ago. This humongous 16 year old kid from North Dakota was sitting next to me reading the 5th book. He smelled like cereal and farts and was audibly mouth-breathing for the whole flight. I tried to engage him in conversation periodically to get his little whistle to quiet down for a few minutes at a time. We chatted about the little bastards at Hogrwarts and it kind of got me misty...not for the books, but for how terrible high school was even though I didn't realize it at the time. And this kid clearly didn't either. He just wanted to read his book and make it home. I wanted to tell him that in 10 years he wouldn't even remember what his goddamn school looked like. Instead I tried to convince him that what he heard about Dumbledore dying in the 6th one wasn't true. <br /><br />Stay strong, brother. </span>  <a data-text-id="5768231245346544065" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" I am so happy that I finally, finally get to read them. I am so so so so happy. The plot was amazing, and there were no boring moments, and I think I loved the characters even more. Ron was so funny, harry was sassy and hermione was so witty. I just love this so much omfg.<br /><br />But I've only got 6 books to read and I'm dreading the moment where I finish this series.  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5543697-anna-banana?shelf=train-reads">train-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1321723439" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15843279914546662797"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436750600ra/15499036.gif" width="400" height="280" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Can you believe I've never read the Harry Potter books before, and I've never seen any of the movies?! I don't know why the heck I was so against reading these when I was younger but I'm definitely kicking my judgmental teenage-ass right now haha. This book was just so awesome and I'm actually really happy that I have no idea what to expect even though it's also killing me not knowing. This is the kind of book that anyone at any age could read and connect with and love so much. I'm finally start</span>  <span id="freeText15843279914546662797" style="display:none"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436750600ra/15499036.gif" width="400" height="280" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Can you believe I've never read the Harry Potter books before, and I've never seen any of the movies?! I don't know why the heck I was so against reading these when I was younger but I'm definitely kicking my judgmental teenage-ass right now haha. This book was just so awesome and I'm actually really happy that I have no idea what to expect even though it's also killing me not knowing. This is the kind of book that anyone at any age could read and connect with and love so much. I'm finally starting to understand the hype surrounding this series...</span>  <a data-text-id="15843279914546662797" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=faraway-lands">faraway-lands</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=villains-i-want-to-throttle">villains-i-want-to-throttle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=boarding-school">boarding-school</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=badass-heroines">badass-heroines</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=absent-parent-syndrome">absent-parent-syndrome</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=orphan-mc">orphan-mc</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=i-own-a-copy">i-own-a-copy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=reread">reread</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12755336-nora?shelf=harry-freaking-potter">harry-freaking-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer413207969" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17949925774248634171">EDIT 9/18/13: Rereading (again) with Litchick and Tandie and a while bunch of other lovelies starting November 18. JOIN US!<br /><br />I must have reread this series about 5 times, but I still remember the way it felt to experience it for the first time. I was introduced to the world of Harry Potter at the age of eight when I watched the first Harry Potter movie. I was enthralled. When I turned nine, I noticed that many of my classmates were carrying around these huge books, so I decided to pick up Harry Po</span>  <span id="freeText17949925774248634171" style="display:none">EDIT 9/18/13: Rereading (again) with Litchick and Tandie and a while bunch of other lovelies starting November 18. JOIN US!<br /><br />I must have reread this series about 5 times, but I still remember the way it felt to experience it for the first time. I was introduced to the world of Harry Potter at the age of eight when I watched the first Harry Potter movie. I was enthralled. When I turned nine, I noticed that many of my classmates were carrying around these huge books, so I decided to pick up Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. I can honestly say it changed my life. <br /><br />Before HP I did like to read, but it wasn't really all that big of a deal to me. When I finished the first Harry Potter book, it was like a spell was cast on me (hehe). I went out and got the rest of the books immediately and I flew through each one. When there were no more HP books to read, I went into a sort of withdrawal, counting down the days until the next installment became available. I went and watched all the movies on opening weekend. I was utterly obsessed. <br /><br />The thing that I am most grateful for is the love of reading that was instilled in me as a result of JK Rowling's books. Once I got a taste of the excitement of reading, I couldn't stop. And that, my friends, is why reading is now my favorite thing to do. That is why I began to write my own stories, plays, and poems, and am currently working on a novel that I hope to publish one day. I owe all this to JK Rowling. I can't thank her enough for what her books have done for me. <br /><br />The story of Harry Potter, an eleven-year-old boy horribly abused and neglected by his "family," if you can even call the Dursleys a family, was one that saddened me when I first read of it. It still saddens me to this day. Still, as a little kid, whenever I went through some hard times, I always told myself that Harry had it worse than me and he endured. I aspired to be like Harry. If he could deal with the Dursleys, then I could deal with whatever life threw at me. Harry Potter is the kind of kid I would love to have as a friend. He's brave, humble, and loyal. I find myself forgetting that he's a fictional character as I read, but at the same time wishing with all my heart that I could meet someone like him. <br /><br />And then we have Ron. Ron was hilarious, what with his dry humor and sarcasm that never came across as bitter or like he was trying too hard. While I noticed that he was self-conscious about his family's financial situation, he wasn't all "woe is me" about it. He was a good and loyal friend to Harry.<br /><br />As for Hermione, I adored her. I found myself connecting with her on such a personal level. I could relate to almost everything she went through. I also happen to have a mane of bushy brown hair, brown eyes, buck teeth (before I got braces), and a love of books and libraries. I too am a huge goody-two-shoes that many people would consider smart. But most of all, I have a habit of shooting my hand up in the air every time a teacher asks a question. Snape would probably despise me. Hermione was practical, smart, responsible, and a great friend. Her amazing cleverness and skill in magic is even more commendable because of the fact that she's Muggle-born. She'd had no prior experience with magic of any kind before coming to Hogwarts, and still she came out top of her class in her first year. Take that, Draco! <br /><br />Speaking of Draco, allow me to rant about the obnoxious git. He was the most contemptible, pompous, jealous, spoiled little brat I've ever encountered in a book. He seemed to have absolutely nothing better to do than follow Harry and his friends around and ruin their lives in any way possible. Ugh. Someone needs to hit this kid. Still, there's a part of me that feels bad for Draco too. I think all of his hatred for Harry and his friends is really jealousy. Think about it this way. Harry had great friends, Draco has dumb, mean cronies. Harry is famous, Draco doesn't get any attention. Harry's great at quidditch, Draco's not really good at anything (though he does excel in douchebaggery). While the bad still outweighs the good, we have to remember that he's just a lonely, jealous kid that needs to lash out at someone.<br /><br />Now lets talk about one of my favorite characters: Severus Snape. I love him. Is that so wrong? I adore that man. My opinion of him has never changed. Sure, I knew he was a jerk in all the books and I got so angry at him at those times. At the same time, though, I was thoroughly amused by his sarcastic, caustic wit. You have to admit, he's funny, mysterious, complex, and even sexy, in his own weird way. As I continued with the series, I grew stronger feelings for him. Stronger annoyance at his bouts of meanness, stronger understanding of why he did what he did, and finally, in the last book, a stronger love and respect of his character. The first time I read Sorcerer's Stone, I was so confused! Did he hate Harry or didn't he? Was he trying to kill Harry or save him? This is what I love most about Snape. The inner machinations of his mind are an enigma (if you know where that line is from, go buy yourself an ice cream). <br /><br />Then we have Hagrid: the sweetest, cutest giant of them all. I love his adorable accent, his love of deadly animals, and how much of a great father figure he is for Harry, Ron, and Hermione. I think his ludicrous belief that deadly creatures are actually harmless stems from his own personal experience. At first Hagrid seems threatening and hostile because of his size and wild appearance, when really he is a huge sweetheart. In this way, he feels he can relate to the dangerous creatures that he loves. Except the majority of these creatures don't turn out to be sweethearts like Hagrid.<br /><br />As for the Dursleys, I cannot deal with them. I despise these people. Can't stand them for the life of me. Somehow, I almost find myself hating them more than I hate Voldemort, especially Petunia. God damn it woman, this kid is your BLOOD relative. He is your sister's son, and you treat him like a prisoner. You wouldn't even treat strangers that way! As much as I despised this family, I found them funny as well, particularly Vernon's angry explosions. <br /><br />And last, but most certainly not least, there is Albus Dumbledore. I love him for his cute craziness, as well as his wisdom. I've never seen a better combination of the two. He is a wonderful father figure for Harry. Still, the mystery surrounding him frustrates me. What did he see in the Mirror of Erised, dammit?! The world will never know.<br /><br />All in all, this series remains my favorite of all time. Thank you, JK Rowling, for all you've done for me and for millions of other people all over the world.</span>  <a data-text-id="17949925774248634171" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review413207969">  <td  </div>    <div class="ListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews ListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1657325017" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1657325017" />    <a title="Ahmed Ejaz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/53694260-ahmed-ejaz"><img alt="Ahmed Ejaz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475866746p2/53694260.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1657325017?book_show_action=false">Sep 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Ahmed Ejaz" class="user" name="Ahmed Ejaz" href="/user/show/53694260-ahmed-ejaz">Ahmed Ejaz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/53694260-ahmed-ejaz?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/53694260-ahmed-ejaz?shelf=recommendations">recommendations</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/53694260-ahmed-ejaz?shelf=01_best-books">01_best-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/53694260-ahmed-ejaz?shelf=children">children</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1657325017" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6959298909327962444"><b>"Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself."</b><br />Very true, isn't it?<br /><br />My words while reading: stunning, terrific... (<i>can't stop myself from praising this book</i>)<br />One of the best books ever! My emotions are still in the influence of this book's ending. What a great book and the ending it was!<br /><br /><b>SETTINGS </b><br />--- Hogwart School of Witchcraft and Wizardry<br />One of the finest school for wizards and witches to learn magic. I liked it very much. It is very well written.<br /><br /><b>MAJOR CHARACTERS</b><br /><br /><b>Harry Potter</b>, <i>of course!</i><br /><b>Bio</b></span>  <span id="freeText6959298909327962444" style="display:none"><b>"Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself."</b><br />Very true, isn't it?<br /><br />My words while reading: stunning, terrific... (<i>can't stop myself from praising this book</i>)<br />One of the best books ever! My emotions are still in the influence of this book's ending. What a great book and the ending it was!<br /><br /><b>SETTINGS </b><br />--- Hogwart School of Witchcraft and Wizardry<br />One of the finest school for wizards and witches to learn magic. I liked it very much. It is very well written.<br /><br /><b>MAJOR CHARACTERS</b><br /><br /><b>Harry Potter</b>, <i>of course!</i><br /><b>Bio </b><br />--- An orphan child. He lives with his uncle and aunt (<i>I didn't like them as they were so rude with Harry</i>), who don't tell him he is a WIZARD! Even though they knew it.<br /><b>My Feelings</b><br />--- A very appealing and effective character. I liked him very much.<br />One thing I didn't like about him: <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ I was expecting some more magic from him but he didn't do more then once or twice, as much as I remember.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><b>Ron</b><br /><b>Bio</b><br />--- One of Harry's best friends.<br /><b>My Feelings</b><br />--- A good one. I also liked him almost as much as I liked Harry. <br /><br /><b>Hermione</b><br />Bio<br />--- Also one of Harry's best friends. She has a very brilliant mind. <br /><b>My Feelings</b><br />--- Actually, I didn't get any feelings while reading her. I don't know why? Although she is very well written. But I liked her dialogues with Ron. That's sort of...HUMOROUS.<br /><br /><b>Voldemort</b><br /><b>Bio</b><br />--- A bad wizard. Main antagonist of this series, I assume and the killer of Harry's parents. He also tried to kill Harry but couldn't and He vanishes after that and nobody knows where he is?<br /><b>My Feelings</b><br />--- He seems a powerful antagonist I will ever read. he didn't appear much. This book just gives us the introduction of his existence. But I am sure I will enjoy reading him in the next books.<br /><br />Albus Dumbledore(Headmaster of Hogwarts) and Hagrid(Keeper of Hogwarts). Both of them seem nice persons to me.<br /><br /><br /><b>OVERVIEW</b><br />Harry finds out he is a wizard when Hagrid gives him the letter from Hogwarts for admission. Harry's life changes completely while studying in Hogwarts when they(<i>Harry, Ron and Hermione</i>) run across the forbidden section of the 3rd floor of Hogwarts. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ There is a stone named Sorcerer's Stone which can extend your life and transform any material into gold. This stone is hidden in that section of the 3rd floor and a dog(who is very big in size and have three heads), and many enchantments are guarding it. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><u>A very big spoiler</u>: <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Voldemort is after this stone because he becomes too week after killing trying to kill harry. If he gets the Stone he will become powerful, again. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><br /><b>THINGS I LIKED</b><br />Everything! from beginning to ending except for one minor thing (<i>see next section</i>).<br /><br /><b>Quidditch</b><br />I liked this sport a lot. When I came to know about it I thought "Author will skip this and announce the winner" BUT author wrote this sport in such a brilliant way that I want more on this sport. There is a book on this and I will read that book soon.<br /><br /><b>Last Chapter</b><br />Just one line: "Anyone can betray anyone."<br /><br />This book contains a good deal of very entertaining scenes. I liked the imagination of author.<br /><br /><br /><b>THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE</b> (<i>not that much</i>)<br /><br /><b>Nicolas Flamel's Intoduction</b><br />This book took little long time to introduce Nicolas (<i>friend of Dumbledore and <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[the maker of Sorcerer's Stone <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></i>), 2 chapters (<i>arround 30 pages</i>). I couldn't like it much because Harry was wondering he had heard/read that name before but he didn't remember it right now. I can understand. BUT 2 CHAPTERS! Seriously! Even though we knew where Harry had read that name. In the train when he was coming to Hogwarts. It didn't look good to me or I couldn't find any fair reason to make this topic that long.I didn't completely hate that fact. I liked it but not that much I liked the whole things in the book.<br /><br /><br /><b>RECOMMENDATION</b><br />Everyone should read it regardless of their tastes, I mean, favourite genre. I don't think there would be a person on this planet (<i>silly thing to say</i>) who would dare to hate this book. I have become a very big fan of this series. It is not a surprise who wouldn't be. I highly recommend this book to those who hasn't started reading. This book would be a great start for them.<br /><br /><br /><b>CONCLUSION</b><br />I must say author has done a good deal of hard work. She wrote every scene in such a way that there would be no need of any visual form of this. I could visualize every scene of this book very easily while reading. I didn't thought I would read this type of writing style after Rick Riordan's. She is on second position in my list of Author's-Writing-Style. SORRY! I can't replace Rick Riordan's style with anybody's. I liked his style more than anybody's. I am really looking forward to read Parcy Jackson series BUT you know, 2 series of 10 books (<i>5 in each</i>) is more than enough books for me to read right now. BUT Sooner or later I will read that series too.<br /><br />According to fact I mentioned above, I would like to give:<br /><b>**** 5 Lifelong Shinning Stars ****</b><br /><br /><b>Point out my mistakes and my misunderstanding about this book if there are any. I would be happy to see that!</b><br /><br /><i>Thanks for your attention!</i><br /><br /><br /><b>QUOTES I LIKED</b><br />"He didn't know what was going to - but it had to be better than what he was leaving."<br /><br />"...hard work and pain are the best teachers..."<br /><br />"Petrificus Totalus!"<br /><br />"It was one of those occasions when the true story is even more and exciting than the wild rumors."<br /><br />"...you couldn't have everything in life."<br /><br />"'The truth' Dumbledore sighed. 'It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution."</span>  <a data-text-id="6959298909327962444" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1657325017">  <td stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1783293758" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15746371029779028200">Just wanted to spend two words on this <b>piece of art</b> before starting Chamber of Secrets illustrated that I just received *screams*<br /><br />This book for me will be forever <i>sacred</i>. It's the very first book that I read 100% without the help of anybody, I was like 7/8 and I fell in love with the Wizarding World immediately.<br />Of course I didn't get everything at that time because I was probably too young to understand certain things and the book really <b>touches very important themes</b> that you can't actually under</span>  <span id="freeText15746371029779028200" style="display:none">Just wanted to spend two words on this <b>piece of art</b> before starting Chamber of Secrets illustrated that I just received *screams*<br /><br />This book for me will be forever <i>sacred</i>. It's the very first book that I read 100% without the help of anybody, I was like 7/8 and I fell in love with the Wizarding World immediately.<br />Of course I didn't get everything at that time because I was probably too young to understand certain things and the book really <b>touches very important themes</b> that you can't actually understand when you are only 7. <br /><br />I re-read it at least 5/6 times and <b>growing up I found it every time more entertaining and meaningful</b>. <i>The world is amazing, the characters are amazing (every single one), the story is amazing</i>, everything is amazing xD<br /><br />I think almost everyone knows the story... So no plot/summary from me haha<br />This series is and will ever be a HUGE part of my life and everything started with this particular book.<br /><br />Last but not least: <b>The illustrated edition</b>, which <b>is stunning</b>! The pictures are just eye candy, I like how it's written in columns and the full page illustrations are everything awww ** <br /><i>(The illustration of Quirrell is pretty disturbing and I LOVE IT xD)</i><br /><br /><i>Sorry if it was a little messy, it's probably not even a review lol but I wanted to share a little piece of myself with you :')</i></span>  <a data-text-id="15746371029779028200" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1388694025p2/3344685.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1372638695?book_show_action=false">Nov 03, 2015</a>      <a title="Sarah" class="user" name="Sarah" href="/user/show/3344685-sarah">Sarah</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408845646" href="/book/show/24548235-harry-potter-and-the-philosopher-s-stone">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=books-i-own-print">books-i-own-print</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=british-author">british-author</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3344685-sarah?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1372638695" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2767526955082208559">Yes, I realise I already own two copies of this book BUT this one is <i>illustrated</i> - that makes all the difference surely? It can't possibly be wrong to buy a book that looks this beautiful can it?<br><br>As soon as I saw images of <b>Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone: Illustrated Edition</b> I knew I had to have it, as a huge fan of the series and someone who already owns several print versions as well as the ebook of each Harry Potter story there was no way I could miss out on this beautiful new edition</span>  <span id="freeText2767526955082208559" style="display:none">Yes, I realise I already own two copies of this book BUT this one is <i>illustrated</i> - that makes all the difference surely? It can't possibly be wrong to buy a book that looks this beautiful can it?<br><br>As soon as I saw images of <b>Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone: Illustrated Edition</b> I knew I had to have it, as a huge fan of the series and someone who already owns several print versions as well as the ebook of each Harry Potter story there was no way I could miss out on this beautiful new edition. There is absolutely no point in me writing another review of the story (you can read my original one <a href="http://www.feelingfictional.com/2011/09/review-harry-potter-and-philosophers.html" rel="nofollow">HERE</a>) because I'm pretty sure that most of the people who are going to be looking at buying this book are already going to be Harry Potter fans so instead I'm going to focus on the quality of the book and the illustrations.<br><br>To put it simply this book is STUNNING. I had high expectations but was totally blown away by how beautiful this book is, it brings back the magical feeling of reading Harry Potter for the first time and I think it's definitely a perfect edition to read with children. <b>Jim Kay</b> has done a fantastic job of giving new life to the characters, he's managed to make them his own (which must have been quite hard to do considering how well everyone knows the actors from the movies) while still making them instantly recognisable.<br><br>The book itself is a lot larger than I expected and has me wondering if they'll have to publish the later books in more than one edition. The quality is brilliant with lovely glossy pages and gorgeous illustrated end pages. This is the kind of book that you want to treasure and it would make a perfect gift for any Harry Potter fan. I can't wait to see the illustrated editions of the rest of the series and will definitely be purchasing them as soon as they're published.<br><br>I'm going to finish this review with a couple of pictures so you can see just how beautiful some of the illustrations are:<br><br><br><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Nho-6QC2PJg/ViQsThLI7iI/AAAAAAAAMrY/crMO6VVUce4/s1600/HP+Illustrated+Harry.jpg" rel="nofollow">          <img height="400" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445211765i/16615269.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a>          <br><b>Harry in the cupboard under the stairs</b>          <br><br><br><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5LqHFiMKbWI/ViQsT7iv08I/AAAAAAAAMrg/-Zsd3OByT-Q/s1600/HP+Illustrated+Owl.jpg" rel="nofollow">          <img height="400" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445211765i/16615270.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a>          <br><b>An owl delivery</b>          <br><br><br><a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MLPJQi_b_zQ/ViQsYu-0GLI/AAAAAAAAMrw/VjQEH276Evg/s1600/HP+Illustrated+Sorting+Hat.JPG" rel="nofollow">          <img height="400" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445211765i/16615271.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a>          <br><b>The Sorting Hat</b>          <br><br><br><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t59zmqZPh_U/ViQsT-a1VAI/AAAAAAAAMrc/QmM-lr1maoQ/s1600/HP+Illustrated+Final+End+Pages.jpg" rel="nofollow">          <img height="400" src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1445211765i/16615272.jpg" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a>          <br><b>Beautiful end pages</b>          <br></span>  <a data-text-id="2767526955082208559" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1372638695'><a id="like_count_review_1372638695" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1372638695?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">17 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1372638695" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1372638695"
