itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1580627511" />    <a title="Lubna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21870106-lubna"><img alt="Lubna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461505068p2/21870106.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1580627511?book_show_action=false">Mar 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Lubna" class="user" name="Lubna" href="/user/show/21870106-lubna">Lubna</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1580627511" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18120588904220374130">Okay so I think I'm the only person standing on this earth who has not read the Harry Potter series yet, and here, this is my first ever book for J K Rowling. <br /><br />I have watched the movies so many times, however. I can quote the movies actually, and I am very glad that for this book, the movie follows exactly everything in details. The book isn't relatively long anyway, not many fillers were there, it was a sequence of ongoing adventures, which by the way was the best part about it. But anyway I bel</span>  <span id="freeText18120588904220374130" style="display:none">Okay so I think I'm the only person standing on this earth who has not read the Harry Potter series yet, and here, this is my first ever book for J K Rowling. <br /><br />I have watched the movies so many times, however. I can quote the movies actually, and I am very glad that for this book, the movie follows exactly everything in details. The book isn't relatively long anyway, not many fillers were there, it was a sequence of ongoing adventures, which by the way was the best part about it. But anyway I believe that contributed to the fact that the storyline isn't altered all that much in the movie. <br /><br />After failing at picking a good story book to read for what feels like forever, I have picked this up because I know you can never go wrong with HP, and that could be the truest thing I have said in my life. And though I knew the story, I was still very thrilled reading through the pages of the book. <br /><br />To say this is a page turner is an understatement, I enjoyed everything about it. The writing however sounded a bit middle grade, but I am so excited to see the character development along the series, as well as how she, Ms. Rowling, grew as a writer (mind you, not that there was anything wrong with this one) <br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="18120588904220374130" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> Thank you for a world I could quietly sneak onto the Hogwarts Express and simply <i>  <b>be</b></i> there.  </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer914602602" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6414244365993193282"><b> First reread (2nd time reading overall) 28/10/14 - 30/10/14 </b><br>Do I really need to write a review? Harry Potter will forever and always be my favourite series. I literally cannot think of any series that could come close. Every single page is just perfection. I have not one bad thing to say about the entire series. I cannot wait to reread the rest in this series.<br><br><b> Second reread (3rd time reading overall) 5/08/15 - 6/08/15 </b><br>Ugh. Once again, just perfect. Second time reading this in less than a year.</span>  <span id="freeText6414244365993193282" style="display:none"><b> First reread (2nd time reading overall) 28/10/14 - 30/10/14 </b><br>Do I really need to write a review? Harry Potter will forever and always be my favourite series. I literally cannot think of any series that could come close. Every single page is just perfection. I have not one bad thing to say about the entire series. I cannot wait to reread the rest in this series.<br><br><b> Second reread (3rd time reading overall) 5/08/15 - 6/08/15 </b><br>Ugh. Once again, just perfect. Second time reading this in less than a year. No regrets. <br>Harry Potter is perfection.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1438956952ra/15774571.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a
